  9169                                  ;*		selected aux port ([auxnum])				*
  9170                                  ;*									*
  9171                                  ;************************************************************************
  9172                                  
  9173                                  getbx:	
  9174 00000384 8B1E[2100]              		mov	bx, [auxnum]	; return bx -> single byte input buffer
  9175                                  					; for selected aux port	([auxnum])
  9176                                  		;add	bx, offset auxbuf
  9177 00000388 81C3[1600]              		add	bx, auxbuf	; 19/10/2022
  9178                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9179                                  		; cf=0 (if [uaxnum] is valid number) 
  9180 0000038C C3                      		retn
  9181                                  
  9182                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9183                                  
  9184                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9185                                  
  9186                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------
  9187                                  ;								:
  9188                                  ;		    clock device driver 			:
  9189                                  ;								:
  9190                                  ;								:
  9191                                  ;   this file contains the clock device driver. 		:
  9192                                  ;								:
  9193                                  ;   the routines in this files are:				:
  9194                                  ;								:
  9195                                  ;	routine 		function			:
  9196                                  ;	------- 		--------			:
  9197                                  ;	tim_writ		set the current time		:
  9198                                  ;	tim_read		read the current time		:
  9199                                  ;	time_to_ticks		convert time to corresponding	:
  9200                                  ;				  number of clock ticks 	:
  9201                                  ;								:
  9202                                  ; the clock ticks at the rate of:				:
  9203                                  ;								:
  9204                                  ;	1193180/65536 ticks/second (about 18.2 ticks per second):
  9205                                  ; see each routine for information on the use.			:
  9206                                  ;								:
  9207                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------
  9208                                  
  9209                                  ; convert time to ticks
  9210                                  ; input : time in cx and dx
  9211                                  ; ticks returned in cx:dx
  9212                                  
  9213                                  ;19/07/2019
  9214                                  ;09/03/2019
  9215                                  
  9216                                  time_to_ticks:				; 0070h:2906h =	02C7h:0396h
  9217                                  
  9218                                  ; first convert from hour,min,sec,hund. to
  9219                                  ; total number of 100th of seconds
  9220                                  
  9221 0000038D B03C                    		mov	al, 60
  9222 0000038F F6E5                    		mul	ch		; hours	to minutes
  9223 00000391 B500                    		mov	ch, 0
  9224 00000393 01C8                    		add	ax, cx		; total	minutes
  9225 00000395 B97017                  		mov	cx, 6000	; 60*100
  9226 00000398 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; get out of the way of	the multiply
  9227 0000039A F7E1                    		mul	cx		; convert to 1/100 sec
  9228 0000039C 89C1                    		mov	cx, ax
  9229 0000039E B064                    		mov	al, 100
  9230 000003A0 F6E7                    		mul	bh		; convert seconds to 1/100 sec
  9231 000003A2 01C1                    		add	cx, ax		; combine seconds with hours and min
  9232 000003A4 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0		; ripple carry
  9233 000003A7 B700                    		mov	bh, 0
  9234 000003A9 01D9                    		add	cx, bx		; combine 1/100	sec
  9235 000003AB 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  9236                                  
  9237                                  	; dx:cx is time in 1/100 sec
  9238                                  
  9239 000003AE 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
  9240 000003AF 91                      		xchg	ax, cx		; now time is in cx:ax
  9241 000003B0 BB0BE9                  		mov	bx, 59659
  9242 000003B3 F7E3                    		mul	bx		; multiply low half
  9243 000003B5 87D1                    		xchg	dx, cx
  9244 000003B7 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; cx->ax, ax->dx, dx->cx
  9245 000003B8 F7E3                    		mul	bx		; multiply high	half
  9246 000003BA 01C8                    		add	ax, cx		; combine overlapping products
  9247 000003BC 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  9248 000003BF 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; ax:dx=time*59659
  9249 000003C0 BB0500                  		mov	bx, 5
  9250 000003C3 F6F3                    		div	bl		; divide high half by 5
  9251 000003C5 88C1                    		mov	cl, al
  9252 000003C7 B500                    		mov	ch, 0
  9253 000003C9 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; remainder of divide-by-5
  9254 000003CB 98                      		cbw
  9255 000003CC 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; use it to extend low half
  9256 000003CD F7F3                    		div	bx		; divide low half by 5
  9257 000003CF 89C2                    		mov	dx, ax		; cx:dx	is now number of ticks in time
  9258 000003D1 CB                      		retf			; far return
  9259                                  
  9260                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9261                                  
  9262                                  ; 17/10/2022
  9263                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9264                                  
  9265                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
  9266                                  ;
  9267                                  ; tim_writ sets the current time
  9268                                  ;
  9269                                  ; on entry es:[di] has the current time:
  9270                                  ;
  9271                                  ;	number of days since 1-1-80	(word)
  9272                                  ;	minutes (0-59)			(byte)
  9273                                  ;	hours (0-23)			(byte)
  9274                                  ;	hundredths of seconds (0-99)	(byte)
  9275                                  ;	seconds (0-59)			(byte)
  9276                                  ;
  9277                                  ; each number has been checked for the correct range.
  9278                                  ;
  9279                                  ;	NOTE: Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
  9280                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
  9281                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
  9282                                  ;
  9283                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
  9284                                  
  9285                                  	; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  9286                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:03EAh
  9287                                  tim_writ:				; 2C7h:3DBh = 70h:294Bh
  9288 000003D2 268B05                  		mov	ax, [es:di]
  9289 000003D5 50                      		push	ax		; daycnt. we need to set this at the very
  9290                                  					; end to avoid tick windows.
  9291 000003D6 803E[F304]00            		cmp	byte [havecmosclock], 0
  9292                                  		;cmp	ds:havecmosclock, 0
  9293 000003DB 7423                    		jz	short no_cmos_1
  9294 000003DD 268A4503                		mov	al, [es:di+3]	; near indirect	calls
  9295                                  					; get binary hours
  9296                                  					; convert to bcd
  9297                                  		;call	far [bintobcd]
  9298                                  		;;call	ds:bintobcd	; call far [bintobcd]
  9299                                  		; 08/08/2023
  9300 000003E1 E8E800                  		call	bintobcd
  9301 000003E4 88C5                    		mov	ch, al		; ch = bcd hours
  9302 000003E6 268A4502                		mov	al, [es:di+2]	; get binary minutes
  9303                                  		;call	far [bintobcd]
  9304                                  		;;call	ds:bintobcd	; convert to bcd
  9305 000003EA E8DF00                  		call	bintobcd
  9306 000003ED 88C1                    		mov	cl, al		; cl = bcd minutes
  9307 000003EF 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; get binary seconds
  9308                                  		;call	far [bintobcd]
  9309                                  		;;call	ds:bintobcd
  9310 000003F3 E8D600                  		call	bintobcd
  9311                                  
  9312 000003F6 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; dh = bcd seconds
  9313 000003F8 B200                    		mov	dl, 0		; dl = 0 (st) or 1 (dst)
  9314 000003FA FA                      		cli
  9315 000003FB B403                    		mov	ah, 3
  9316 000003FD CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET REAL TIME	CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  9317                                  					; CH = hours in	BCD, CL	= minutes in BCD
  9318                                  					;  DH =	seconds	in BCD,DL = 01h	if daylight savings, 00h if standard time
  9319                                  					; Return: CMOS clock set
  9320 000003FF FB                      		sti
  9321                                  no_cmos_1:				
  9322 00000400 268B4D02                		mov	cx, [es:di+2]
  9323 00000404 268B5504                		mov	dx, [es:di+4]
  9324                                  		; 17/10/2022
  9325 00000408 FF1E[C106]              		call	far [ttticks]
  9326                                  		;call	dword ptr ds:ttticks ; call far	[ttticks]
  9327                                  					; convert time to ticks
  9328                                  					; cx:dx	now has	time in	ticks
  9329 0000040C FA                      		cli			; turn off timer
  9330 0000040D B401                    		mov	ah, 1
  9331 0000040F CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET TIME OF DAY
  9332                                  					; CX:DX	= clock	count
  9333                                  					; Return: time of day set
  9334                                  		;pop	ds:daycnt
  9335 00000411 8F06[F004]              		pop	word [daycnt]
  9336 00000415 FB                      		sti
  9337                                  		;cmp	ds:havecmosclock, 0
  9338 00000416 803E[F304]00            		cmp	byte [havecmosclock], 0
  9339 0000041B 7409                    		jz	short no_cmos_2
  9340                                  
  9341                                  		; 08/08/2023
  9342                                  		;call	far [daycnttoday]
  9343                                  		;;call	ds:daycnttoday	; call far [daycnttoday]
  9344                                  					; convert to bcd format
  9345 0000041D E80700                  		call	daycnttoday
  9346                                  
  9347 00000420 FA                      		cli
  9348 00000421 B405                    		mov	ah, 5
  9349 00000423 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET DATE IN REAL TIME	CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  9350                                  					; DL = day in BCD, DH =	month in BCD, CL = year	in BCD
  9351                                  					; CH = century (19h or 20h)
  9352                                  					; Return: CMOS clock set
  9353 00000425 FB                      		sti
  9354                                  no_cmos_2:
  9355                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9356                                  		; cf=0
  9357                                  		;clc
  9358 00000426 C3                      		retn
  9359                                  
  9360                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9361                                  
  9362                                  ; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  9363                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:0440h
  9364                                  %if 1 
  9365                                  
  9366                                  ; CMOS Clock setting support routines used by MSCLOCK.
  9367                                  ; Warning!!! This code will be dynamically relocated by MSINIT.
  9368                                  
  9369                                  daycnttoday:	; proc near
  9370                                  
  9371                                  ; entry: [daycnt] = number of days since 1-1-80
  9372                                  ;
  9373                                  ; return: ch - century in bcd
  9374                                  ;	  cl - year in bcd
  9375                                  ;	  dh - month in bcd
  9376                                  ;	  dl - day in bcd
  9377                                  
  9378                                  		; 08/08/2023 (ds:) (near proc)
  9379                                  		; 16/10/2022 (cs:) (far proc)		
  9380 00000427 FF36[F004]              		push	word [daycnt] ; save daycnt
  9381 0000042B 813E[F004]891C          		cmp	word [daycnt], 7305 ; (365*20+(20/4))
  9382                                  					; # days from 1-1-1980 to 1-1-2000
  9383 00000431 7308                    		jnb	short century20
  9384                                  		;mov	byte [base_century], 19
  9385                                  		;mov	byte [base_year], 80
  9386                                  		; 08/08/2023
  9387 00000433 C706[F404]1350          		mov	word [base_century], 5013h
  9388 00000439 EB0C                    		jmp	short years
  9389                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9390                                  		
  9391                                  century20:				
  9392                                  		;mov	byte [base_century], 20
  9393                                  		;mov	byte [base_year], 0
  9394                                  		; 08/08/2023
  9395 0000043B C706[F404]1400          		mov	word [base_century], 20
  9396 00000441 812E[F004]891C          		sub	word [daycnt], 7305 ; (365*20+(20/4))
  9397                                  					; adjust daycnt
  9398                                  years:					
  9399 00000447 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  9400 00000449 A1[F004]                		mov	ax, [daycnt]
  9401 0000044C BBB505                  		mov	bx, 1461	; (366+365*3)
  9402                                  					; # of days in a Leap year block
  9403 0000044F F7F3                    		div	bx		; AX = # of leap block,	DX = daycnt
  9404 00000451 8916[F004]              		mov	[daycnt], dx	; save daycnt left
  9405 00000455 B304                    		mov	bl, 4
  9406 00000457 F6E3                    		mul	bl		; AX = # of years. Less	than 100
  9407 00000459 0006[F504]              		add	[base_year], al ; So, ah = 0. Adjust year
  9408 0000045D FF06[F004]              		inc	word [daycnt]	; set daycnt to	1 base
  9409                                  		; 08/08/2023
  9410 00000461 BB6E01                  		mov	bx, 366
  9411 00000464 B90300                  		mov	cx, 3
  9412                                  		;cmp	word [daycnt], 366 ; daycnt=remainder of leap year
  9413 00000467 391E[F004]              		cmp	[daycnt], bx ; 366
  9414 0000046B 7619                    		jbe	short leapyear	; within 366+355+355+355 days.
  9415 0000046D FE06[F504]              		inc	byte [base_year] ; if daycnt <= 366, then leap year
  9416                                  		;sub	word [daycnt], 366 ; else daycnt--, base_year++ ;
  9417 00000471 291E[F004]              		sub	[daycnt], bx ; 366 ; 08/08/2023
  9418                                  		;mov	cx, 3		; And next three years are normal
  9419                                  regularyear:	
  9420                                  		; 08/08/2023
  9421 00000475 4B                      		dec	bx ; 365			
  9422                                  		;cmp	word [daycnt], 365 ; for(i=1; i>3 or daycnt <=365; i++)
  9423 00000476 391E[F004]              		cmp	[daycnt], bx ; 365 ; 08/08/2023
  9424 0000047A 760F                    		jbe	short yeardone	; {if (daycnt >	365)
  9425 0000047C FE06[F504]              		inc	byte [base_year] ; { daycnt -=	365
  9426                                  		;sub	word [daycnt], 365 ; }
  9427 00000480 291E[F004]              		sub	[daycnt], bx ; 365 ; 08/08/2023 
  9428 00000484 E2EF                    		loop	regularyear	; }
  9429                                  					;
  9430                                  					; should never fall through loop
  9431                                  leapyear:	
  9432 00000486 C606[F704]1D            		mov	byte [february], 29 ; 08/08/2023			
  9433                                  		;mov	byte [month_tab+1], 29 ; leap year.
  9434                                  					; change month table.
  9435                                  yeardone:				
  9436 0000048B 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx
  9437 0000048D 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  9438 0000048F A1[F004]                		mov	ax, [daycnt]
  9439                                  		;mov	si, offset month_tab
  9440 00000492 BE[F604]                		mov	si, month_tab	; 19/10/2022
  9441                                  		;mov	cx, 12
  9442                                  		; 08/08/2023
  9443 00000495 B10C                    		mov	cl, 12
  9444                                  months:					
  9445 00000497 FEC3                    		inc	bl
  9446                                  		; 08/08/2023
  9447 00000499 8A14                    		mov	dl, [si]	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:04B7h
  9448 0000049B 39D0                    		cmp	ax, dx		; cmp daycnt for each month till fit
  9449                                  					; dh=0
  9450 0000049D 7605                    		jbe	short month_done
  9451 0000049F 46                      		inc	si		; next month
  9452 000004A0 29D0                    		sub	ax, dx		; adjust daycnt
  9453 000004A2 E2F3                    		loop	months		;
  9454                                  					; should never fall through loop
  9455                                  month_done:	
  9456 000004A4 C606[F704]1C            		mov	byte [february], 28 ; 08/08/2023
  9457                                  		;mov	byte [month_tab+1], 28
  9458                                  					; restore month table value
  9459 000004A9 88DA                    		mov	dl, bl
  9460 000004AB 8A36[F504]              		mov	dh, [base_year]
  9461 000004AF 8A0E[F404]              		mov	cl, [base_century] ; al=day,dl=month,dh=year,cl=cntry
  9462 000004B3 E81600                  		call	bintobcd	; convert "day"	to bcd
  9463                                  					; dl = bcd day,	al = month
  9464 000004B6 86D0                    		xchg	dl, al
  9465 000004B8 E81100                  		call	bintobcd	; dh = bcd month, al = year
  9466 000004BB 86F0                    		xchg	dh, al
  9467 000004BD E80C00                  		call	bintobcd	; cl = bcd year, al = century
  9468 000004C0 86C8                    		xchg	cl, al
  9469 000004C2 E80700                  		call	bintobcd	; ch = bcd century
  9470 000004C5 88C5                    		mov	ch, al
  9471 000004C7 8F06[F004]              		pop	word [daycnt] ; restore original value
  9472 000004CB C3                      		retn
  9473                                  
  9474                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9475                                  
  9476                                  bintobcd:	; proc near		; real time clock support
  9477                                  
  9478                                  ;convert a binary input in al (less than 63h or 99 decimal)
  9479                                  ;into a bcd value in al. ah destroyed.	
  9480                                  		
  9481 000004CC D40A                    		aam			; AH = AL/10, AL = AL MOD 10
  9482 000004CE D510                    		aad     10h             ; db 0D5h,10h
  9483                                  					; AL = (AH*10H)+AL, AH = 0
  9484 000004D0 C3                      		retn
  9485                                  %endif
  9486                                  
  9487                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9488                                  
  9489                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9490                                  
  9491                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9492                                  ; gettime reads date and time
  9493                                  ; and returns the following information:
  9494                                  ;
  9495                                  ;	es:[di]  =count of days since 1-1-80
  9496                                  ;	es:[di+2]=hours
  9497                                  ;	es:[di+3]=minutes
  9498                                  ;	es:[di+4]=seconds
  9499                                  ;	es:[di+5]=hundredths of seconds
  9500                                  ;
  9501                                  ;	NOTE:  Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
  9502                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
  9503                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
  9504                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9505                                  
  9506                                  tim_read:				; 2C7h:435h = 70h:29A5h
  9507 000004D1 E84B00                  		call	GetTickCnt
  9508 000004D4 8B36[F004]              		mov	si, [daycnt]
  9509                                  
  9510                                  ; we now need to convert the time in tick to the time in 100th of
  9511                                  ; seconds. the relation between tick and seconds is:
  9512                                  ;
  9513                                  ;		 65,536 seconds
  9514                                  ;	       ----------------
  9515                                  ;		1,193,180 tick
  9516                                  ;
  9517                                  ; to get to 100th of second we need to multiply by 100. the equation is:
  9518                                  ;
  9519                                  ;	ticks from clock  * 65,536 * 100
  9520                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9521                                  ;		1,193,180
  9522                                  ;
  9523                                  ; fortunately this formula simplifies to:
  9524                                  ;
  9525                                  ;	ticks from clock * 5 * 65,536
  9526                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9527                                  ;		59,659
  9528                                  ;
  9529                                  ; the calculation is done by first multipling tick by 5. next we divide by
  9530                                  ; 59,659. in this division we multiply by 65,536 by shifting the dividend
  9531                                  ; my 16 bits to the left.
  9532                                  ;
  9533                                  ; start with ticks in cx:dx
  9534                                  ; multiply by 5
  9535                                  
  9536 000004D8 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
  9537 000004DA 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; start	with ticks in cx:dx
  9538                                  					; multiply by 5
  9539 000004DC D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9540 000004DE D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	2
  9541 000004E0 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9542 000004E2 D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	4
  9543 000004E4 01DA                    		add	dx, bx
  9544 000004E6 11C8                    		adc	ax, cx		; times	5
  9545 000004E8 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
  9546                                  
  9547                                  ; now have ticks * 5 in	dx:ax
  9548                                  ; we now need to multiply by 65536 and divide by 59659 d.
  9549                                  
  9550 000004E9 B90BE9                  		mov	cx, 59659	; get divisor
  9551 000004EC F7F1                    		div	cx		; dx now has remainder
  9552                                  					; ax has high word of final quotient
  9553                                  
  9554                                  		; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  9555                                  		;mov	bx, ax		; put high word	in safe	place
  9556 000004EE 93                      		xchg	bx, ax
  9557 000004EF 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; this is the multiply by 65536
  9558 000004F1 F7F1                    		div	cx		; bx:ax	now has	time in	100th of seconds
  9559                                  
  9560                                  ; rounding based on the	remainder may be added here
  9561                                  ; the result in	bx:ax is time in 1/100 second.
  9562                                  
  9563 000004F3 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		
  9564 000004F5 B9C800                  		mov	cx, 200		; extract 1/100's
  9565                                  
  9566                                  ; division by 200 is necessary to ensure no overflow--max result
  9567                                  ; is number of seconds in a day/2 = 43200.
  9568                                  
  9569 000004F8 F7F1                    		div	cx
  9570 000004FA 80FA64                  		cmp	dl, 100		; remainder over 100?
  9571 000004FD 7203                    		jb	short noadj
  9572 000004FF 80EA64                  		sub	dl, 100		; keep 1/100's less than 100
  9573                                  noadj:					
  9574 00000502 F5                      		cmc			; if we	subtracted 100,	carry is now set
  9575 00000503 88D3                    		mov	bl, dl		; save 1/100's
  9576                                  
  9577                                  ; to compensate	for dividing by	200 instead of 100, we now multiply
  9578                                  ; by two, shifting a one in if the remainder had exceeded 100.
  9579                                  
  9580 00000505 D1D0                    		rcl	ax, 1		
  9581 00000507 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  9582 00000509 D1D2                    		rcl	dx, 1
  9583 0000050B B93C00                  		mov	cx, 60		; divide out seconds
  9584 0000050E F7F1                    		div	cx
  9585 00000510 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; save the seconds
  9586 00000512 F6F1                    		div	cl		; break	into hours and minutes
  9587 00000514 86C4                    		xchg	al, ah
  9588                                  
  9589                                  ; time is now in ax:bx (hours, minutes, seconds, 1/100 sec)
  9590                                  
  9591                                  		; 08/08/2023
  9592                                  		;push	ax
  9593                                  		;mov	ax, si		; daycnt
  9594 00000516 96                      		xchg	ax, si
  9595 00000517 AB                      		stosw
  9596                                  		;pop	ax
  9597 00000518 96                      		xchg	ax, si		; al = hours, ah = minutes
  9598 00000519 AB                      		stosw
  9599 0000051A 89D8                    		mov	ax, bx
  9600 0000051C AB                      		stosw
  9601 0000051D F8                      		clc			; [es:di] = count of days since 1-1-80
  9602                                  					;   [es:di+2] = hours
  9603                                  					;   [es:di+3] = minutes
  9604                                  					;   [es:di+4] = seconds
  9605                                  					;   [es:di+5] = hundredths of seconds
  9606 0000051E C3                      		retn
  9607                                  
  9608                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9609                                  
  9610                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9611                                  
  9612                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9613                                  ;
  9614                                  ; procedure : GetTickCnt
  9615                                  ;
  9616                                  ;		Returns the tick count in CX:DX. Takes care of DayCnt in case
  9617                                  ;		of rollover [except when power management driver is in use]. 
  9618                                  ;		Uses the following logic for updating Daycnt
  9619                                  ;
  9620                                  ;		if ( rollover ) {
  9621                                  ;			if ( t_switch )
  9622                                  ;				daycnt++ ;
  9623                                  ;			else
  9624                                  ;				daycnt += rollover ;
  9625                                  ;		}
  9626                                  ;
  9627                                  ; USES : AX
  9628                                  ;
  9629                                  ; RETURNS : CX:DX - tick count
  9630                                  ; MODIFIES : daycnt
  9631                                  ;
  9632                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9633                                  
  9634                                  		; 17/10/2022
  9635                                  GetTickCnt:	
  9636 0000051F 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
  9637 00000521 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- GET TIME OF DAY
  9638                                  					; Return: CX:DX	= clock	count
  9639                                  					; AL = 00h if clock was	read or	written	(via AH=0,1) since the previous
  9640                                  					; midnight
  9641                                  					; Otherwise, AL	> 0
  9642 00000523 803E[F204]00            		cmp	byte [t_switch], 0 ; use old method ? (>0 is yes)
  9643 00000528 7507                    		jnz	short inc_case	; old method assumes  that Int 1Ah returns rollover flag
  9644 0000052A 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; new method assumes that Int 1Ah returns roll over count
  9645                                  					; and not flag
  9646 0000052C 0106[F004]              		add	[daycnt], ax
  9647 00000530 C3                      		retn
  9648                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9649                                  
  9650                                  inc_case:				
  9651 00000531 08C0                    		or	al, al
  9652 00000533 7404                    		jz	short no_rollover
  9653 00000535 FF06[F004]              		inc	word [daycnt]
  9654                                  no_rollover:				
  9655 00000539 C3                      		retn
  9656

  9684                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9685                                  ;	disk interface routines
  9686                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9687                                  
  9688                                  ; device attribute bits:
  9689                                  ;	bit 6 - get/set map for logical drives and generic ioctl.
  9690                                  
  9691                                  ;MAXERR		equ	5
  9692                                  ;MAX_HD_FMT_ERR	equ	2
  9693                                  
  9694                                  ;LSTDRV	equ 504h
  9695                                  
  9696                                  ; some floppies do not have changeline. as a result, media-check would
  9697                                  ; normally return i-don't-know, the dos would continually reread the fat and
  9698                                  ; discard cached data. we optimize this by implementing a logical door-latch:
  9699                                  ; it is physically impossible to change a disk in under 2 seconds. we retain
  9700                                  ; the time of the last successful disk operation and compare it with the current
  9701                                  ; time during media-check. if < 2 seconds and at least 1 timer tick has passed,
  9702                                  ; the we say no change. if > 2 seconds then we say i-don't-know. finally, 
  9703                                  ; since we cannot trust the timer to be always available, we record the number 
  9704                                  ; of media checks that have occurred when no apparent time has elapsed. while
  9705                                  ; this number is < a given threshold, we say no change. when it exceeds that
  9706                                  ; threshold, we say i-don't-know and reset the counter to 0. when we store 
  9707                                  ; the time of last successful access, if we see that time has passed too,
  9708                                  ; we reset the counter.
  9709                                  
  9710                                  accessmax	equ	5
  9711                                  
  9712                                  ; due to various bogosities, we need to continually adjust what the head
  9713                                  ; settle time is.  the following algorithm is used:
  9714                                  ;
  9715                                  ;   get the current head settle value.
  9716                                  ;   if it is 0, then
  9717                                  ;	set slow = 15
  9718                                  ;   else
  9719                                  ;	set slow = value
  9720                                  ;   ...
  9721                                  ;*********************************************
  9722                                  ;************ old algorithm ******************
  9723                                  ;*   if we are seeking and writing then
  9724                                  ;*	 use slow
  9725                                  ;*   else
  9726                                  ;*	 use fast
  9727                                  ;*********************************************
  9728                                  ;*********** ibm's requested logic ***********
  9729                                  ;   if we are seeking and writing and not on an at then
  9730                                  ;	use slow
  9731                                  ;   else
  9732                                  ;	use fast
  9733                                  ;   ...
  9734                                  ;   restore current head settle value
  9735                                  ;
  9736                                  ;
  9737                                  ;---------------------------------------
  9738                                  multrk_on	equ	10000000b	;user spcified mutitrack=on, or system turns
  9739                                  					; it on after handling config.sys file as a
  9740                                  					; default value, if multrk_flag = multrk_off1.
  9741                                  multrk_off1	equ	00000000b	;initial value. no "multitrack=" command entered.
  9742                                  multrk_off2	equ	00000001b	;user specified multitrack=off.
  9743                                  
  9744                                  ; close data segment, open Bios_Code segment
  9745                                  
  9746                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9747                                  
  9748                                  ; BIOSCODE:04A2h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
  9749

  9751                                  ;	command jump table
  9752                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9753                                  
  9754 0000053A 00                      		db 0
  9755

  9757                                  %if 0
  9758

  9760                                  					; ((dtbl_siz-1)/2) ; this is the size of the table ; 26
  9761                                  		dw 1742h		; dsk_init

  9768                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear

  9772                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear

  9775                                  		dw 81Ah			; dsk_close

  9777                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9778                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9779                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9780                                  		dw 0C6Bh		; do_generic_ioctl
  9781                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9782                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear

  9793 0000053C [6117]                  		dw dsk_init

  9940                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9941                                  ; perform a check on the time passed since the last access for this physical
  9942                                  ; drive.
  9943                                  ; we are accessing the same drive. if the time of last successful access was
  9944                                  ; less than 2 seconds ago, then we may presume that the disk was not changed.
  9945                                  ; returns in si:
  9946                                  ;	0 - if time of last access was >= 2 seconds
  9947                                  ;	1 - if time was < 2 seconds (i.e no media change assumed)
  9948                                  ; registers affected ax,cx,dx, flags.
  9949                                  ;
  9950                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds->Bios_Data

  9953                                  		; 19/10/2022

  9956 000005F9 E823FF                  		call	GetTickCnt	; cx:dx	is the elapsed time
  9957 000005FC 268B4547                		mov	ax, [es:di+47h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_lo]
  9958                                  					; get stored time
  9959 00000600 29C2                    		sub	dx, ax
  9960 00000602 268B4549                		mov	ax, [es:di+49h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_hi]
  9961 00000606 19C1                    		sbb	cx, ax
  9962                                  		; 11/08/2023
  9963                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:0646h
  9964                                  		;mov	al, [accesscount]

  9966 0000060A 09D2                    		or	dx, dx		; time must pass

  9968                                  		; 11/08/2023

  9970                                  		;cmp	al, 5

  9972                                  		;;cmp	byte [accesscount], 5 
  9973                                  		;			; if count is less than threshold, ok
  9974                                  		;jb	short timecheck_ret
  9975                                  		;;dec	byte [accesscount] ; don't let the count wrap
  9976                                  		; 11/08/2023

  9978                                  		;jmp	short timecheck_unk ; "i don't know" if media changed
  9979                                  		; 11/08/2023

  9981 00000613 730A                    		jnb	short timecheck_unk

 10154                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10155                                  ;	getbp - return bpb from the drive specified by the bds.
 10156                                  ;	    if the return_fake_bpb flag is set, then it does nothing.
 10157                                  ;	    note that we never come here for fixed disks.
 10158                                  ;	    for all other cases,
 10159                                  ;	      - it reads boot sector to pull out the bpb
 10160                                  ;	      - if no valid bpb is found, it then reads the fat sector,
 10161                                  ;		to get the fat id byte to build the bpb from there.
 10162                                  ;
 10163                                  ;   inputs:	es:di point to correct bds.
 10164                                  ;
 10165                                  ;   outputs:	fills in bpb in current bds if valid bpb or fat id on disk.
 10166                                  ;		carry set, and al=7 if invalid disk.
 10167                                  ;		carry set and error code in al if other error.
 10168                                  ;		if failed to recognize the boot record, then will set the
 10169                                  ;		set_id_flag to 0.
 10170                                  ;		this routine will only work for a floppy diskette.
 10171                                  ;		     for a fixed disk, it will just return.
 10172                                  ;
 10173                                  ;	****** Note: getbp is a clone of getbp which uses the newer
 10174                                  ;	  segment definitions. It should be migrated towards.
 10175                                  ;	   now es:di has the bds, ds: has Bios_Data
 10176                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10177                                  
 10178                                  GetBp:		; if returning fake bpb then return bpb as is.
 10179                                  		;test	byte [es:di+BDS.flags], return_fake_bpb|fnon_removable

 10345                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10346                                  
 10347                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
 10348                                  ; read in the boot sector. set carry if error in reading sector.
 10349                                  ; bx is set to 1 if the boot sector is invalid, otherwise it is 0.
 10350                                  ;
 10351                                  ;	assumes es:di -> bds, ds-> Bios_Data
 10352                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
 10353                                  
 10354                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10355                                  
 10356                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 10357                                  ; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, BIOSCODE:06C3h)
 10358                                  
 10359                                  readbootsec:	
 10360 0000074F B600                    		mov	dh, 0		; head 0
 10361 00000751 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1		; cylinder 0, sector 1
 10362 00000754 E8BF00                  		call	read_sector
 10363 00000757 7243                    		jb	short err_ret
 10364 00000759 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; assume valid boot sector
 10365                                  
 10366                                  		; put a sanity check for the boot sector in here to detect
 10367                                  		; boot sectors that do not have valid bpbs. we examine the
 10368                                  		; first two bytes - they must contain a long jump (69h) or a
 10369                                  		; short jump (EBh) followed by a nop (90h), or a short jump
 10370                                  		; (E9h). if this test is passed, we further check by examining
 10371                                  		; the signature at the end of the boot sector for the word
 10372                                  		; AA55h. if the signature is not present, we examine the media
 10373                                  		; descriptor byte to see if it is valid. for dos 3.3, this
 10374                                  		; logic is modified a little bit. we are not going to check
 10375                                  		; signature. instead we are going to sanity check the media
 10376                                  		; byte in bpb regardless of the validity of signature. this is
 10377                                  		; to save the already developed commercial products that have
 10378                                  		; good jump instruction and signature but with the false bpb
 10379                                  		; informations
 10380                                  
 10381                                  ; that will crash the diskette drive operation. (for example, symphony diskette).
 10382                                  
 10383                                  		; 02/09/2023
 10384                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10385                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 69h ; is it a direct jump?
 10386                                  		;jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; don't need to find a nop
 10387                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 0E9h ; dos 2.0 jump?
 10388                                  		;jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; no need for	nop
 10389                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 0EBh ; how about a short jump?
 10390                                  		;jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10391                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
 10392                                  		;jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10393                                  
 10394                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 10395 0000075B A0[4E01]                		mov	al, [disksector]
 10396 0000075E 3C69                    		cmp	al, 69h		; is it a direct jump?
 10397 00000760 740F                    		je	short check_bpb_mediabyte
 10398                                  					; don't need to find a nop
 10399 00000762 3CE9                    		cmp	al, 0E9h	; dos 2.0 jump?
 10400 00000764 740B                    		je	short check_bpb_mediabyte
 10401                                  					; no need for nop
 10402 00000766 3CEB                    		cmp	al, 0EBh	; how about a short jump?
 10403 00000768 7530                    		jne	short invalidbootsec
 10404 0000076A 803E[5001]90            		cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
 10405 0000076F 7529                    		jne	short invalidbootsec
 10406                                  
 10407                                  ; 15/10/5022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10408                                  ;
 10409                                  ;; 10/03/2019
 10410                                  ;; (MSDOS 3.3, MSDISK.ASM, 1988)
 10411                                  ;;
 10412                                  ;; Don't have to perform the following signature check since
 10413                                  ;; we need to check the media byte even with the good signatured diskette.
 10414                                  ;;
 10415                                  ;;check_signature:
 10416                                  ;;		cmp	word [cs:disksector+1FEh],0AA55h ; see if non-ibm
 10417                                  ;;							 ; disk or 1.x media.
 10418                                  ;;		jz	short checksinglesided ; go see if singled sided medium.
 10419                                  ;;					       ; may need some special handling
 10420                                  
 10421                                  ; check for non-ibm disks which do not have the signature AA55h at the
 10422                                  ; end of the boot sector, but still have a valid boot sector. this is done
 10423                                  ; by examining the media descriptor in the boot sector.
 10424                                  
 10425                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10426                                  check_bpb_mediabyte:
 10427 00000771 A0[6301]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 10428                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 10429 00000774 50                      		push	ax ; 02/09/2023
 10430 00000775 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h
 10431 00000777 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; allow	for strange media
 10432 00000779 58                      		pop	ax ; 02/09/2023
 10433 0000077A 751E                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10434                                  
 10435                                  ; there were some (apparently a lot of them) diskettes that had been formatted
 10436                                  ; under dos 3.1 and earlier versions which have invalid bpbs in their boot
 10437                                  ; sectors. these are specifically diskettes that were formatted in drives
 10438                                  ; with one head, or whose side 0 was bad. these contain bpbs in the boot
 10439                                  ; sector that have the sec/clus field set to 2 instead of 1, as is standard
 10440                                  ; in dos. in order to support them, we have to introduce a "hack" that will
 10441                                  ; help our build bpb routine to recognise these specific cases, and to
 10442                                  ; set up out copy of the bpb accordingly.
 10443                                  ; we do this by checking to see if the boot sector is off a diskette that
 10444                                  ; is single-sided and is a pre-dos 3.20 diskette. if it is, we set the
 10445                                  ; sec/clus field to 1. if not, we carry on as normal.
 10446                                  
 10447                                  checksinglesided:
 10448                                  		;mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 10449                                  		; 02/09/2023
 10450                                  		; al = [disksector+15h]
 10451 0000077C 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h
 10452 0000077E 741B                    		jz	short gooddsk
 10453 00000780 A801                    		test	al, 1
 10454 00000782 7517                    		jnz	short gooddsk
 10455 00000784 813E[5601]332E          		cmp	word [disksector+8], 2E33h ; "3."
 10456 0000078A 7507                    		jnz	short mustbeearlier
 10457 0000078C 803E[5801]32            		cmp	byte [disksector+0Ah], 32h ; "2"
 10458 00000791 7308                    		jnb	short gooddsk
 10459                                  
 10460                                  ; we must have a pre-3.20 diskette. set the sec/clus field to 1
 10461                                  
 10462                                  mustbeearlier:				
 10463 00000793 C606[5B01]01            		mov	byte [disksector+0Dh], 1
 10464                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 10465 00000798 EB01                    		jmp	short gooddsk
 10466                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10467

 10484                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10485                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10486                                  ; 'movbpb' moves the bpb read from the boot sector into registers for use by
 10487                                  ; getbp routine at has1
 10488                                  ;
 10489                                  ; if the set_id_flag is 1, and if an extended boot record, then set volume
 10490                                  ; serial number, volume label, file system id in bds according to
 10491                                  ; the boot record.  after that, this routine will set the set_id_flag to 2
 10492                                  ; to signal that volume label is set already from the extended boot record
 10493                                  ; (so, don't set it again by calling "set_volume_id" routine which uses
 10494                                  ; the volume label in the root directory.)
 10495                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10496                                  
 10497                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10498                                  
 10499                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10500                                  movbpb:	
 10501 0000079D 8A36[5B01]              		mov	dh, [disksector+0Dh]
 10502                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 10503                                  					; sectors per unit
 10504 000007A1 8A3E[5F01]              		mov	bh, [disksector+11h]
 10505                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.ROOTENTRIES]
 10506                                  					; number of directory entries
 10507 000007A5 8B0E[6101]              		mov	cx, [disksector+13h]
 10508                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.TOTALSECTORS]
 10509                                  					; size of drive
 10510 000007A9 8A26[6301]              		mov	ah, [disksector+15h]
 10511                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 10512                                  					; media	descriptor
 10513 000007AD A0[6401]                		mov	al, [disksector+16h];
 10514                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERFAT]
 10515                                  					; number of fat	sectors
 10516 000007B0 8A1E[6601]              		mov	bl, [disksector+18h]
 10517                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERTRACK]
 10518                                  					; sectors per track
 10519 000007B4 8A16[6801]              		mov	dl, [disksector+1Ah]
 10520                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.HEADS]
 10521                                  					; number of heads
 10522 000007B8 803E[0205]01            		cmp	byte [set_id_flag], 1 ; called by get_bpb?
 10523 000007BD 75DC                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
 10524 000007BF E81200                  		call	mov_media_ids
 10525 000007C2 7205                    		jb	short movbpb_conv ; conventional boot record?
 10526 000007C4 C606[0205]02            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 2 ; signals that volume id is set
 10527                                  movbpb_conv:				
 10528 000007C9 803E[7700]01            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 1
 10529 000007CE 75CB                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
 10530 000007D0 E8B511                  		call	resetchanged	; reset	flags in bds to	not fchanged.
 10531                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10532                                  		; cf = 0
 10533                                  ;movbpb_ret:				
 10534                                  		;clc
 10535 000007D3 C3                      		retn

 10537                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10538                                  
 10539                                  ;copy the boot_serial number, volume id, and filesystem id from the
 10540                                  ;***extended boot record*** in ds:disksector to the bds table pointed
 10541                                  ;by es:di.
 10542                                  
 10543                                  ;in.) es:di -> bds
 10544                                  ;     ds:disksector = valid extended boot record.
 10545                                  ;out.) vol_serial, bds_volid and bds_system_id in bds are set according to
 10546                                  ;      the boot record information.
 10547                                  ;     carry flag set if not an extended bpb.
 10548                                  ;     all registers saved except the flag.
 10549                                  
 10550                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10551                                  mov_media_ids:		
 10552 000007D4 803E[7401]29            		cmp	byte [disksector+26h], 29h
 10553                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SIG],
 10554                                  					; EXT_BOOT_SIGNATURE
 10555 000007D9 752C                    		jnz	short mmi_not_ext
 10556 000007DB 51                      		push	cx
 10557 000007DC 8B0E[7501]              		mov	cx, [disksector+27h]
 10558                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL]
 10559 000007E0 26894D57                		mov	[es:di+57h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial]
 10560 000007E4 8B0E[7701]              		mov	cx, [disksector+29h]
 10561                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL+2]
 10562 000007E8 26894D59                		mov	[es:di+59h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial+2]
 10563 000007EC 57                      		push	di
 10564 000007ED 56                      		push	si
 10565 000007EE B90B00                  		mov	cx, 11		; size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 10566 000007F1 BE[7901]                		mov	si, disksector+2Bh
 10567                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+2Bh) ;
 10568                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.VOL_LABEL
 10569 000007F4 83C74B                  		add	di, 75		; BDS.volid
 10570 000007F7 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 10571                                  		;mov	cx, 8		; size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID
 10572                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10573 000007F9 B108                    		mov	cl, 8 ; cx = 8
 10574 000007FB BE[8401]                		mov	si, disksector+36h
 10575                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+36h) ; disksector+EXT_BOOT.SYSTEM_ID
 10576 000007FE 83C705                  		add	di, 5		; (BDS.filesys_id-BDS.volid)-size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 10577 00000801 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 10578 00000803 5E                      		pop	si
 10579 00000804 5F                      		pop	di
 10580 00000805 59                      		pop	cx
 10581                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10582                                  		; cf = 0
 10583                                  		;clc		; this clc is not required (16/06/2019 - Erdogan Tan)
 10584                                  				; (20/09/2022)

 10592                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10593                                  
 10594                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10595                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 10596                                  ; read in the fat sector and get the media byte from it.
 10597                                  ; input : es:di -> bds
 10598                                  ; output:
 10599                                  ;	  carry set if an error occurs, ax contains error code.
 10600                                  ;	  otherwise, ah contains media byte on exit
 10601                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 10602                                  
 10603                                  readfat:	
 10604                                  		;mov	dh, 0
 10605                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10606 00000809 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
 10607 0000080B B90200                  		mov	cx, 2		; head 0
 10608                                  					; cylinder 0, sector 2
 10609 0000080E E80500                  		call	read_sector
 10610 00000811 7202                    		jb	short bad_fat_ret
 10611 00000813 8A27                    		mov	ah, [bx]	; media	byte
 10612                                  bad_fat_ret:				
 10613 00000815 C3                      		retn

 10615                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10616                                  
 10617                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10618                                  
 10619                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10620                                  ; read a single sector into the temp buffer.
 10621                                  ; perform three retries in case of error.
 10622                                  ;   inputs:	es:[di].bds_drivenum has physical drive to use
 10623                                  ;		cx has sector and cylinder
 10624                                  ;		dh has head
 10625                                  ;		es:di has bds
 10626                                  ;		ds has Bios_Data
 10627                                  ;
 10628                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear
 10629                                  ;		    Bios_Data:bx point to sector
 10630                                  ;		       (note: some callers assume location of buffer)
 10631                                  ;
 10632                                  ;		carry set
 10633                                  ;		    ax has rom error code
 10634                                  ;
 10635                                  ; register bp is preserved.
 10636                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10637                                  
 10638                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10639                                  
 10640                                  		; 19/10/2022

 10818                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------
 10819                                  ; miscellaneous odd jump routines. 
 10820                                  ; moved out of mainline for speed.
 10821                                  
 10822                                  ; if we have a system where we have virtual drives, we need 
 10823                                  ; to prompt the user to place the correct disk in the drive.
 10824                                  ;
 10825                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds:->Bios_Data
 10826                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------
 10827                                  
 10828                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10829                                  checksingle:		
 10830 000008D8 50                      		push	ax
 10831 000008D9 53                      		push	bx
 10832 000008DA 268B5D23                		mov	bx, [es:di+23h]	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10833                                  
 10834                                  ; if hard drive, cannot change disk.
 10835                                  ; if current owner of physical drive, no need to change diskette.
 10836                                  
 10837 000008DE F6C321                  		test	bl, 21h		; fnon_removable|fi_own_physical
 10838 000008E1 7573                    		jnz	short singleret
 10839 000008E3 F6C310                  		test	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 10840                                  					; is there a drive sharing this	physical drive?
 10841 000008E6 746E                    		jz	short singleret
 10842                                  
 10843                                  
 10844                                  ; look for the previous owner of this physical drive
 10845                                  ; and reset its ownership flag.
 10846                                  
 10847 000008E8 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10848                                  					; get physical drive number
 10849 000008EC 06                      		push	es		; preserve pointer to current bds
 10850 000008ED 57                      		push	di
 10851 000008EE C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; get first bds
 10852                                  scan_list:				
 10853 000008F2 26384504                		cmp	[es:di+4], al
 10854 000008F6 7553                    		jnz	short scan_skip	; Not our drive. Try next bds.
 10855 000008F8 B320                    		mov	bl, 20h	; ' '   ; fi_own_physical ; test ownership flag
 10856 000008FA 26845D23                		test	[es:di+23h], bl
 10857 000008FE 744B                    		jz	short scan_skip	; he doesn't own it either. continue
 10858 00000900 26305D23                		xor	[es:di+23h], bl	; reset	ownership flag
 10859 00000904 5F                      		pop	di		; restore pointer to current bds
 10860 00000905 07                      		pop	es
 10861 00000906 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; ; set	ownership flag
 10862                                  
 10863                                  ; we examine the fsetowner flag. if it is set, then we are using the code in
 10864                                  ; checksingle to just set the owner of a drive. we must not issue the prompt
 10865                                  ; in this case.
 10866 0000090A 803E[7A00]01            		cmp	byte [fsetowner], 1
 10867 0000090F 7517                    		jnz	short not_fsetowner
 10868                                  		;cmp	byte ptr es:[di+4], 0 ;	are we handling	drive number 0 ?
 10869 00000911 26807D0400              		cmp	byte [es:di+4], 0
 10870 00000916 753E                    		jnz	short singleret
 10871 00000918 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]
 10872                                  		;mov	al, es:[di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet]
 10873                                  					; get the DOS drive letter
 10874 0000091C 06                      		push	es
 10875 0000091D 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10876 00000921 26A20405                		mov	[es:LSTDRV], al
 10877                                  		;mov	es:504h, al	; [es:LSTDRV]
 10878                                  					; set up sdsb
 10879 00000925 07                      		pop	es		; restore bds pointer
 10880 00000926 EB2E                    		jmp	short singleret
 10881                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10882                                  
 10883                                  ; to support "backward" compatibility with ibm's "single drive status byte"
 10884                                  ; we now check to see if we are in a single drive system and the application
 10885                                  ; has "cleverly" diddled the sdsb
 10886

 10891 00000930 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; if (curr_drv == req_drv)
 10892 00000934 88C4                    		mov	ah, al

 10894 00000937 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]

 10900 00000943 58                      		pop	ax		; swap(curr_drv,req_drv)

 10902                                  ignore_sdsb:

 10938                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10939                                  
 10940                                  ; 15/10/52022
 10941                                  
 10942                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10943                                  ;	disk i/o handler
 10944                                  ;
 10945                                  ;	al = drive number (0-6)
 10946                                  ;	ah = media descriptor
 10947                                  ;	cx = sector count
 10948                                  ;	dx = first sector (low)
 10949                                  ;	[start_sec_h] = first sector (high)  32 bit calculation.
 10950                                  ;	ds = cs
 10951                                  ;	es:di = transfer address
 10952                                  ;	[rflag]=operation (2=read, 3=write)
 10953                                  ;	[verify]=1 for verify after write
 10954                                  ;
 10955                                  ;	if successful carry flag = 0
 10956                                  ;	  else cf=1 and al contains error code
 10957                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10958                                  
 10959                                  diskrd:	
 10960                                  		;mov	ds:rflag, 2	; romread
 10961                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10962 00000961 C606[2001]02            		mov	byte [rflag], 2 ; romread
 10963                                  
 10964                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10965                                  
 10966                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10967                                  diskio:
 10968 00000966 89FB                    		mov	bx, di		; es:bx	= transfer address
 10969 00000968 8C06[2F05]              		mov	[xfer_seg], es	; save transfer	segment
 10970 0000096C E801FC                  		call	SetDrive
 10971 0000096F 268A4510                		mov	al, [es:di+10h]	; [es:di+BDS.media]
 10972 00000973 A2[1F01]                		mov	[medbyt], al
 10973                                  		;jcxz	short ioret
 10974 00000976 E3E8                    		jcxz	ioret
 10975                                  
 10976                                  ; see if the media is formatted or not by checking the flags field in
 10977                                  ; in the bds. if it is unformatted we cannot allow i/o, so we should
 10978                                  ; go to the error exit at label unformatteddrive.
 10979                                  
 10980 00000978 26F6452402              		test	byte [es:di+24h], 2
 10981                                  		;test	byte ptr es:[di+24h], 2	; [es:di+BDS.flags+1]
 10982                                  					; unformatted_media
 10983 0000097D 75DE                    		jnz	short unformatteddrive
 10984 0000097F 890E[2201]              		mov	[seccnt], cx	; save sector count
 10985 00000983 8926[3501]              		mov	[spsav], sp	; save sp
 10986                                  
 10987                                  ; ensure that we are trying to access valid sectors on the drive
 10988                                  
 10989 00000987 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
 10990 00000989 31F6                    		xor	si, si
 10991 0000098B 01CA                    		add	dx, cx
 10992                                  		;adc	si, 0
 10993                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 10994 0000098D D1D6                    		rcl	si, 1
 10995 0000098F 26837D0E00              		cmp	word [es:di+0Eh], 0 ; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs16]
 10996                                  					; 32 bit sector ?
 10997 00000994 740C                    		jz	short sanity32
 10998                                  		;cmp	si, 0
 10999                                  		; 02/09/2023
 11000 00000996 09F6                    		or	si, si
 11001 00000998 75BF                    		jnz	short baddrive
 11002 0000099A 263B550E                		cmp	dx, [es:di+0Eh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs16]
 11003 0000099E 77B9                    		ja	short baddrive
 11004 000009A0 EB12                    		jmp	short sanityok
 11005                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11006                                  
 11007                                  sanity32:				
 11008 000009A2 0336[2305]              		add	si, [start_sec_h]
 11009 000009A6 263B751D                		cmp	si, [es:di+1Dh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
 11010 000009AA 7208                    		jb	short sanityok
 11011 000009AC 77AB                    		ja	short baddrive
 11012 000009AE 263B551B                		cmp	dx, [es:di+1Bh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32]
 11013 000009B2 77A5                    		ja	short baddrive
 11014                                  
 11015                                  sanityok:				
 11016 000009B4 8B16[2305]              		mov	dx, [start_sec_h]
 11017 000009B8 26034517                		add	ax, [es:di+17h]	; [es:di+BDS.hiddensecs]
 11018 000009BC 26135519                		adc	dx, [es:di+19h]	; [es:di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
 11019                                  
 11020                                  ; now dx;ax have the physical first sector.
 11021                                  ; since the following procedures is going to destroy ax, let's
 11022                                  ; save it temporarily to saved_word.
 11023                                  
 11024 000009C0 A3[2505]                		mov	[saved_word], ax ; save the sector number (low)
 11025                                  
 11026                                  ; set up pointer to disk base table in [dpt]. we cannot assume that iosetup
 11027                                  ; will do it because we will skip the set up stuff with hard disks.
 11028                                  
 11029 000009C3 06                      		push	es
 11030                                  		;mov	es, [zeroseg]
 11031                                  		; 02/09/2023
 11032 000009C4 31F6                    		xor	si, si ; 0
 11033 000009C6 8EC6                    		mov	es, si
 11034 000009C8 26C4367800              		les	si, [es:DSKADR]
 11035                                  		;les	si, es:78h	; [es:DSKADR]
 11036                                  					; current disk parm table
 11037 000009CD 8936[2D01]              		mov	[dpt], si
 11038 000009D1 8C06[2F01]              		mov	[dpt+2], es
 11039 000009D5 07                      		pop	es
 11040 000009D6 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 11041                                  					; fnon_removable
 11042 000009DB 7510                    		jnz	short skip_setup
 11043 000009DD E8F8FE                  		call	checksingle
 11044                                  
 11045                                  ; check to see if we have previously noted a change line. the routine
 11046                                  ; returns if everything is ok. otherwise, it pops off the stack and returns
 11047                                  ; the proper error code.
 11048                                  
 11049 000009E0 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0 ; do we have changeline support?
 11050 000009E5 7403                    		jz	short diskio_nochangeline ; brif not
 11051 000009E7 E8960E                  		call	checklatchio	; will do a sneaky pop stack return
 11052                                  					; if a disk error occurs
 11053                                  diskio_nochangeline:			
 11054 000009EA E84700                  		call	iosetup		; set up tables	and variables for i/o
 11055                                  
 11056                                  ; now the settle values are correct for the following code
 11057                                  
 11058                                  skip_setup:
 11059                                  
 11060                                  ; 32 bit sector calculation.
 11061                                  ; dx:[saved_word] = starting sector number.
 11062                                  				
 11063 000009ED 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
 11064 000009EF 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 11065                                  		;div	word [es:di+13h] ; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 11066                                  					 ; divide by sec per track
 11067                                  		; 02/09/2023
 11068 000009F1 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]
 11069 000009F5 F7F1                    		div	cx
 11070 000009F7 A3[2105]                		mov	[temp_h], ax
 11071 000009FA A1[2505]                		mov	ax, [saved_word]
 11072 000009FD F7F1                    		div	cx ; 02/09/2023
 11073                                  		;div	word [es:di+13h] ; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 11074                                  					; now, [temp_h]:ax = track #, dx = sector
 11075                                  		;inc	dl		; sector number	is 1 based.
 11076                                  		; 18/12/2022

 11525                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 11526                                  
 11527                                  ; if the drive has been marked as too big (i.e. starting sector of the
 11528                                  ; partition is > 16 bits, then always return drive not ready.

 11549                                  ; map error returned by rom in ah into corresponding code to be returned to
 11550                                  ; dos in al. trashes di. guaranteed to set carry.

 11561                                  					; number of possible error conditions
