 13781                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13782                                  
 13783                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13784                                  
 13785                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13786                                  ;
 13787                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 13788                                  ;
 13789                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 13790                                  ;							seg ffff )
 13791                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 13792                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 13793                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 13794                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 13795                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 13796                                  ;
 13797                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 13798                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 13799                                  ;
 13800                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13801                                  
 13802                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13803                                  HMAPtr:
 13804 0000143E 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13805                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13806 00001443 8B3E[9608]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13807                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13808 00001447 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13809 0000144A 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13810 0000144C 803E[9C08]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 13811                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 13812 00001451 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13813 00001453 FF1E[9808]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13814                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13815 00001457 8B3E[9608]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13816                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13817                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 13818 0000145B C3                      		retn
 13819                                  
 13820                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13821                                  
 13822                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13823                                  
 13824                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 13825                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 13826                                  
 13827                                  move_sector:
 13828                                  
 13829                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 13830                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 13831                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 13832                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 13833                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 13834                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 13835                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 13836                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 13837                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 13838                                  ;
 13839                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 13840                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 13841                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 13842                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 13843                                  ; back to a byte move.
 13844                                  
 13845 0000145C FC                      		cld
 13846 0000145D 51                      		push	cx
 13847 0000145E B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 13848 00001461 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 13849 00001465 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13850 00001467 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 13851 0000146B 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13852 0000146D F3A5                    		rep movsw
 13853 0000146F 59                      		pop	cx
 13854 00001470 C3                      		retn
 13855                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13856                                  
 13857                                  movsec_bytes:				
 13858 00001471 D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 13859 00001473 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 13860 00001475 59                      		pop	cx
 13861 00001476 C3                      		retn
 13862                                  
 13863                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13864                                  
 13865                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13866                                  
 13867                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 13868                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 13869                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 13870                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 13871                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 13872                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 13873                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 13874                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 13875                                  ;
 13876                                  ; input conditions:
 13877                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 13878                                  ;
 13879                                  ; output:
 13880                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 13881                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 13882                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 13883                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 13884                                  
 13885                                  check_wrap:	
 13886 00001477 50                      		push	ax
 13887 00001478 53                      		push	bx
 13888 00001479 06                      		push	es
 13889 0000147A 57                      		push	di
 13890 0000147B E86C00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 13891 0000147E 725E                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 13892                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13893 00001480 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13894                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13895 00001485 7457                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 13896 00001487 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13897 0000148B 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 13898 0000148D 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 13899 00001490 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 13900 00001492 764A                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 13901 00001494 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 13902                                  
 13903                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 13904                                  ; last sector on that track.
 13905                                  
 13906 00001496 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 13907 00001498 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 13908                                  		; 18/12/2022
 13909 0000149A 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 13910 0000149B 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 13911                                  					; if on	boundary
 13912                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 13913                                  not_on_bound:
 13914 0000149D 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 13915 000014A0 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 13916 000014A2 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 13917 000014A4 40                      		inc	ax
 13918 000014A5 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 13919 000014A7 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 13920                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13921 000014AA 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13922 000014AE 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx
 13923                                  		;cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13924                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 13925 000014B0 7632                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 13926 000014B2 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 13927 000014B3 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13928                                  		;mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13929 000014B5 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 13930                                  
 13931                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 13932                                  
 13933 000014B7 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 13934 000014B9 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 13935 000014BB 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 13936                                  
 13937                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 13938                                  
 13939 000014BD 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 13940 000014BF 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 13941 000014C1 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 13942                                  no_head_bound:				
 13943 000014C2 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 13944 000014C4 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 13945 000014C5 FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 13946 000014C7 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 13947 000014C9 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 13948 000014CB 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 13949 000014CE B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 13950 000014D0 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 13951 000014D2 D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 13952 000014D4 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 13953 000014D6 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 13954 000014D8 D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 13955 000014DA 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 13956 000014DC 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 13957                                  no_wrap:				
 13958 000014DE F8                      		clc
 13959 000014DF 5F                      		pop	di
 13960 000014E0 07                      		pop	es
 13961 000014E1 5B                      		pop	bx
 13962 000014E2 58                      		pop	ax
 13963 000014E3 C3                      		retn
 13964                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13965                                  
 13966                                  no_wrap_head:				
 13967 000014E4 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 13968 000014E6 FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 13969 000014E8 EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 13970                                  
 13971                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13972                                  
 13973                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13974                                  
 13975                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 13976                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 13977                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 13978                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 13979                                  ;
 13980                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 13981                                  
 13982                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13983                                  find_bds:	
 13984 000014EA C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 13985                                  fbds_1:					
 13986 000014EE 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13987 000014F2 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 13988 000014F4 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 13989                                  					; go to next bds
 13990 000014F7 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13991 000014FA 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 13992 000014FC F9                      		stc
 13993                                  fdbs_2:					
 13994 000014FD C3                      		retn
 13995                                  
 13996                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13997                                  
 13998                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13999                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14000                                  doint:
 14001                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14002 000014FE 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14003                                  					; get physical drive number
 14004                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 14005                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 14006                                  		
 14007 00001501 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14008 00001503 08C0                    		or	al, al
 14009 00001505 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 14010                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14011 00001507 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14012                                  					; get request code
 14013                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 14014 0000150A FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14015                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 14016 0000150D 9D                      		popf
 14017                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 14018                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14019 0000150E 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14020                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 14021                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14022 00001513 9C                      		pushf
 14023                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14024 00001514 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14025                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 14026                                  dointdone:				
 14027 00001517 C3                      		retn
 14028                                  
 14029                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14030                                  
 14031                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14032                                  
 14033                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 14034                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 14035                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 14036                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 14037                                  ;
 14038                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 14039                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 14040                                  ;
 14041                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 14042                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 14043                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 14044                                  
 14045                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 14046                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 14047                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 14048                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 14049                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 14050                                  ;.olddx: resw
 14051                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 14052                                  ;.olddd: resd
 14053                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 14054                                  ;end struc
 14055                                  
 14056                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14057                                  
 14058                                  ;   entry conditions:
 14059                                  ;	ah = function
 14060                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 14061                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 14062                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 14063                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 14064                                  ;   output conditions:
 14065                                  ;	no dma violation.
 14066                                  
 14067                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 14068                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 14069                                  ;
 14070                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 14071                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 14072                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 14073                                  
 14074                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14075                                  
 14076                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14077                                  
 14078 00001518 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 14079                                  
 14080                                  ; 17/10/2022
 14081                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 14082                                  ; 09/12/2022
 14083                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 14084                                  
 14085                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14086                                  
 14087                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 14088                                  
 14089                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 14090                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 14091                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 14092                                  
 14093                                  format_special_stuff:			
 14094 0000151C 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 14095 00001521 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 14096 00001523 53                      		push	bx
 14097 00001524 BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 14098 00001527 E83D04                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 14099 0000152A 5B                      		pop	bx
 14100 0000152B EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 14101                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14102                                  
 14103                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14104                                  
 14105                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 14106                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 14107                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 14108                                  
 14109                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14110                                  ec35_special_stuff:			
 14111 0000152D 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 14112 0000152F 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 14113 00001531 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 14114 00001532 51                      		push	cx
 14115 00001533 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 14116 00001535 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 14117 00001537 D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 14118 00001539 8406[2905]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 14119 0000153D 59                      		pop	cx
 14120 0000153E 58                      		pop	ax
 14121 0000153F 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 14122                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 14123 00001541 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 14124 00001542 06                      		push	es
 14125                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14126 00001543 2EC41E[1815]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 14127                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 14128                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 14129 00001548 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 14130 0000154A 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 14131 0000154D 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 14132                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 14133                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 14134 00001551 07                      		pop	es
 14135 00001552 5B                      		pop	bx
 14136 00001553 EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 14137                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14138                                  
 14139                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14140                                  
 14141                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 14142                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 14143                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 14144                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 14145                                  
 14146                                  ps2_special_stuff:			
 14147 00001555 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 14148                                  					; read driver parm ?
 14149 0000155A 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 14150 0000155C 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 14151                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 14152 00001561 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 14153                                  ps2_30_problem:				
 14154 00001563 50                      		push	ax
 14155 00001564 B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 14156                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 14157                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14158 00001566 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14159                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 14160                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14161 0000156B 58                      		pop	ax
 14162 0000156C EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 14163                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14164                                  
 14165                                  ; 17/10/2022
 14166                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14167                                  
 14168                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 14169                                  
 14170                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 14171                                  
 14172                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 14173                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 14174                                  
 14175                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14176 0000156E 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 14177                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 14178                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 14179 0000156F 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 14180                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 14181                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 14182                                  
 14183                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 14184                                  
 14185 00001574 A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 14186 00001577 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 14187 0000157A 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 14188                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 14189                                   format_special_stuff_done:		
 14190 0000157C 803E[2905]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 14191 00001581 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 14192                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 14193                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 14194                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h		
 14195 00001583 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14196                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14197                                  		
 14198 00001588 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 14199                                  		
 14200 00001589 803E[3606]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 14201                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 14202 0000158E 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 14203                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 14204                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so		
 14205 00001590 9D                      		popf
 14206 00001591 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 14207                                  ret_from_i13:				
 14208 00001593 1F                      		pop	ds
 14209 00001594 CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 14210                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14211                                  
 14212                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 14213                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 14214                                  ; a changeline error.
 14215                                  
 14216                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:			
 14217 00001597 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 14218                                  i13_ret_error:				
 14219 00001599 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 14220 0000159C 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 14221 0000159E 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 14222 000015A0 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 14223 000015A2 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 14224 000015A7 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 14225                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 14226                                  					; never	would
 14227 000015A9 53                      		push	bx
 14228 000015AA BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 14229 000015AD E8B703                  		call	set_changed_dl
 14230 000015B0 5B                      		pop	bx
 14231                                  int13b:					
 14232 000015B1 F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 14233 000015B2 EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 14234                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14235                                  
 14236                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 14237                                  
 14238                                  goterr13:				
 14239 000015B4 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 14240 000015B7 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 14241                                  goterr13_xxxx:				
 14242 000015B9 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 14243 000015BC 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 14244 000015BE 803E[3006]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 14245 000015C3 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 14246                                  
 14247 000015C5 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 14248                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 14249                                  					; (2 = romread)
 14250                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 14251 000015CA 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 14252                                  
 14253 000015CC 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14254                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 14255                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14256 000015CE 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14257                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14258                                  					; call far 70:797h
 14259 000015D3 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 14260 000015D6 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 14261 000015D8 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 14262 000015DA 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 14263 000015DC 53                      		push	bx
 14264 000015DD 51                      		push	cx
 14265 000015DE 52                      		push	dx
 14266 000015DF A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 14267                                  loop_ecc:				
 14268 000015E2 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 14269                                  
 14270                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 14271                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 14272                                  ;
 14273                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 14274                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 14275                                  ; track.
 14276                                  ;
 14277                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 14278                                  ; this request.
 14279                                  ;
 14280                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 14281                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 14282                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 14283                                  ;
 14284 000015E5 E88FFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 14285                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 14286                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14287 000015E8 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14288                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14289 000015ED 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 14290 000015EF 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 14291 000015F2 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 14292 000015F4 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 14293 000015F7 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 14294                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14295                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 14296                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 14297 000015F9 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 14298                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 14299                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 14300                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 14301                                  ok11_op:				
 14302 000015FB FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 14303 000015FF 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 14304 00001601 FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 14305                                  					; add 200h to address
 14306 00001603 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 14307 00001605 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 14308 00001607 EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 14309                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14310                                  
 14311                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 14312                                  
 14313                                  ok11_exit_err:				
 14314 00001609 F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 14315                                  ok11_exit:				
 14316 0000160A 5A                      		pop	dx
 14317 0000160B 59                      		pop	cx
 14318 0000160C 5B                      		pop	bx
 14319 0000160D EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14320                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14321                                  
 14322                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 14323                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 14324                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 14325                                  
 14326                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:			
 14327 0000160F 06                      		push	es
 14328 00001610 53                      		push	bx
 14329 00001611 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14330 00001614 1E                      		push	ds
 14331 00001615 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 14332 00001616 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 14333                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 14334                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14335 00001619 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14336                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14337 0000161E 5B                      		pop	bx
 14338 0000161F 07                      		pop	es
 14339 00001620 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 14340 00001622 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 14341 00001625 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 14342                                  
 14343                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 14344                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 14345                                  
 14346                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:		
 14347 00001627 56                      		push	si
 14348 00001628 57                      		push	di
 14349 00001629 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14350 0000162B BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14351 0000162E E82BFE                  		call	move_sector
 14352 00001631 5F                      		pop	di
 14353 00001632 5E                      		pop	si
 14354 00001633 EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 14355                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14356                                  
 14357                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 14358                                  ; operation as best we can.
 14359                                  
 14360                                  gotdmaerr:				
 14361 00001635 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 14362 00001638 FB                      		sti
 14363 00001639 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 14364 0000163C 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14365                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 14366                                  					; functions we don't handle
 14367 0000163E 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 14368 00001641 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 14369 00001643 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 14370 00001646 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 14371 00001648 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14372                                  
 14373                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 14374                                  
 14375                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 14376                                  
 14377 0000164A 52                      		push	dx
 14378 0000164B 51                      		push	cx
 14379 0000164C 53                      		push	bx
 14380 0000164D 50                      		push	ax
 14381 0000164E 55                      		push	bp
 14382 0000164F 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 14383 00001651 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 14384 00001653 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14385 00001655 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14386 00001657 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14387 00001659 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 14388 0000165B 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 14389 0000165D 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 14390                                  
 14391                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 14392                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 14393                                  
 14394 00001661 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 14395 00001663 E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 14396                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14397                                  
 14398                                  no_skip_first:				
 14399 00001666 D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 14400 00001668 B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 14401 0000166A 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 14402                                  
 14403                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 14404                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 14405                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 14406                                  ;
 14407                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 14408                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 14409                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 14410                                  ; in error.
 14411                                  
 14412 0000166C 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 14413 0000166E 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 14414                                  
 14415                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 14416                                  
 14417 00001670 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14418                                  					; set up head number
 14419 00001673 E888FE                  		call	doint
 14420 00001676 E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 14421                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14422                                  
 14423                                  i13_done_dmaerr:			
 14424 00001679 B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 14425 0000167B F9                      		stc
 14426 0000167C E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 14427                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 14428                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14429                                  
 14430                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 14431                                  
 14432                                  intverify:				
 14433 0000167F 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 14434 00001680 53                      		push	bx
 14435 00001681 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 14436 00001682 07                      		pop	es
 14437                                  dosimple:				
 14438 00001683 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14439                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 14440                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 14441                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14442 00001686 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14443                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14444 0000168B 5B                      		pop	bx
 14445 0000168C 07                      		pop	es
 14446 0000168D E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14447                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14448                                  
 14449                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 14450                                  
 14451                                  intformat:				
 14452 00001690 06                      		push	es
 14453 00001691 53                      		push	bx
 14454 00001692 56                      		push	si
 14455 00001693 57                      		push	di
 14456 00001694 1E                      		push	ds
 14457                                  
 14458                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 14459                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 14460                                  
 14461 00001695 06                      		push	es
 14462 00001696 1E                      		push	ds
 14463 00001697 07                      		pop	es
 14464 00001698 1F                      		pop	ds
 14465 00001699 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 14466 0000169B BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 14467 0000169E E8BBFD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 14468 000016A1 1F                      		pop	ds
 14469 000016A2 5F                      		pop	di
 14470 000016A3 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 14471 000016A4 EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 14472                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14473                                  
 14474                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 14475                                  ; the first block.
 14476                                  ;
 14477                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 14478                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 14479                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 14480                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 14481                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 14482                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 14483                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 14484                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 14485                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 14486                                  
 14487                                  doblock:
 14488                                  
 14489                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 14490                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 14491                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 14492                                  				
 14493 000016A6 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14494                                  					; get head #, drive #
 14495 000016A9 51                      		push	cx
 14496 000016AA 06                      		push	es
 14497 000016AB 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14498                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 14499 000016AC E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 14500 000016AF 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14501                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14502 000016B3 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14503                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14504 000016B8 5F                      		pop	di
 14505 000016B9 07                      		pop	es
 14506 000016BA 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 14507 000016BC 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 14508 000016BE B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 14509 000016C0 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14510                                  doblockflop:				
 14511 000016C2 59                      		pop	cx
 14512                                  doblockcontinue:			
 14513 000016C3 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 14514 000016C5 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 14515 000016C7 50                      		push	ax
 14516 000016C8 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 14517 000016CA EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 14518                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14519                                  
 14520                                  doblocklast:				
 14521 000016CC 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 14522 000016CE 50                      		push	ax
 14523                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot	
 14524 000016CF E82CFE                  		call	doint
 14525 000016D2 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 14526 000016D4 58                      		pop	ax
 14527 000016D5 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 14528                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 14529 000016D8 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 14530 000016DA 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 14531 000016DC 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 14532 000016DE 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 14533 000016E0 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 14534                                  					; then we are done already.
 14535 000016E2 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 14536                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 14537 000016E4 E890FD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 14538 000016E7 EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 14539                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14540                                  
 14541                                  bufferx:				
 14542 000016E9 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14543                                  					; set up head number
 14544                                  buffer:					
 14545 000016EC 53                      		push	bx
 14546 000016ED 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14547 000016F0 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 14548 000016F3 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 14549                                  					
 14550                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 14551                                  
 14552 000016F5 06                      		push	es
 14553 000016F6 1E                      		push	ds
 14554 000016F7 56                      		push	si
 14555 000016F8 57                      		push	di
 14556 000016F9 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 14557 000016FA 06                      		push	es
 14558 000016FB 1F                      		pop	ds
 14559 000016FC 07                      		pop	es
 14560 000016FD BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 14561 00001700 57                      		push	di		; save it
 14562 00001701 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 14563 00001703 E856FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 14564 00001706 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 14565                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 14566 00001707 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 14567 00001708 5E                      		pop	si
 14568 00001709 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 14569                                  
 14570                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 14571                                  
 14572 0000170A B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14573                                  					; get drive number
 14574 0000170C 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 14575 0000170F E865FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 14576                                  					;
 14577                                  					; ah is	function
 14578                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 14579                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 14580                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 14581                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 14582                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 14583 00001712 E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 14584 00001715 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 14585 00001716 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 14586 00001718 EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 14587                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14588                                  
 14589                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 14590                                  
 14591                                  doread:					
 14592 0000171A 06                      		push	es
 14593 0000171B 53                      		push	bx
 14594 0000171C 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 14595 0000171D 07                      		pop	es
 14596 0000171E BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14597 00001721 B001                    		mov	al, 1
 14598 00001723 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14599                                  					; get drive number
 14600 00001726 E84EFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 14601                                  					; ah = function
 14602                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 14603                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 14604                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 14605 00001729 E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 14606 0000172C 5B                      		pop	bx
 14607 0000172D 07                      		pop	es
 14608 0000172E 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 14609 00001730 56                      		push	si
 14610 00001731 57                      		push	di
 14611 00001732 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14612 00001734 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14613 00001737 E822FD                  		call	move_sector
 14614 0000173A 5F                      		pop	di
 14615 0000173B 5E                      		pop	si
 14616                                  
 14617                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 14618                                  
 14619                                  dotail:					
 14620 0000173C 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 14621 0000173D 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 14622 00001740 41                      		inc	cx
 14623 00001741 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 14624 00001744 F8                      		clc
 14625 00001745 FEC8                    		dec	al
 14626 00001747 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 14627                                  
 14628                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 14629                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 14630                                  
 14631 00001749 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14632 0000174C E828FD                  		call	check_wrap
 14633 0000174F E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 14634                                  
 14635                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 14636                                  
 14637                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 14638                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 14639                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 14640                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 14641                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 14642                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 14643                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 14644                                  
 14645                                  bad13:					
 14646 00001752 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 14647 00001754 5D                      		pop	bp
 14648 00001755 5B                      		pop	bx
 14649 00001756 5B                      		pop	bx
 14650 00001757 59                      		pop	cx
 14651 00001758 5A                      		pop	dx
 14652 00001759 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 14653 0000175B E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 14654                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14655                                  
 14656                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:				
 14657 0000175E E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 14658                                  
 14659                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14660                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14661                                  		;db 	0
 14662                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14663                                  
 14664                                  ;Bios_Code ends

 14674                                  dsk_init:				; 2C7h:1742h = 70h:3CB2h

 14682                                  
 14683                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14684                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 14685                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 14686                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 14687                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14688                                  
 14689                                  install_bds:
 14690 0000176D 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 14691 0000176E BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 14692                                  
 14693                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 14694                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 14695                                  loop_next_bds:
 14696 00001771 C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 14697                                  					; fetch	next bds
 14698 00001773 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14699 00001777 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 14700                                  					; drive	with new one?
 14701 0000177A 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 14702 0000177C B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 14703 0000177E 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14704                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 14705 00001782 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14706 00001785 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 14707                                  					; we don't own it
 14708 0000178A 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14709                                  					; determine if changeline available
 14710 0000178D 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 14711 00001790 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14712                                  next_bds:
 14713                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 14714 00001794 B8FFFF                  		mov	ax, 0FFFFh	; -1
 14715 00001797 3904                    		cmp	[si], ax	; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14716                                  		;cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14717                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 14718 00001799 75D6                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 14719 0000179B 8C4402                  		mov	[si+2], es	; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 14720                                  					; install bds
 14721 0000179E 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 14722 000017A0 268905                  		mov	[es:di], ax	; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14723                                  		;mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14724                                  					; set next pointer to null
 14725 000017A3 1F                      		pop	ds
