 20035 00000A14 26C70628005343          	mov	word [es:20h+8],'SC'		;  code area
 20036                                  
 20037 00000A1B C3                      	retn
 20038                                  
 20039                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 20040                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 20041                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 20042                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 20043                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 20044                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 20045                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 20046                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 20047                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 20048                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 20049                                  ;	  stub will go.
 20050                                  ;
 20051                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 20052                                  
 20053                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20054                                  update_arena:
 20055 00000A1C 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 20056 00000A1D 57                      	push	di
 20057 00000A1E 51                      	push	cx
 20058 00000A1F 52                      	push	dx
 20059                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20060                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 20061                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20062                                  	; ds = cs 
 20063 00000A20 C53E[6D02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 20064 00000A24 4F                      	dec	di
 20065 00000A25 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 20066                                  						;  before sysvar
 20067 00000A26 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 20068                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 20069 00000A28 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 20070 00000A2D 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 20071 00000A2F 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 20072                                  
 20073                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 20074 00000A31 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 20075 00000A36 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 20076 00000A38 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 20077 00000A3A 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 20078 00000A3C 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 20079                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 20080 00000A3E 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 20081                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 20082 00000A42 C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 20083 00000A48 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block
 20084                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx			; store it in the arena
 20085 00000A4A 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 20086 00000A4E 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller
 20087                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20088                                  	;; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)	; Take care ORG 30h of
 20089 00000A50 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				;  BIOS code
 20090 00000A53 5A                      	pop	dx
 20091 00000A54 59                      	pop	cx
 20092 00000A55 5F                      	pop	di
 20093 00000A56 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 20094 00000A57 C3                      	retn
 20095                                  ;
 20096                                  ; M012 : END
 20097                                  ;
 20098                                  FatalErr:
 20099 00000A58 0E                      	push	cs
 20100 00000A59 1F                      	pop	ds
 20101 00000A5A BA[2209]                	mov	dx,FEmsg
 20102 00000A5D B409                    	mov	ah,9
 20103 00000A5F CD21                    	int	21h 		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 20104                                  				; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 20105                                  	; 30/12/2022 (MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 20106 00000A61 E93F07                  	jmp	stall
 20107                                  	; 23/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 20108                                  	;cli
 20109                                  	;hlt

 20115                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20116                                  ;
 20117                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 20118                                  ;
 20119                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 20120                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 20121                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 20122                                  ;
 20123                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 20124                                  ;
 20125                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20126                                  
 20127                                  AllocHMA:
 20128                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 20129                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 20130                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 20131                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 20132                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 20133                                  
 20134                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 20135                                  ;
 20136                                  ;	xor	ax,ax
 20137                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 20138                                  ;	push	ax
 20139                                  ;	popf
 20140                                  ;	pushf
 20141                                  ;	pop	ax
 20142                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)
 20143                                  ;	and	ax,0F000h
 20144                                  ;	cmp	ax,0F000h	; 8088/8086?
 20145                                  ;	jz	short grab_hma_error
 20146                                  
 20147                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 20148                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A26h)
 20149                                  
 20150 00000A64 1E                      	push	ds
 20151                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data
 20152                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT
 20153                                  	; 21/10/2022
 20154 00000A65 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 20155 00000A68 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 20156                                  
 20157 00000A6A E84A00                  	call	IsXMSLoaded
 20158 00000A6D 7545                    	jnz	short grabhma_error
 20159                                  
 20160 00000A6F B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 20161 00000A72 CD2F                    	int	2Fh		; get the vector into es:bx
 20162                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 20163                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 20164                                  
 20165 00000A74 891E[0E00]              	mov	[xms],bx
 20166                                  	;mov	[0Eh], bx
 20167 00000A78 8C06[1000]              	mov	[xms+2],es
 20168                                  	;mov	[10h],es
 20169                                  
 20170 00000A7C B401                    	mov	ah,1		; request HMA
 20171 00000A7E BAFFFF                  	mov	dx,0FFFFh
 20172                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 20173 00000A81 FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 20174 00000A85 48                      	dec	ax
 20175 00000A86 7409                    	jz	short allocHMA_1 ; error if not able to allocate HMA
 20176                                  
 20177                                  ;------ Himem may be lying because it has allocated mem for int 15
 20178                                  
 20179 00000A88 B488                    	mov	ah,88h
 20180 00000A8A CD15                    	int	15h
 20181                                  		; Get Extended Memory Size
 20182                                  		; Return: CF clear on success
 20183                                  		; AX = size of memory above 1M in K
 20184 00000A8C 83F840                  	cmp	ax,64		; less than 64 K of hma ?
 20185                                  	;jb	short grabhma_error
 20186                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20187 00000A8F 7224                    	jb	short grabhma_err ; cf=1
 20188                                  allocHMA_1:
 20189 00000A91 B405                    	mov	ah,5		; localenableA20
 20190                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 20191 00000A93 FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 20192 00000A97 48                      	dec	ax
 20193 00000A98 751A                    	jnz	short grabhma_error ; error if couldn't enable A20
 20194                                  
 20195 00000A9A E88901                  	call	IsVDiskInstalled
 20196 00000A9D 7415                    	jz	short grabhma_error ; yes, we cant use HMA
 20197                                  
 20198 00000A9F B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh
 20199 00000AA2 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 20200 00000AA4 26C70610003412          	mov	word [es:10h],1234h ; see if we can really read/write there
 20201 00000AAB 26813E10003412          	cmp	word [es:10h],1234h
 20202                                  	;jne	short grabhma_error ; don't try to load there if XMS lied
 20203                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20204 00000AB2 7401                    	je	short allocHMA_ok	
 20205                                  
 20206                                  ; 11/12/2022
 20207                                  ;	; 11/12/2022
 20208                                  ;	; cf=0
 20209                                  ;	;clc
 20210                                  ;	pop	ds
 20211                                  ;	retn
 20212                                  
 20213                                  grabhma_error:
 20214 00000AB4 F9                      	stc
 20215                                  	; 11/12/022
 20216                                  grabhma_err:	; cf=1
 20217                                  allocHMA_ok:	; cf=0
 20218 00000AB5 1F                      	pop	ds
 20219 00000AB6 C3                      	retn
 20220                                  
 20221                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20222                                  ;
 20223                                  ; procedure : IsXMSLoaded
 20224                                  ;
 20225                                  ;             Checks whether a XMS driver is loaded
 20226                                  ;
 20227                                  ; Returns : Z flag set if XMS driver loaded
 20228                                  ;           Z flag reset if no XMS drivers are present
 20229                                  ;
 20230                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20231                                  
 20232                                  IsXMSLoaded:
 20233 00000AB7 B80043                  	mov	ax,4300h
 20234 00000ABA CD2F                    	int	2Fh		; - Multiplex - XMS - INSTALLATION CHECK
 20235                                  				; Return: AL = 80h XMS driver installed
 20236                                  				; AL <> 80h no driver
 20237 00000ABC 3C80                    	cmp	al,80h		; XMS installed?
 20238 00000ABE C3                      	retn

 20277 00000AD5 5F                      	pop	di
 20278 00000AD6 5E                      	pop	si
 20279 00000AD7 5A                      	pop	dx

 20281 00000AD9 5B                      	pop	bx
 20282 00000ADA 58                      	pop	ax
 20283                                  
 20284 00000ADB CB                      	retf
 20285                                  
 20286                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20287                                  ;
 20288                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 20289                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 20290                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 20291                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 20292                                  ;
 20293                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 20294                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 20295                                  ;
 20296                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20297                                  
 20298                                  StartVDHead:
 20299                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 20300                                  
 20301 00000ADC 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 20302 00000AE0 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 20303 00000AE2 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 20304 00000AE4 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 20305 00000AE6 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 20306                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 20307 00000AE7 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 20308                                  VDiskSig1:
 20309 00000AEE 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 20310                                  
 20311                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)

 20348                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20349                                  ;
 20350                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 20351                                  ;
 20352                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 20353                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 20354                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 20355                                  ;
 20356                                  ; Inputs : None
 20357                                  ;
 20358                                  ; Outputs : None
 20359                                  ;
 20360                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 20361                                  ;
 20362                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20363                                  
 20364                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 20365                                  
 20366                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 20367 00000B30 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 20368 00000B32 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 20369                                  
 20370                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 20371                                  
 20372                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20373 00000B34 A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 20374                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 20375 00000B37 2EA3[0C0B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 20376 00000B3B A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 20377                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20378 00000B3E 2EA3[0E0B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20379                                  
 20380                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 20381                                  
 20382 00000B42 B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 20383                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 20384                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20385 00000B44 BB0400                  	mov	bx,4
 20386 00000B47 CD21                    	int	21h
 20387                                  
 20388                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 20389                                  
 20390 00000B49 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena
 20391 00000B4A 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 20392                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; owner = System
 20393 00000B4C 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:1],8
 20394                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; System Code
 20395 00000B53 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:8],'SC'
 20396 00000B5A 40                      	inc	ax
 20397 00000B5B 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
 20398                                  
 20399                                  ;-------------- install new int 19 vector
 20400                                  
 20401 00000B5D FA                      	cli				; no reboots at this time
 20402                                  	;mov	word [19h*4],(VDInt19-StartVDHead)
 20403 00000B5E C70664002F00            	mov	word [19h*4],47
 20404 00000B64 A36600                  	mov	[19h*4+2],ax

 20413 00000B70 1F                      	pop	ds

 20484                                  ; (SYSINIT:0CA6h)
 20485                                  
 20486                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 20487                                  
 20488                                  ;; 04/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimized)
 20489                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 20490                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 20491                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 20492                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 20493                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 20494                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 20495                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 20496                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 20497                                  ;								      ;I070
 20498                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 20499                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 20500                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 20501                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 20502                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 20503                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 20504                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 20505                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 20506                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 20507                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 20508                                  ;								      ;I070
 20509                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 20510                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 20511                                  
 20512                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20513                                  	; ds = cs
 20514                                  
 20515                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 20516                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS SYSINIT:0CBFh)
 20517                                  
 20518 00000BDA 06                      	push	es
 20519 00000BDB 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 20520 00000BDD 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 20521 00000BDF B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 20522 00000BE1 D3EA                    	shr	dx,cl
 20523 00000BE3 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 20524 00000BE5 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 20525 00000BE7 05[BA0B]                	add	ax,ClrdVDISKHead
 20526 00000BEA 80D200                  	adc	dl,0
 20527                                  
 20528                                  	;; 23/10/2022
 20529                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 20530                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+2],ax
 20531                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.hi_byte],dl
 20532                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+4],dl
 20533                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20534                                  	;mov	[src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 20535 00000BED A3[9C0B]                	mov	[src_desc+2],ax
 20536                                  	;mov	[src_desc+desc.hi_byte],dl
 20537 00000BF0 8816[9E0B]              	mov	[src_desc+4],dl
 20538                                  
 20539 00000BF4 B91000                  	mov	cx,16	; 16 words
 20540 00000BF7 0E                      	push	cs
 20541 00000BF8 07                      	pop	es
 20542 00000BF9 BE[8A0B]                	mov	si,bmove
 20543 00000BFC B487                    	mov	ah,87h
 20544 00000BFE CD15                    	int	15h	; EXTENDED MEMORY - BLOCK MOVE (AT,XT286,PS)
 20545                                  			; CX = number of words to move 
 20546                                  			; ES:SI -> global descriptor table
 20547                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AH = status
 20548 00000C00 07                      	pop	es
 20549 00000C01 C3                      	retn

 20551                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20552                                  ;
 20553                                  ; procedure : SaveFreeHMAPtr
 20554                                  ;
 20555                                  ;		Save the Free HMA pointer in BIOS variable for later use.
 20556                                  ;		(INT 2f ax==4a01 call returns pointer to free HMA)
 20557                                  ;		Normalizes the pointer to ffff:xxxx format and stores only
 20558                                  ;		the offset.
 20559                                  ;
 20560                                  ; Inputs : ES:DI - pointer to free HMA
 20561                                  ; Output : FreeHMAPtr in BIOS data segment updated
 20562                                  ;
 20563                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20564                                  
 20565                                  SaveFreeHMAPtr:
 20566 00000C02 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es
 20567 00000C04 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh		; HMA segment
 20568 00000C07 29D8                    	sub	ax,bx
 20569 00000C09 83C70F                  	add	di,15			; para round
 20570 00000C0C 83E7F0                  	and	di,0FFF0h
 20571 00000C0F B104                    	mov	cl,4
 20572 00000C11 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 20573 00000C13 29C7                    	sub	di,ax
 20574 00000C15 1E                      	push	ds
 20575                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 20576                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h
 20577                                  	; 21/10/2022
 20578 00000C16 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 20579 00000C19 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 20580 00000C1B 893E[9608]              	mov	[FreeHMAPtr],di	   ; (ds:8F7h for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 20581 00000C1F C606[0D00]FF            	mov	byte [inHMA],0FFh  ; (ds:0Dh)
 20582 00000C24 1F                      	pop	ds
 20583 00000C25 C3                      	retn

 20590                                  ;		& INT 19 vector

 20612 00000C40 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax

 20614 00000C42 BE1300                  	mov	si,13h

 20620 00000C4D C3                      	retn			; returns the Zero flag

 20624                                  ; procedure : CPMHack
 20625                                  ;
 20626                                  ;		Copies the code from 0:c0 into ffff:0d0h
 20627                                  ;		for CPM compatibility
 20628                                  ;
 20629                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 20631                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20632                                  CPMHack:
 20633 00000C4E 1E                      	push	ds
 20634 00000C4F B9FFFF                  	mov	cx,0FFFFh
 20635 00000C52 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx		; ES = FFFF
 20636                                  	;xor	cx,cx
 20637                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20638 00000C54 41                      	inc	cx  ; cx = 0
 20639 00000C55 8ED9                    	mov	ds,cx		; DS = 0
 20640 00000C57 BEC000                  	mov	si,0C0h
 20641 00000C5A BFD000                  	mov	di,0D0h
 20642                                  	;mov	cx,5
 20643 00000C5D B105                    	mov	cl,5
 20644 00000C5F FC                      	cld
 20645 00000C60 F3A4                    	rep	movsb		; move 5 bytes from 0:C0 to FFFF:D0
 20646 00000C62 1F                      	pop	ds
 20647 00000C63 C3                      	retn

 20672                                  TempCDS:
 20673 00000C6D C43E[6D02]              	les	di,[DOSINFO]

 20685 00000C81 E8E604                  	call	ParaRound		; (ax) = paragraph size for CDSs
 20686 00000C84 8B36[A702]              	mov	si,[top_of_cdss] ; 31/12/2022
 20687                                  
 20688                                  ;	BUGBUG - we don't update confbot - won't someone else use it?
 20689                                  ;	chuckst -- answer: no. Confbot is used to access the CDSs,
 20690                                  ;	25 jul 92  which are stored BELOW it. Alloclim is the
 20691                                  ;		   variable which has the top of free memory for
 20692                                  ;		   device driver loads, etc.
 20693                                  
 20694 00000C88 29C6                    	sub	si,ax
 20695                                  
 20696                                  ;	chuckst, 25 Jul 92 -- note: I'm removing the code here
 20697                                  ;		that automatically updates alloclim every time we
 20698                                  ;		set up some new CDSs. Instead, I've added code
 20699                                  ;		which pre-allocates space for 26 CDSs. This
 20700                                  ;	        way we've got room for worst case CDSs before
 20701                                  ;		we place MagicDrv.sys
 20702                                  ;
 20703                                  ;	mov	[ALLOCLIM],si		; can't alloc past here!
 20704                                  
 20705                                  	; 30/12/2022
 20706                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 20707                                  	; (SYSINIT:0C52h)
 20708                                  	;mov	[ALLOCLIM],si ; (MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 20709                                  
 20710 00000C8A 26897518                	mov	[es:di+SYSI_CDS+2],si

 20712 00000C8E 89F0                    	mov	ax,si
 20713 00000C90 26C745160000            	mov	word [es:di+SYSI_CDS],0	; set address of CDS list
 20714                                  	;mov	[word es:di+16h],0
 20715                                  	;lds	si,[es:di+SYSI_DPB]	; (ds:si) = address of first DPB
 20716 00000C96 26C535                  	lds	si,[es:di]

 20718 00000C9B 31FF                    	xor	di,di			; (es:di) = address of 1st CDS
 20719                                  
 20720                                  ;*	Initialize our temporary CDSs. We'll init each CDS with the
 20721                                  ;	info from the corresponding DPB.
 20722                                  ;
 20723                                  ;	(cx) = count of CDSs left to process
 20724                                  ;	(es:di) = address of next CDS
 20725                                  
 20726                                  fooset:
 20727                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20728 00000C9D 2EA1[A902]              	mov	ax,[cs:DirStrng] ; "A:"
 20729 00000CA1 AB                      	stosw				; setup the root as the curdir
 20730                                  	
 20731                                  	; 23/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 20732                                  	;call	get_dpb_for_drive_al	; get dpb for drive in dpb
 20733                                  
 20734                                  	; 30/12/2022
 20735                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT:0D8Bh)
 20736 00000CA2 E85C00                  	call	get_dpb_for_drive_al	; get dpb for drive in dpb
 20737                                  
 20738                                  ;	(ds:si) = address of DPB
 20739                                  ;		 (si) = -1 if no drive
 20740                                  
 20741 00000CA5 2EA1[AB02]              	mov	ax,[cs:DirStrng+2] ; "\",0
 20742 00000CA9 AB                      	stosw
 20743 00000CAA 2EFE06[A902]            	inc	byte [cs:DirStrng]
 20744 00000CAF 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 20745 00000CB1 51                      	push	cx
 20746                                  	;mov	cx,curdir_list.cdir_flags - 4 ; 63
 20747 00000CB2 B93F00                  	mov	cx,63	; 23/10/2022
 20748 00000CB5 F3AA                    	rep	stosb			; zero out rest of CURDIR_TEXTs
 20749                                  
 20750                                  ;	should handle the system that does not have any floppies.
 20751                                  ;	in this case,we are going to pretended there are two dummy floppies
 20752                                  ;	in the system. still they have dpb and cds,but we are going to
 20753                                  ;	0 out curdir_flags,curdir_devptr of cds so ibmdos can issue
 20754                                  ;	"invalid drive specification" message when the user try to
 20755                                  ;	access them.
 20756                                  ;
 20757                                  ;	(ax) = 0
 20758                                  ;	(es:di) = CURDIR_FLAGS in the CDS records
 20759                                  ;	(ds:si) = Next DPB (-1 if none)
 20760                                  
 20761 00000CB7 83FEFF                  	cmp	si,-1	; cmp si,0FFFFh
 20762 00000CBA 7414                    	je	short fooset_zero	; don't have any physical drive.
 20763                                  
 20764                                  ;	check to see if we are faking floppy drives. if not go to normcds.
 20765                                  ;	if we are faking floppy drives then see if this cds being initialised
 20766                                  ;	is for drive a: or b: by checking the appropriate field in the dpb
 20767                                  ;	pointed to by ds:si. if not for a: or b: then go to normcds. if
 20768                                  ;	for a: or b: then execute the code given below starting at fooset_zero.
 20769                                  ;	for dpb offsets look at inc\dpb.inc.

 21529                                  
 21530                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 21531                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 21532                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 21533                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 21534                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 21535                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 21536                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 21537                                  ;
 21538                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 21539                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 21540                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 21541                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 21542                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 21543                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 21544                                  ;
 21545                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 21546                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 21547                                  ;
 21548                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 21549                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 21550                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 21551                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 21552                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 21553                                  ;
 21554                                  ;	for round-up machine
 21555                                  ;
 21556                                  ;			  none.
 21557                                  
 21558                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 21559                                  ;
 21560                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 21561                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 21562                                  
 21563                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21564                                  
 21565 00001001 50                      	push	ax
 21566 00001002 53                      	push	bx
 21567 00001003 52                      	push	dx
 21568 00001004 06                      	push	es
 21569                                  
 21570 00001005 B0FF                    	mov	al,0FFh 		;reset h/w by writing to port
 21571 00001007 BAF202                  	mov	dx,2F2h 		;get starting address
 21572 0000100A EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f2h,0ffh
 21573 0000100B 42                      	inc	dx
 21574 0000100C EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f3h,0ffh
 21575 0000100D 42                      	inc	dx
 21576 0000100E EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f4h,0ffh
 21577 0000100F 42                      	inc	dx
 21578 00001010 EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f5h,0ffh
 21579 00001011 42                      	inc	dx
 21580 00001012 EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f6h,0ffh
 21581 00001013 42                      	inc	dx
 21582 00001014 EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f7h,0ffh
 21583                                  
 21584                                  ;sb secondary global rearm
 21585                                  
 21586 00001015 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		;get machine type
 21587 00001018 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 21588 0000101A 26803EFEFFFC            	cmp	byte [es:0FFFEh],0FCh ;q:is it a at type machine
 21589 00001020 740D                    	je	short startrearm	; *if at no need to check
 21590                                  
 21591 00001022 B4C0                    	mov	ah,0C0h 		;get system configuration
 21592 00001024 CD15                    	int	15h			; *
 21593 00001026 7216                    	jc	short finishrearm	; *jmp if old rom
 21594                                  
 21595                                  ; test feature byte for secondary interrupt controller
 21596                                  
 21597 00001028 26F6470540              	test	byte [es:bx+5],40h
 21598                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21599                                  	;test	byte [es:bx+ROMBIOS_DESC.bios_sd_featurebyte1],ScndIntController
 21600 0000102D 740F                    	je	short finishrearm	;jmp if it is there
 21601                                  
 21602                                  startrearm:
 21603 0000102F B0FF                    	mov	al,0FFh 		;write any pattern to port
 21604 00001031 BAF206                  	mov	dx,6F2h 		;get starting address
 21605 00001034 EE                      	out	dx,al			;out 06f2h,0ffh
 21606 00001035 42                      	inc	dx			;bump address
 21607 00001036 EE                      	out	dx,al			;out 06f3h,0ffh
 21608 00001037 42                      	inc	dx			;bump address
 21609 00001038 EE                      	out	dx,al			;out 06f4h,0ffh
 21610 00001039 42                      	inc	dx			;bump address
 21611 0000103A 42                      	inc	dx			;bump address
 21612 0000103B EE                      	out	dx,al			;out 06f6h,0ffh
 21613 0000103C 42                      	inc	dx			;bump address
 21614 0000103D EE                      	out	dx,al			;out 06f7h,0ffh
 21615                                  
 21616                                  finishrearm:

 21769                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21770                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 21771                                  ;
 21772                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 21773                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 21774                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 21775                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 21776                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 21777                                  ; program).
 21778                                  
 21779                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 21780                                  
 21781                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 21782                                  
 21783 000010E9 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 21784                                  
 21785                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 21786                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 21787                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 21788                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 21789                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 21790                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 21791                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 21792                                  ; carridge return.
 21793                                  
 21794                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 21795                                  ;character after =.
 21796                                  
 21797 000010EA 06                      	push	es
 21798 000010EB 1E                      	push	ds
 21799 000010EC 07                      	pop	es
 21800 000010ED 1F                      	pop	ds			; es->sysinitseg,ds->confbot seg
 21801 000010EE 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 21802                                  
 21803 000010F0 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 21804 000010F2 FC                      	cld
 21805 000010F3 2EC606[F102]20          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],' ' ; clear out the parm area
 21806 000010F9 BF[F202]                	mov	di,ldexec_parm
 21807                                  installfilename:			; skip the file name
 21808 000010FC AC                      	lodsb				; al = ds:si; si++
 21809 000010FD 3C00                    	cmp	al,0
 21810 000010FF 7402                    	je	short got_installparm
 21811 00001101 EBF9                    	jmp	short installfilename
 21812                                  got_installparm:			; copy the parameters to ldexec_parm
 21813 00001103 AC                      	lodsb
 21814 00001104 268805                  	mov	[es:di],al
 21815 00001107 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf	; cmp al,0Ah	; line feed?
 21816 00001109 7405                    	je	short done_installparm
 21817 0000110B FEC1                    	inc	cl			; # of char. in the parm.
 21818 0000110D 47                      	inc	di
 21819 0000110E EBF3                    	jmp	short got_installparm
 21820                                  done_installparm:
 21821 00001110 2E880E[F002]            	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_line],cl ; length of the parm.
 21822 00001115 80F900                  	cmp	cl,0			; if no parm,then
 21823 00001118 7506                    	jne	short install_seg_set 	; let the parm area

 21825                                  					; starts with cr.

 21827 00001120 2EC70600000000          	mov	word [cs:0],0		; make a null environment segment
 21828 00001127 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs			; by overlap jmp instruction of sysinitseg.

 21930                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 21931                                  ;
 21932                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 21933                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 21934                                  ;
 21935                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 21936                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 21937                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 21938                                  
 21939                                  ParaRound:
 21940 0000116A 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 21941 0000116D D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 21942 0000116F D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21943 00001171 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21944 00001173 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21945 00001175 C3                      	retn

 21947                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21948                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 21949                                  ;
 21950                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 21951                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 21952                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 21953                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 21954                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 21955                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 21956                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 21957                                  ;
 21958                                  ;in: after relocation,
 21959                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 21960                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 21961                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 21962                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 21963                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 21964                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 21965                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 21966                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 21967                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 21968                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 21969                                  ;
 21970                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 21971                                  
 21972                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21973                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21974                                  sysinit_base:				
 21975 00001176 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 21976 0000117B 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 21977 00001180 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 21978 00001182 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 21979 00001187 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 21980 0000118C 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 21981 0000118D 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 21982 0000118E 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 21983                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 21984                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 21985 00001190 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 21986 00001193 263906[DA02]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 21987 00001198 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 21988                                  
 21989                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 21990                                  
 21991 0000119A B409                    	mov	ah,9
 21992 0000119C 0E                      	push	cs
 21993 0000119D 1F                      	pop	ds
 21994                                  	; 30/12/2022
 21995                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:12B8h)
 21996                                  	;mov	dx, 102
 21997 0000119E BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21998                                  					; 66h (for MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 21999 000011A1 CD21                    	int	21h
 22000                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 22001                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 22002                                  
 22003                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 22004                                  stall:
 22005                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22006                                  _stall: 
 22007                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22008 000011A3 F4                      	hlt 
 22009                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22010                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 22011 000011A4 EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 22012                                  
 22013                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 22014 000011A6 26FF2E[D602]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 22015                                  
 22016                                  ;-------------------------------------
 22017                                  
 22018                                  sum_up:
 22019                                  
 22020                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 22021                                  ;out:  ax - result
 22022                                  ;
 22023                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 22024                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 22025                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 22026                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 22027                                  ;
 22028                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 22029                                  
 22030 000011AB 1E                      	push	ds
 22031                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 22032                                  	; (SYSINIT:12C6h)
 22033 000011AC 26A1[A302]              	mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 22034                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22035                                  	;mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 22036 000011B0 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 22037 000011B2 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 22038 000011B4 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 22039 000011B6 268B0E[D002]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 22040                                  					; whole test better fail.
 22041 000011BB D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 22042 000011BD 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 22043                                  sum1:
 22044 000011BF 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 22045 000011C1 46                      	inc	si
 22046 000011C2 46                      	inc	si
 22047 000011C3 E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 22048                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 22049                                  sum_sys_code:
 22050                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22051 000011C5 BEC411                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22052                                  			    ; 532h (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22053                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 22054                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 22055                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 22056                                  	; 02/11/2022
 22057                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 22058                                  	; 30/12/2022  
 22059 000011C8 B9[204E]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 22060 000011CB 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 22061 000011CD D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 22062                                  sum2:
 22063 000011CF 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 22064 000011D2 46                      	inc	si
 22065 000011D3 46                      	inc	si
 22066 000011D4 E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 22067 000011D6 1F                      	pop	ds
 22068 000011D7 C3                      	retn
 22069                                  
 22070                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22071                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS 4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22072                                  ; (SYSINIT:12F2h)
 22073                                  
 22074                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 22075                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:			    ; = 62 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1290h) 	
 22076 000011D8 0000                    	dw	0
 22077                                  sysinit_base_sp equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 63 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1161h)
 22078                                  ;SYSINIT:11BFh:			    ; = 64 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1292h)
 22079 000011DA 0000                    	dw	0	
 22080                                  
 22081                                  mem_alloc_err_msgx:
 22082                                  
 22083                                         ;include msbio.cl4		; memory allocation error message
 22084                                  
 22085                                  ;SYSINIT:12F6:  ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS SYSINIT:12F6h
 22086 000011DC 0D0A                    	db	0Dh,0Ah
 22087 000011DE 4D656D6F727920616C-     	db 	'Memory allocation error $'
 22087 000011E7 6C6F636174696F6E20-

 22089                                  end_sysinit_base: ; label byte
 22090                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22091                                  	; (SYSINIT:11DCh for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 22092                                  
 22093                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22094                                  ; Set_Buffer
 22095                                  ;
 22096                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 22097                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 22098                                  ;
 22099                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 22100                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 22101                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 22102                                  ;
 22103                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 22104                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 22105                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22106                                  
 22107                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22108                                  	; (SYSINIT:11DCh)
 22109                                  
 22110                                  set_buffer:
 22111 000011F7 30D2                    	xor	dl,dl				; assume buffers not in HMA
 22112 000011F9 E85500                  	call	GetBufferAddr
 22113 000011FC 7402                    	jz	short set_buff_1
 22114 000011FE B201                    	mov	dl,1				; buffers in HMA
 22115                                  set_buff_1:
 22116                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22117                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue],di	; head of Buff Q
 22118 00001200 893F                    	mov	[bx],di
 22119                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue+2],es
 22120 00001202 8C4702                  	mov	[bx+2],es
 22121                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Dirty_Buff_Count],0 ;set dirty_count to 0.
 22122 00001205 C747040000              	mov	word [bx+4],0
 22123                                  
 22124 0000120A 89F8                    	mov	ax,di
 22125 0000120C 2E8B0E[9902]            	mov	cx,[cs:buffers]
 22126 00001211 57                      	push	di				; remember first buffer
 22127                                  
 22128                                  ;	for each buffer
 22129                                  
 22130                                  nxt_buff:
 22131 00001212 E86300                  	call	set_buffer_info 		; set buf_link,buf_id...
 22132 00001215 89C7                    	mov	di,ax
 22133 00001217 E2F9                    	loop	nxt_buff
 22134                                  
 22135 00001219 2E2B3E[9D02]            	sub	di,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; point to last buffer
 22136                                  
 22137 0000121E 59                      	pop	cx				; get first buffer
 22138                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],cx	; last->next = first
 22139 0000121F 26890D                  	mov	[es:di],cx
 22140 00001222 87CF                    	xchg	cx,di
 22141                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev],cx	; first->prev = last
 22142                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22143 00001224 26894D02                	mov	[es:di+2],cx
 22144                                  
 22145 00001228 08D2                    	or	dl,dl				; In HMa ?
 22146 0000122A 7417                    	jz	short set_buff_2		; no
 22147                                  	;mov	byte [bx+BUFFINF.Buff_In_HMA],1
 22148 0000122C C6470C01                	mov	byte [bx+12],1
 22149 00001230 2EA1[6403]              	mov	ax,[cs:memhi]			; seg of scratch buff
 22150                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff],0	; offset of sctarch buff is 0
 22151 00001234 C7470D0000              	mov	word [bx+13],0
 22152                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff+2],ax
 22153 00001239 89470F                  	mov	word [bx+15],ax
 22154 0000123C 2EA1[9D02]              	mov	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; size of scratch buff
 22155                                  	;sub	ax,bufinsiz ; 20		; buffer head not required
 22156 00001240 83E814                  	sub	ax,20
 22157                                  set_buff_2:
 22158 00001243 2E0106[6203]            	add	[cs:memlo],ax
 22159                                  	;or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],for_devmark ; 2
 22160 00001248 2E800E[E414]02          	or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],2
 22161                                  	;call	round
 22162                                  	;retn
 22163                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22164 0000124E E9BA30                  	jmp	round
 22165                                  
 22166                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22167                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 22168                                  ;
 22169                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 22170                                  ;
 22171                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 22172                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 22173                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22174                                  
 22175                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 22176                                  GetBufferAddr:
 22177 00001251 53                      	push	bx
 22178 00001252 52                      	push	dx
 22179 00001253 2EA1[9D02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 22180 00001257 2EF726[9902]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 22181                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 22182 0000125C 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 22183                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22184                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 22185                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22186 0000125F 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 22187 00001261 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 22188 00001263 B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 22189                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 22190 00001266 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 22191 00001268 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 22192 0000126B 7508                    	jne	short got_hma
 22193 0000126D BF0000                  	mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 22194                                  	;zf=1
 22195                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 22196                                  	;zf=1
 22197 00001270 2E8E06[6403]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 22198                                  got_hma:
 22199 00001275 5A                      	pop	dx
 22200 00001276 5B                      	pop	bx
 22201 00001277 C3                      	retn
 22202                                  
 22203                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22204                                  
 22205                                  set_buffer_info:
 22206                                  
 22207                                  ;function: set buf_link,buf_id,buf_sector
 22208                                  ;
 22209                                  ;in: es:di -> buffer header to be set.
 22210                                  ;    ax = di
 22211                                  ;
 22212                                  ;out:
 22213                                  ;    above entries set.
 22214                                  
 22215                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 22216 00001278 2EFF36[BD02]            	push	word [cs:buf_prev_off]
 22217                                  	;pop	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev]
 22218 0000127D 268F4502                	pop	word [es:di+2]
 22219 00001281 2EA3[BD02]              	mov	[cs:buf_prev_off],ax
 22220 00001285 2E0306[9D02]            	add	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	;adjust ax
 22221                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],ax
 22222 0000128A 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax
 22223                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_ID],00FFh  ; new buffer free
 22224 0000128D 26C74504FF00            	mov	word [es:di+4],00FFh
 22225                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector],0   ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 22226 00001293 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0
 22227                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector+2],0 ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 22228 00001299 26C745080000            	mov	word [es:di+8],0
 22229 0000129F C3                      	retn
 22230                                  
 22231                                  ; ======================================================================
 22232                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 22233                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22234                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22235                                  
 22236                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22237                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 22238                                  ;
 22239                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 22240                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 22241                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 22242                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 22243                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 22244                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 22245                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 22246                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 22247                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 22248                                  ;
 22249                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 22250                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 22251                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 22252                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 22253                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 22254                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 22255                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 22256                                  ;	conditions:
 22257                                  ;
 22258                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 22259                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 22260                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 22261                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 22262                                  ;
 22263                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 22264                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 22265                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 22266                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 22267                                  ;
 22268                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 22269                                  ;
 22270                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 22271                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 22272                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 22273                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 22274                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 22275                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 22276                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 22277                                  ;	interrupt line.
 22278                                  ;
 22279                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 22280                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 22281                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 22282                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 22283                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 22284                                  ;
 22285                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 22286                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 22287                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 22288                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 22289                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 22290                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 22291                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 22292                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 22293                                  ;
 22294                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 22295                                  
 22296                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22297                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 22298                                  
 22299                                  	; 14/12/2022
 22300                                  stackinit:
 22301 000012A0 50                      	push	ax
 22302 000012A1 1E                      	push	ds
 22303 000012A2 06                      	push	es
 22304 000012A3 53                      	push	bx
 22305 000012A4 51                      	push	cx
 22306 000012A5 52                      	push	dx
 22307 000012A6 57                      	push	di
 22308 000012A7 56                      	push	si
 22309 000012A8 55                      	push	bp
 22310                                  
 22311                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 22312                                  
 22313                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22314                                  	; ds = cs
 22315 000012A9 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 22316 000012AC 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 22317                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22318                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 22319                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 22320 000012AE 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 22321                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 22322 000012B2 A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 22323 000012B5 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 22324                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22325 000012B9 A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 22326                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22327                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 22328                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 22329 000012BC 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 22330                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22331 000012C0 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 22332 000012C2 A1[9202]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]
 22333                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22334                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 22335                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 22336 000012C5 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 22337                                  
 22338                                  ; initialize the data fields with the parameters
 22339                                  
 22340                                  ; "firstentry" will always be at stacks
 22341                                  
 22342                                  	;mov	bp,[es:stacks]			; get offset of stack
 22343                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22344                                  	; bp = [es:stacks] ; *!*
 22345 000012C9 26892E[0C00]            	mov	[es:firstentry],bp
 22346                                  
 22347                                  ; the stacks will always immediately follow the table entries
 22348                                  
 22349 000012CE B80800                  	mov	ax,entrysize ; 8
 22350                                  	;mov	cx,[es:stackcount]
 22351                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22352                                  	; cx = [es:stackcount] ; *!*!*
 22353 000012D1 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 22354 000012D3 01E8                    	add	ax,bp
 22355 000012D5 26A3[0400]              	mov	[es:stackat],ax
 22356 000012D9 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 22357 000012DB 83EB02                  	sub	bx,2
 22358                                  
 22359                                  ; zero the entire stack area to start with
 22360                                  
 22361 000012DE 268B3E[0400]            	mov	di,[es:stackat]
 22362 000012E3 26A1[0600]              	mov	ax,[es:stacksize]
 22363 000012E7 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 22364 000012E9 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 22365 000012EB 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 22366 000012ED 06                      	push	es
 22367 000012EE 1F                      	pop	ds				;ds = relocated stack code seg.
 22368                                  
 22369                                  ;now, ds -> stack code area
 22370                                  
 22371 000012EF 8E06[0A00]              	mov	es,[stacks+2]			; get segment of stack area.
 22372 000012F3 FC                      	cld
 22373 000012F4 F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 22374                                  
 22375 000012F6 8B0E[0200]              	mov	cx,[stackcount]
 22376                                  
 22377                                  ; loop for "count" times, building a table entry
 22378                                  ;  cs = sysinitseg, ds = relocated stack code seg, es = segment of stack space
 22379                                  ;  cx = number of entries
 22380                                  ;  es:bp => base of stacks - 2
 22381                                  ;  es:bx => first table entry
 22382                                  
 22383                                  buildloop:
 22384                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22385                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free	; mov [es:bp+0],0

 22390 000012FE 26884601                	mov	[es:bp+intlevel],al	; ax = 0
 22391                                  	;mov	[es:bp+1],al
 22392 00001302 26894602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],ax
 22393                                  	;mov	[es:bp2],ax
 22394 00001306 26894604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ax
 22395                                  	;mov	[es:bp+4],ax
 22396 0000130A 031E[0600]              	add	bx,[stacksize]
 22397 0000130E 26895E06                	mov	[es:bp+newsp],bx		; mov [es:bp+6],bx
 22398                                  	;mov	[es:bp+6],bx

 22400 00001315 83C508                  	add	bp,entrysize ; 8
 22401

 22403                                  
 22404 0000131A 83ED08                  	sub	bp,entrysize ; 8

 22407

 22409 00001326 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		;look at the model byte

 22418                                  skip_disablenmis:
