 23141                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 23142                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 23143                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 23144                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 23145                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 23146                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 23147                                  
 23148 00001494 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 23149 00001497 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 23150 00001499 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 23151 0000149D 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 23152                                  
 23153 000014A0 1E                      	push	ds
 23154                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 23155                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 23156                                  	; 21/10/2022
 23157 000014A1 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 23158 000014A4 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 23159 000014A6 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 23160 000014A9 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 23161 000014AB 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 23162 000014AF 894502                  	mov	word [di+2],ax
 23163 000014B2 1F                      	pop	ds
 23164                                  
 23165 000014B3 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 23166 000014B6 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 23167 000014BA C3                      	retn
 23168                                  
 23169                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 23170                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23171                                  
 23172                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23173                                  ;set the devmark for mem command.
 23174                                  ;in: [memhi] - the address to place devmark
 23175                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 23176                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 23177                                  ;out: devmark established.
 23178                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 23179                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.
 23180                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23181                                  
 23182                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23183                                  ; (SYSINIT:1637h)
 23184                                  
 23185                                  setdevmark:
 23186                                  
 23187 000014BB 06                      	push	es
 23188 000014BC 51                      	push	cx
 23189                                  
 23190 000014BD 2E8B0E[6403]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]
 23191 000014C2 2E890E[E214]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 23192 000014C7 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 23193                                  	; 25/10/2022
 23194                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 23195 000014C9 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 23196 000014CD 41                      	inc	cx
 23197                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 23198 000014CE 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 23199                                  
 23200 000014D3 59                      	pop	cx
 23201 000014D4 07                      	pop	es
 23202 000014D5 2EFF06[6403]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 23203 000014DA C3                      	retn
 23204

 23406                                  ; PARMS 	LABEL	BYTE
 23407                                  ;		DW	PARMSX
 23408                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 23409                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 23410                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 23411                                  ;					; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="
 23412                                  ;					; "," & WHITESPACE ALWAYS
 23413                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 23414                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA END OF LINE LIST, CR, LF OR 0 ALWAYS
 23415                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23416                                  
 23417                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMS block structure
 23418                                  struc _$P_PARMS_Blk
 23419 00000000 ????                     .PARMSX_Address:  resw 1		;AN000; Address of PARMSX

 23421 00000003 ??                       .Len_Extra_Delim: resb 1		;AN000; Length of extra delimiter
 23422                                  endstruc

 23426                                  _$P_I_Have_Delim   equ	1		;AN000; extra delimiter specified
 23427                                  _$P_I_Have_EOL	   equ	2		;AN000; extra EOL specified
 23428                                  
 23429                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23430                                  ; PARMSX	LABEL	BYTE
 23431                                  ;		DB	minp,maxp	; MIN, MAX POSITIONAL OPERANDS ALLOWED

 23434                                  ;		DB	maxs		; # OF SWITCHES
 23435                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF SWITCH 1
 23436                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxs-1 TIMES

 23441                                  
 23442                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMSX block structure
 23443                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 23444 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 23445 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 23446 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 23447                                  endstruc
 23448                                  
 23449                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23450                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 23451                                  ;
 23452                                  ;
 23453                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 23454                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 23455                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23456                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23457                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23458                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23459                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23460                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23461                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23462                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23463                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23464                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 23465                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 23466                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 23467                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 23468                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 23469                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 23470                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 23471                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 23472                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 23473                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 23474                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 23475                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 23476                                  ;	   :
 23477                                  ;
 23478                                  ;Note:
 23479                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 23480                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 23481                                  ;
 23482                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 23483                                  ;
 23484                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 23485                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 23486                                  ;
 23487                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 23488                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 23489                                  ;
 23490                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 23491                                  ;
 23492                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 23493                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 23494                                  ;
 23495                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23496                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 23497                                  ;
 23498                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 23499                                  ;
 23500                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23501                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 23502                                  ;
 23503                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23504                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23505                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23506                                  ;
 23507                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 23508                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 23509                                  ;
 23510                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 23511                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 23512                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 23513                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23514                                  
 23515                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 23516                                  
 23517                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 23518                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 23519                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 23520                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 23521                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 23522                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 23523                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 23524                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 23525                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 23526                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 23527                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 23528                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 23529                                  
 23530                                  ;**** Function flags
 23531                                  
 23532                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 23533                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 23534                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 23535                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 23536                                  
 23537                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 23538                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 23539 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 23540 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 23541 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 23542 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 23543 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 23544 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 23545                                  endstruc
 23546                                  
 23547                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23548                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 23549                                  ;
 23550                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 23551                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 23552                                  ;	     +-
 23553                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 23554                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 23555                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 23556                                  ;	     |	:
 23557                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23558                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 23559                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 23560                                  ;	     |	:
 23561                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23562                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 23563                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 23564                                  ;	     +-	:
 23565                                  ;
 23566                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 23567                                  ;
 23568                                  ;Note:
 23569                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 23570                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 23571                                  ;
 23572                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23573                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23574                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23575                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23576                                  
 23577                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 23578                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 23579                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 23580                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 23581                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 23582                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 23583                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 23584                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 23585                                  
 23586                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 23587 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 23588 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 23589 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 23590 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 23591 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 23592                                  endstruc
 23593                                  
 23594                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23595                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 23596                                  ;
 23597                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 23598                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 23599                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 23600                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 23601                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 23602                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 23603                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 23604                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 23605                                  ;
 23606                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 23607                                  ;
 23608                                  ;            +-
 23609                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 23610                                  ;	    | or
 23611                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 23612                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 23613                                  ;	    | or
 23614                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 23615                                  ;	    | or
 23616                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 23617                                  ;	    | or
 23618                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 23619                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 23620                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 23621                                  ;	    | or
 23622                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 23623                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 23624                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 23625                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 23626                                  ;	    +-
 23627                                  ;
 23628                                  ;
 23629                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 23630                                  ;      list.
 23631                                  ;
 23632                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 23633                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 23634                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 23635                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23636                                  
 23637                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure
 23638                                  struc _$P_Result_Blk
 23639 00000000 ??                       .Type:        resb 1		;AN000; Type returned
 23640 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 23641 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 23642 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 23643                                  endstruc
 23644

 23650                                  _$P_List_Idx	   equ	2		;AN000; List Index
 23651                                  _$P_String	   equ	3		;AN000; String
 23652                                  _$P_Complex	   equ	4		;AN000; Complex
 23653                                  _$P_File_Spec	   equ	5		;AN000; File Spec
 23654                                  _$P_Drive	   equ	6		;AN000; Drive

 23660

 23666                                  _$P_Too_Many	   equ	1		;AN000; Too many operands
 23667                                  _$P_Op_Missing	   equ	2		;AN000; Required operand missing
 23668                                  _$P_Not_In_SW	   equ	3		;AN000; Not in switch list provided
 23669                                  _$P_Not_In_Key	   equ	4		;AN000; Not in keyword list provided
 23670                                  _$P_Out_Of_Range   equ	6		;AN000; Out of range specified
 23671                                  _$P_Not_In_Val	   equ	7		;AN000; Not in value list provided
 23672                                  _$P_Not_In_Str	   equ	8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 23673                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error
 23674                                  _$P_RC_EOL	   equ	-1		;AN000; End of command line

 23760                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23761                                  ; SysParse;
 23762                                  ;
 23763                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 23764                                  ;
 23765                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 23766                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 23767                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 23768                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 23769                                  ;
 23770                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 23771                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 23772                                  ;		 is in DS.
 23773                                  ;
 23774                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 23775                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 23776                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 23777                                  ;
 23778                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 23779                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 23780                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 23781                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 23782                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 23783                                  ;
 23784                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 23785                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 23786                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 23787                                  ;
 23788                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 23789                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 23790                                  ;
 23791                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 23792                                  ;
 23793                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 23794                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 23795                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 23796                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 23797                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 23798                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 23799                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 23800                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 23801                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 23802                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 23803                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 23804                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 23805                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 23806                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 23807                                  ;	     (tm08)
 23808                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 23809                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 23810                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 23811                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 23812                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 23813                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 23814                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 23815                                  ;					  (tm12)
 23816                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 23817                                  ;					  (tm13)
 23818                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 23819                                  ;					  (tm14)
 23820                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 23821                                  ;					  (tm15)
 23822                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 23823                                  
 23824                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 23825                                  
 23826                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 23827                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 23828                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 23829                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 23830                                  
 23831                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 23832                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 23833                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 23834                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 23835                                  ;
 23836                                  
 23837                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 23838                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 23839                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 23840                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 23841                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 23842                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 23843                                  
 23844                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 23845                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 23846                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 23847                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 23848                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 23849                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 23850                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 23851                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 23852                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 23853                                  
 23854                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 23855                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 23856                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 23857                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 23858                                  ;	     segment.
 23859                                  
 23860                                  ;  9/16/87 : Ed K (;AN023;) PTM1040
 23861                                  ;	     in _$P_set_cdi PROC, it assumes CS points to psdata. Change Push CS
 23862                                  ;	     into PUSH cs.  In _$P_Get_DecNum PROC, fix AN020
 23863                                  ;	     forced both TIME and DATE to use the delims, "-","/",".".
 23864                                  ;	     Created FLag, in _$P_time_Format PROC, to request the delim in
 23865                                  ;	     BL be used if TIME is being parsed.
 23866                                  
 23867                                  ;  9/24/87 : Ed K
 23868                                  ;	     Removed the include to STRUC.INC.	Replaced the STRUC macro
 23869                                  ;	     invocations with their normally expanded code; made comments
 23870                                  ;	     out of the STRUC macro invocation statements to maintain readability.
 23871

 23873                                  ;	     When no CONTROL for a keyword found, tried to fill in RESULT

 23875

 23877                                  ;	     A quoted text string can be framed only by double quote.  Remove
 23878                                  ;	     support to frame quoted text string with single quote.

 23880                                  ;	     _$P_SQuote EQU also removed from PSDATA.INC.  Any references to
 23881                                  ;	     single quote in PROC prologues are left as is for history reasons.
 23882                                  
 23883                                  ;	     This fixes another bug, not mentioned in p1672, in that two
 23884                                  ;	     quote chars within a quoted string is supposed to be reported as
 23885                                  ;	     one quote character, but is reported as two quotes.  This changed
 23886                                  ;	     two instructions in PROC _$P_Quoted_Str.
 23887

 23889                                  ;	     have the SHORT operator to avoid the unneeded NOP.

 23956 00001590 2EC706[F714]0000        	mov	word [cs:_$P_Flags],0	;AC034; Clear all internal flags
 23957 00001597 FC                      	cld				;AN000; confirm forward direction
 23958 00001598 2E890E[EA14]            	mov	word [cs:_$P_ORDINAL],cx ;AC034; save operand ordinal
 23959 0000159D 2EC706[EC14]0000        	mov	word [cs:_$P_RC],_$P_No_Error ;AC034; Assume no error

 23964                                  ;M029 -- Begin changes
 23965                                  ; The table of special chars _$P_FileSp_Char should be initialized on every
 23966                                  ;entry to SysParse. This is in the non-checksum region and any program that
 23967                                  ;corrupts this table but does not corrupt the checksum region will leave
 23968                                  ;command.com parsing in an inconsistent state.
 23969                                  ; NB: The special characters string has been hardcoded here. If any change
 23970                                  ;is made to it in psdata.inc, a corresponding change needs to be made here.
 23971                                  
 23972                                  ;IF FileSW + DrvSW
 23973 000015B2 2EC706[8615]5D5B        	mov	word [cs:_$P_FileSp_Char], ']['
 23974 000015B9 2EC706[8815]3C7C        	mov	word [cs:_$P_FileSp_Char+2], '<|'
 23975 000015C0 2EC706[8A15]2B3E        	mov	word [cs:_$P_FileSp_Char+4], '+>'
 23976 000015C7 2EC706[8C15]3B3D        	mov 	word [cs:_$P_FileSp_Char+6], ';='
 23977                                  ;ENDIFtHHH

 24395                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24396                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 24397                                  ;
 24398                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 24399                                  ;
 24400                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 24401                                  ;	    AL = type
 24402                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 24403                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 24404                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 24405                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 24406                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 24407                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 24408                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 24409                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24410                                  ;
 24411                                  ; Output:   None
 24412                                  ;
 24413                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 24414                                  ;
 24415                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)
 24416                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24417                                  
 24418                                  _$P_Fill_Result:
 24419 000017C6 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 24420 000017C7 268B7F04                	mov	di,[es:bx+_$P_Control_Blk.Result_Buf]
 24421                                  					;AN000; di points to result buffer
 24422 000017CB 2E893E[F014]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DX],di		;AC034; set returned result address
 24423 000017D0 268805                  	mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Type],al ;AN000; store type
 24424 000017D3 26886501                	mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Item_Tag],ah ;AN000; store item tag
 24425 000017D7 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24426 000017D8 2EA1[FF14]              	mov	ax,[cs:_$P_Found_SYNONYM] ;AC034; if yes,
 24427 000017DC 26894502                	mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.SYNONYM_Ptr],ax 
 24428                                  					;AN000;   then set it to the result
 24429 000017E0 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 24430                                  _$P_RLT04:				;AN000;
 24431 000017E1 3C01                    	cmp	al,_$P_Number		;AN000; if number
 24432 000017E3 750A                    	jne	short _$P_RLT00		;AN000;
 24433                                  
 24434                                  _$P_RLT02:				;AN000;

 24437 000017ED EB5A                    	jmp	short _$P_RLT_Exit	;AN000;
 24438

 24445 000017F7 EB50                    	jmp	short _$P_RLT_Exit	;AN000;
 24446                                  
 24447                                  _$P_RLT01:				;AN000;
 24448 000017F9 3C07                    	cmp	al,_$P_Date_F		;AN000; Date format ?

 24450

 24453

 24455 00001803 7506                    	jne	short _$P_RLT03		;AN000;
 24456                                  
 24457 00001805 26885504                	mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Picked_Val],dl ;AN000; store drive number
 24458 00001809 EB3E                    	jmp	short _$P_RLT_Exit	;AN000;
 24459                                  
 24460                                  _$P_RLT03:				;AN000;
 24461 0000180B 3C04                    	cmp	al,_$P_Complex		;AN000; complex format ?
 24462 0000180D 750F                    	jne	short _$P_RLT05		;AN000;
 24463                                  
 24464 0000180F 2EA1[F914]              	mov	ax,[cs:_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx] ;AC034; then get pointer in command buffer
 24465 00001813 40                      	inc	ax			;AN000; skip left Parentheses
 24466 00001814 26894504                	mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Picked_Val],ax ;AN000; store offset
 24467 00001818 268C5D06                	mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Picked_Val+2],ds ;AN000; store segment
 24468 0000181C EB2B                    	jmp	short _$P_RLT_Exit	;AN000;
 24469                                  
 24470                                  _$P_RLT05:				;AN000;
 24471                                  ;------------------------  AL = 3, 5, or 9

 24476 00001826 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24477 00001827 26F6470201              	test	byte [es:bx+_$P_Control_Blk.Function_Flag],_$P_CAP_File

 24503                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24504                                  ; _$P_Check_Match_Flags
 24505                                  ;
 24506                                  ; Function:  Check the mutch_flags and make the exit code and set the
 24507                                  ;	     result buffer
 24508                                  ;
 24509                                  ;	    Check for types in this order:
 24510                                  ;		Complex
 24511                                  ;		Date
 24512                                  ;		Time
 24513                                  ;		Drive
 24514                                  ;		Filespec
 24515                                  ;		Quoted String
 24516                                  ;		Simple String
 24517                                  ;
 24518                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 24519                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24520                                  ;
 24521                                  ; Output:    None
 24522                                  ;
 24523                                  ; Use:	     _$P_Value, P$_SValue, _$P_Simple_String, _$P_Date_Format
 24524                                  ;	     _$P_Time_Format, _$P_Complex_Format, _$P_File_Foemat
 24525                                  ;	     _$P_Drive_Format
 24526                                  ;***********************************************************************

 24528                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0

 24629                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24630                                  ; _$P_Remove_Colon;
 24631                                  ;
 24632                                  ; Function: Remove colon at end
 24633                                  ;
 24634                                  ; Input:    cs:SI points to string buffer to be examineed
 24635                                  ;
 24636                                  ; Output:   None
 24637                                  ;
 24638                                  ; Use:	_$P_Chk_DBCS
 24639                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24640                                  
 24641                                  _$P_Remove_Colon:
 24642 000018F7 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24643 000018F8 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 24644                                  _$P_RCOL_Loop:				;AN000;
 24645 000018F9 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get character
 24646 000018FC 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of string ?
 24647 000018FE 741A                    	jz	short _$P_RCOL_Exit	;AN000; if yes, just exit
 24648                                  
 24649 00001900 3C3A                    	cmp	al,_$P_Colon		;AN000; is it colon ?
 24650 00001902 750D                    	jne	short _$P_RCOL00	;AN000;
 24651                                  
 24652 00001904 2E807C0100              	cmp	byte [cs:si+1],_$P_NULL ;AN000; if so, next is NULL ?
 24653 00001909 7506                    	jne	short _$P_RCOL00	;AN000; no, then next char
 24654                                  
 24655 0000190B 2EC60400                	mov	byte [cs:si],_$P_NULL	;AN000; yes, remove colon
 24656 0000190F EB09                    	jmp	short _$P_RCOL_Exit	;AN000; and exit.
 24657                                  
 24658                                  _$P_RCOL00:				;AN000;
 24659 00001911 E81504                  	call	_$P_Chk_DBCS		;AN000; if not colon, then check if
 24660 00001914 7301                    	jnc	short _$P_RCOL01	;AN000; DBCS leading byte.
 24661                                  
 24662 00001916 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; if yes, skip trailing byte
 24663                                  _$P_RCOL01:				;AN000;
 24664 00001917 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; si points to next byte
 24665 00001918 EBDF                    	jmp	short _$P_RCOL_Loop	;AN000; loop until NULL encountered
 24666                                  
 24667                                  _$P_RCOL_Exit:				;AN000;
 24668 0000191A 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 24669 0000191B 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 24670 0000191C C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 24672                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24673                                  ; _$P_Do_CAPS_String;
 24674                                  ;
 24675                                  ; Function: Perform capitalization along with the file case map table
 24676                                  ;	    or character case map table.
 24677                                  ;
 24678                                  ; Input:    AL = 2 : Use character table
 24679                                  ;	    AL = 4 : Use file table
 24680                                  ;	    cs:SI points to string buffer to be capitalized
 24681                                  ;
 24682                                  ; Output:   None
 24683                                  ;
 24684                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_Char, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 24685                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24686                                  
 24687                                  _$P_Do_CAPS_String:
 24688 0000191D 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 24689 0000191E 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 24690 0000191F 88C2                    	mov	dl,al			;AN000; save info id
 24691                                  
 24692                                  _$P_DCS_Loop:				;AN000;
 24693 00001921 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; load charater and
 24694 00001924 E80204                  	call	_$P_Chk_DBCS		;AN000; check if DBCS leading byte
 24695 00001927 720C                    	jc	short _$P_DCS00		;AN000; if yes, do not need CAPS
 24696                                  
 24697 00001929 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of string ?
 24698 0000192B 740C                    	jz	short _$P_DCS_Exit	;AN000; then exit.
 24699                                  
 24700 0000192D E80C00                  	call	_$P_Do_CAPS_Char 	;AN000; Here a SBCS char need to be CAPS
 24701 00001930 2E8804                  	mov	[cs:si],al		;AN000; stored upper case char to buffer
 24702 00001933 EB01                    	jmp	short _$P_DCS01		;AN000; process next
 24703                                  _$P_DCS00:				;AN000;
 24704 00001935 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip DBCS leading and trailing byte
 24705                                  _$P_DCS01:				;AN000;
 24706 00001936 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; si point to next byte
 24707 00001937 EBE8                    	jmp	short _$P_DCS_Loop	;AN000; loop until NULL encountered
 24708                                  _$P_DCS_Exit:				;AN000;
 24709 00001939 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 24710 0000193A 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 24711 0000193B C3                      	retn

 24713                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24714                                  ; _$P_Do_CAPS_Char;
 24715                                  ;
 24716                                  ; Function: Perform capitalization along with the file case map table
 24717                                  ;	    or character case map table.
 24718                                  ;
 24719                                  ; Input:    DL = 2 : Use character table
 24720                                  ;	    DL = 4 : Use file table
 24721                                  ;	    AL = character to be capitalized

 24806                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24807                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 24808                                  ;
 24809                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 24810                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 24811                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 24812                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 24813                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 24814                                  ;
 24815                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 24816                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24817                                  ;
 24818                                  ; Output:    None
 24819                                  ;
 24820                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 24821                                  ;
 24822                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 24823                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24824                                  
 24825                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24826                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 24827                                  
 24828                                  	; 07/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 24829                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1C46h)  	
 24830                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 24831 0000197E 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24832 0000197F 2E800E[F814]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 24833 00001985 2E8026[F814]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 24834                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],~_$P_Neg ; 07/07/2023 
 24835 0000198B 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 24836 0000198E 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 24837 00001990 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 24838                                  
 24839 00001992 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?
 24840 00001994 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Sval01	;AN000; else
 24841                                  
 24842 00001996 2E800E[F814]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 24843                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;
 24844 0000199C 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip sign char
 24845                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 24846 0000199D E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
 24847 000019A0 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 24848 000019A1 C3                      	retn

 24875                                  ; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 24876                                  ; Ref: Disassembled PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM SYSINIT code
 24877                                  ;				Erdogan Tan - July 2023 
 24878                                  %if 0
 24879                                  	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 2*x
 24880                                  	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 24881                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 24882                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 24883                                  
 24884                                  	mov	bx,dx			;AN000; save low(2*x)
 24885                                  	mov	ax,cx			;AN000; save high(2*x)

 24888                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?

 24892                                  	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 24893                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 24894                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 24895

 24897                                  	adc	cx,ax			;AN000; 32bit ADD

 24899                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 24900

 24902                                  	adc	cx,0			;AN000; if carry, add 1 to high 16bit
 24903                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 24904                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 24905                                  
 24906                                  	inc	si			;AN000; update pointer
 24907                                  	jmp	short _$P_Value_Loop	;AN000; loop until NULL encountered
 24908                                  ;_$P_Value_Err0:
 24909                                  %endif

 25101                                  ; _$P_Check_OVF
 25102                                  ;
 25103                                  ; Function:  Check if overflow is occurred with consideration of
 25104                                  ;	     signed or un-signed numeric value
 25105                                  ;
 25106                                  ; Input:     Flag register
 25107                                  ;
 25108                                  ; Output:    CY = 1  :	Overflow
 25109                                  ;
 25110                                  ; Vars:     _$P_Flags(R)

 25749                                  ; _$P_Chk_Delim;
 25750                                  ;
 25751                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of delimiter characters.

 25850                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25851                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 25852                                  ;
 25853                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 25854                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 25855                                  ;
 25856                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 25857                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 25858                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 25859                                  ;
 25860                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 25861                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 25862                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 25863                                  
 25864                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 25865                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 25866                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 25867                                  ;
 25868                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 25869                                  
 25870                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 25871                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25872                                  
 25873                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 25874                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 25875                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 25876                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25877 00001D10 BD[0115]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 25878                                  
 25879                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 25880 00001D13 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 25881 00001D15 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 25882                                  
 25883                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 25884 00001D17 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 25885 00001D19 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 25886                                  
 25887 00001D1B F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 25888                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 25889                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25890 00001D1C C3                      	retn
 25891                                  
 25892                                  ; 12/12/2022
 25893                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 25894                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 25895                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 25896                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 25897                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 25898                                  
 25899                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 25900                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 25901 00001D1D 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 25902 00001D1F 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 25903                                  
 25904 00001D21 2E800E[F814]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020 ;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 25905                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 25906                                  
 25907                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25908                                  	; cf=0
 25909                                  	;retn
 25910                                  
 25911                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 25912                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25913                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 25914 00001D27 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 25915                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 25916                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 25917 00001D28 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 25918                                  
 25919                                  ;**************************************************************************
 25920                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 25921                                  ;
 25922                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 25923                                  ;
 25924                                  ;  Input:
 25925                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 25926                                  ;
 25927                                  ;  Output:
 25928                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 25929                                  ;
 25930                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 25931                                  ;
 25932                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 25933                                  ;***************************************************************************
 25934                                  
 25935                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 25936 00001D29 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 25937 00001D2A 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 25938 00001D2B 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25939                                  	;cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 25940                                  	;jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 25941                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25942 00001D2C 2E8B36[F514]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]
 25943 00001D31 21F6                    	and	si,si ; 0 ?
 25944 00001D33 7525                    	jnz	short _$P_DBCS00 ; already set
 25945 00001D35 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25946 00001D36 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25947 00001D37 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25948 00001D38 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 25949 00001D39 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 25950 00001D3A 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 25951 00001D3B 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 25952                                  	; si = 0 ; 08/07/2023
 25953                                  	;xor	si,si			;AN000;
 25954 00001D3C 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si ; 0		;AN000;
 25955 00001D3E B80063                  	mov	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 25956 00001D41 CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 25957                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 25958 00001D43 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25959 00001D45 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25960 00001D47 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 25961 00001D48 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 25962 00001D49 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 25963 00001D4A 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 25964 00001D4B 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 25965 00001D4C 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25966 00001D4D 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 25967 00001D4E 7424                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 25968                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 25969 00001D50 2E8936[F314]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 25970 00001D55 2E891E[F514]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 25971                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 25972                                  	;mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 25973                                  	;mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 25974                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25975 00001D5A 2EC536[F314]            	lds	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]
 25976                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 25977 00001D5F 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 25978 00001D62 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 25979 00001D64 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 25980 00001D66 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 25981 00001D68 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 25982 00001D6B 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 25983 00001D6D F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 25984 00001D6E EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 25985                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 25986 00001D70 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 25987 00001D71 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 25988                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 25989 00001D72 EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 25990                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 25991                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25992                                  	; cf=0
 25993                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 25994                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 25995 00001D74 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25996 00001D75 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 25997 00001D76 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 25998 00001D77 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 26562                                  
 26563                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 26564                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26565                                  
 26566                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 26567                                  ;
 26568                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 26569                                  ;
 26570                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26571                                  ;
 26572                                  ;   Modification log:
 26573                                  ;
 26574                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 26575                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 26576                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 26577                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 26578                                  ;
 26579                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26580                                  ;
 26581                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 26582                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 26583                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 26584                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 26585                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 26586                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 26587                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 26588                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 26589                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 26590                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 26591                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 26592                                  ;
 26593                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26594                                  
 26595                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 26596                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 26597                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 26598                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 26599                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 26600                                  
 26601                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 26602                                  
 26603                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 26604                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 26605                                  
 26606                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 26607                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 26608                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 26609                                  
 26610                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 26611                                  ;
 26612                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 26613                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 26614                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 26615                                  ;	           line.
 26616                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 26617                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 26618                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 26619                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 26620                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 26621                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 26622                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 26623                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 26624                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 26625                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 26626                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 26627                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 26628                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 26629                                  ;	           for details).
 26630                                  
 26631 00001F77 00                      fInHigh:  db	0
 26632 00001F78 00                      fUmbTiny: db	0
 26633 00001F79 0000                    SegLoad:  dw	0
 26634 00001F7B 00                      UmbLoad:  db	0
 26635 00001F7C 00<rep 10h>             UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 26636 00001F8C 0000<rep 10h>           UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 26637 00001FAC 00                      fm_umb:   db	0
 26638 00001FAD 00                      fm_strat: db	0
 26639 00001FAE 00                      fm_argc:  db	0	
 26640                                  
 26641                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 26642                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 26643                                  
 26644                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 26645                                  
 26646                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 26647                                  
 26648                                  ;****************************************************************** RICHID ****
 26649

 26652                                  
 26653                                  ; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26654                                  ; (SYSINIT:212Bh)	
 26655                                  
 26656                                  		;public	DevEntry
 26657                                  
 26658 00001FAF 0000                    DevSize:	dw	0	; size of the device driver being loaded(paras)
 26659 00001FB1 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded
 26660 00001FB3 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 26661 00001FB5 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver
 26662 00001FB9 00000000                DevBrkAddr:	dd	0	; Break address of the device driver
 26663                                  ; 30/12/2022
 26664                                  ; 27/10/2022 
 26665 00001FBD 00                      ConvLoad:	db	0	; Use conventional (dos 5 -style) InitDevLoad?
 26666                                  ;
 26667 00001FBE 00                      DevUMB:		db	0	; byte indicating whether to load DDs in UMBs
 26668 00001FBF 0000                    DevUMBAddr:	dw	0	; cuurent UMB used fro loading devices (paras)
 26669 00001FC1 0000                    DevUMBSize:	dw	0	; Size of the current UMB being used   (paras)
 26670 00001FC3 0000                    DevUMBFree:	dw	0	; Start of free are in the current UMB (paras)
