 26698                                  
 26699                                  ; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26700                                  ; (SYSINIT:215Eh)
 26701                                  
 26702                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26703                                  ;
 26704                                  ; procedure : doconf
 26705                                  ;
 26706                                  ;             Config file is parsed initially with this routine. For the
 26707                                  ;             Subsequent passes 'multi_pass' entry is used .
 26708                                  ;
 26709                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26710                                  
 26711                                  	; 27/10/2022
 26712                                  doconf:
 26713 00001FE3 0E                      	push	cs
 26714 00001FE4 1F                      	pop	ds
 26715                                  
 26716 00001FE5 B80037                  	mov	ax,3700h
 26717                                          ;mov	ax,(CHAR_OPER<<8)	; get switch character
 26718 00001FE8 CD21                    	int	21h
 26719 00001FEA 8816[E746]              	mov	[command_line+1],dl	; set in default command line
 26720                                  
 26721                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21  IO.SYS)
 26722                                  ; 27/10/2022
 26723                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26724                                  ;	;mov	[command_line-1],dl     ; save default switchchar
 26725 00001FEE 8816[E546]              	mov	[def_swchr],dl ; 31/03/2019 
 26726                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 26727                                  
 26728 00001FF2 BA[FC45]                	mov	dx,config ;'\CONFIG.SYS' ;now pointing to file description
 26729 00001FF5 B8003D                  	mov	ax,3D00h
 26730                                  	;mov	ax,OPEN<<8		;open file "config.sys"
 26731 00001FF8 F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 26732 00001FF9 CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 26733 00001FFB 7309                    	jnc	short noprob		; brif opened okay
 26734                                  
 26735                                  ; 31/12/2022
 26736                                  ; 27/10/2022
 26737                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26738 00001FFD E83919                  	call	kbd_read		; we still want to give the guy
 26739                                  ;					; a chance to select clean boot!
 26740                                  ;;endif					; (ie, no autoexec.bat processing)
 26741 00002000 C606[CD02]0B            	mov	byte [multi_pass_id],11	; set it to unreasonable number
 26742 00002005 C3                      	retn
 26743                                  noprob: 				;get file size (note < 64k!!)
 26744 00002006 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax  ; File handle
 26745 00002008 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 26746 0000200A 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 26747                                  	;mov	ax,4202h
 26748 0000200C B80242                  	mov	ax,(LSEEK<<8)|2
 26749 0000200F CD21                    	int	21h
 26750 00002011 A3[5603]                	mov	[count],ax
 26751                                  
 26752 00002014 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 26753                                  	;mov	ax,4200h
 26754 00002016 B80042                  	mov	ax,LSEEK<<8		;reset pointer to beginning of file
 26755 00002019 CD21                    	int	21h
 26756                                  
 26757                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 
 26758 0000201B 8B16[A502]              	mov	dx,[ALLOCLIM]		;use current alloclim value
 26759                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26760                                  	;mov	dx,[top_of_cdss] 
 26761                                  
 26762 0000201F A1[5603]                	mov	ax,[count]
 26763 00002022 A3[D002]                	mov	[config_size],ax	;save the size of config.sys file.
 26764 00002025 E842F1                  	call	ParaRound
 26765 00002028 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax
 26766                                  
 26767                                  ; 31/12/2022
 26768                                  ; 27/10/2022
 26769                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26770                                  ;
 26771                                  ;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 26772                                  ;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 26773                                  ;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 26774                                  ;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 26775                                  ;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 26776                                  ;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 26777                                  ;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 26778                                  ;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 26779                                  ;
 26780 0000202A 4A                      	dec	dx                      ;reserve 1 additional paragraph
 26781 0000202B 8916[DD14]              	mov	[config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for
 26782 0000202F 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax                   ;rebuilding the config.sys memory image
 26783                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 26784                                  
 26785 00002031 83EA11                  	sub	dx,11h			;room for header
 26786                                  	
 26787                                  	; 31/12/2022
 26788 00002034 8916[A502]              	mov	[ALLOCLIM],dx		;config starts here. new alloclim value.
 26789 00002038 8916[A302]              	mov	[CONFBOT],dx
 26790                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26791                                  	;mov	[top_of_cdss],dx
 26792                                  	;call    TempCDS 
 26793                                  	
 26794                                  	; 31/12/2022
 26795                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26796                                  	; ds <> cs 
 26797                                  	;mov	dx,[cs:top_of_cdss]
 26798                                   
 26799 0000203C 8EDA                    	mov	ds,dx
 26800 0000203E 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 26801

 26933                                  
 26934 000020CC 50                              push    ax                      ;
 26935 000020CD E8C708                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 26936 000020D0 88C4                            mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 26937 000020D2 E8C208                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 26938 000020D5 86C4                            xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 26939 000020D7 A3[AF02]                        mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 26940 000020DA 58                              pop     ax
 26941                                  ;
 26942                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 26943                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 26944                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 26945                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 26946                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 26947                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 26948                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 26949                                  ;   spot.
 26950                                  ;
 26951                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 26952                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 26953                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 26954                                  ;   retrieved.
 26955                                  ;

 27151                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27152                                  ; buffer command
 27153                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27154                                  
 27155                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27156                                  ;									      *
 27157                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 27158                                  ;									      *
 27159                                  ; input :								      *
 27160                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 27161                                  ; output:								      *
 27162                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 27163                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 27164                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 27165                                  ;									      *
 27166                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 27167                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 27168                                  ; logic:								      *
 27169                                  ; {									      *
 27170                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *
 27171                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 27172                                  ;	reset buffer_slash_x;						      *
 27173                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 27174                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 27175                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 27176                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 27177                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 27178                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 27179                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *
 27180                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *
 27181                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 27182                                  ;	};								      *
 27183                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
 27184                                  ; };									      *
 27185                                  ;									      *
 27186                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27187                                  
 27188                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27189                                  	; (SYSINIT:229Ch)
 27190                                  tryb:
 27191 000021A7 80FC42                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BUFFERS ; 'B'
 27192 000021AA 755C                    	jne	short tryc
 27193                                  
 27194                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 27195                                  ; (SYSINIT:24BFh)
 27196                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27197                                  ;%if 0
 27198                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27199 000021AC E8981F                  	call	query_user		; query the user if config_cmd
 27200 000021AF 7257                    	jc	short tryc		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 27201                                  ;endif
 27202                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 27203                                  
 27204                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27205                                  	; 18/12/2022
 27206 000021B1 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 27207                                  	;mov	byte [p_buffer_slash_x],0 ; 31/03/2019
 27208 000021B3 880E[BF1D]              	mov	[p_buffer_slash_x],cl ; 0
 27209                                  
 27210 000021B7 BF[781D]                	mov	di,buf_parms
 27211                                  	;xor	cx,cx	; 18/12/2022
 27212                                  	; 03/01/2023
 27213                                  	;mov	dx,cx
 27214                                  do7:
 27215 000021BA E88307                  	call	sysinit_parse
 27216 000021BD 7303                    	jnc	short if7		; parse error,
 27217                                  	;call	badparm_p		;  and show messages and end the search loop.
 27218                                  	;;jmp	short sr7
 27219                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27220                                  ;sr7:
 27221                                  	;jmp	coff
 27222                                  	; 03/01/2023
 27223 000021BF E9AA06                  	jmp	badparm_p_coff
 27224                                  if7:
 27225 000021C2 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,_$P_RC_EOL ; 0FFFFh	; end of line?
 27226 000021C5 741A                    	je	short en7		;  then jmp to $endloop for semantic check
 27227                                  	;cmp	word [result_val_swoff],switch_x
 27228 000021C7 813E[C31D][B81D]        	cmp	word [result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.SYNONYM_Ptr],switch_x
 27229                                  	;jne	short if11
 27230                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27231 000021CD 74EB                    	je	short do7 ;je short en11
 27232                                  
 27233                                  ;	mov	byte [p_buffer_slash_x],1 ; set the flag M016
 27234                                  	;jmp	short en11 ; 31/12/2022
 27235                                  if11:
 27236                                  	;mov	ax,[rv_dword]
 27237 000021CF A1[C51D]                	mov	ax,[result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.Picked_Val]
 27238 000021D2 83F901                  	cmp	cx,1
 27239 000021D5 7505                    	jne	short if13
 27240                                  
 27241 000021D7 A3[BB1D]                	mov	[p_buffers],ax
 27242                                  	;jmp	short en11
 27243                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27244 000021DA EBDE                    	jmp	short do7
 27245                                  if13:
 27246 000021DC A3[BD1D]                	mov	[p_h_buffers],ax
 27247                                  en11:
 27248 000021DF EBD9                    	jmp	short do7
 27249                                  en7:
 27250 000021E1 833E[BB1D]63            	cmp	word [p_buffers],99
 27251 000021E6 760B                    	jbe	short if18
 27252                                  
 27253                                  ;	cmp	byte [p_buffer_slash_x],0 ; M016
 27254                                  ;	jne	short if18
 27255                                  
 27256 000021E8 E88407                  	call	badparm_p
 27257 000021EB C706[BD1D]0000          	mov	word [p_h_buffers],0
 27258 000021F1 EB12                    	jmp	short sr7
 27259                                  if18:
 27260 000021F3 A1[BB1D]                	mov	ax,[p_buffers]	; we don't have any problem.

 27280                                  
 27281                                  ;****************************************************************************
 27282                                  ;									    *
 27283                                  ; function: parse the parameters of break = command.			    *
 27284                                  ;									    *
 27285                                  ; input :								    *
 27286                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				    *
 27287                                  ; output:								    *
 27288                                  ;	turn the control-c check on or off.				    *
 27289                                  ;									    *

 27299                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */ *

 27301                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */ *
 27302                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,off;				    *

 27933                                  ;	Note: sysi_numio (in DOS DATA) currently reflects the REAL
 27934                                  ;	number of installed devices (including DblSpace drives) where

 27936                                  ;	be assigned to. Because some naughty device drivers (like
 27937                                  ;	interlnk) look at the internal DOS variable instead of the
 27938                                  ;	value we pass it, we'll temporarily stick our value into
 27939                                  ;	DOS DATA while we're initializing the device drivers.
 27940                                  ;
 27941                                  ;	Note that this will make it impossible for this device
 27942                                  ;	driver to access the DblSpace drive letters, whether
 27943                                  ;	they are swapped-hosts or unswapped compressed drives,

 28867                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28868                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 28869                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 28870                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 28871                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 28872                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 28873                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 28874                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 28875                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28876                                  
 28877                                  ;**************************************************************************
 28878                                  ;									  *
 28879                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 28880                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 28881                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 28882                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 28883                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 28884                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 28885                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 28886                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 28887                                  ; input :								  *
 28888                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 28889                                  ; output:								  *
 28890                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 28891                                  ;									  *
 28892                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 28893                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 28894                                  ; logic:								  *
 28895                                  ; {									  *
 28896                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 28897                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 28898                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 28899                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 28900                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 28901                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 28902                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 28903                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 28904                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 28905                                  ;	     }								  *
 28906                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 28907                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 28908                                  ;	};								  *
 28909                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 28910                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 28911                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 28912                                  ; };									  *
 28913                                  ;**************************************************************************
 28914

 29630                                  ;***	CheckProtmanArena -- special hack for adjusting alloclim with Protman$

 29632                                  ;	adjusts alloclim if Protman$ reduced our arena through a manual hack.

 29634                                  CheckProtmanArena:

 29637 0000292A 48                      	dec	ax
 29638 0000292B 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 29639                                  	;add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 29640 0000292D 2603060300              	add	ax,[es:3]	; find end of arena
 29641 00002932 40                      	inc	ax
 29642 00002933 2E3B06[A502]            	cmp	ax,[cs:ALLOCLIM] ; is it less than alloclim?
 29643 00002938 7704                    	ja	short CheckProtmanDone
 29644                                  
 29645 0000293A 2EA3[A502]              	mov	[cs:ALLOCLIM],ax ; reduce alloclim then
 29646                                  CheckProtmanDone:
 29647 0000293E 07                      	pop	es
 29648 0000293F C3                      	retn

 30002                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 30003                                  ;
 30004                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 30005                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 30006                                  ;
 30007                                  ;	Output : none
 30008                                  ;
 30009                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 30010                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 30011                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 30012                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 30013                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h

 30043                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30044                                  ;
 30045                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 30046                                  ;
 30047                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 30048                                  ;	Output : none
 30049                                  ;
 30050                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 30051                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 30052                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 30053                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 30054                                  ;
 30055                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30056                                  
 30057                                  	; 01/11/2022
 30058                                  SetInt12Mem:
 30059 00002A12 1E                      	push	ds
 30060 00002A13 BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 30061 00002A16 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 30062 00002A18 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 30063 00002A1C 2E891E[D11F]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 30064 00002A21 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 30065 00002A23 D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 30066 00002A25 A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 30067 00002A28 2EC606[D01F]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 30068 00002A2E 1F                      	pop	ds
 30069                                  ;limx:
 30070 00002A2F C3                      	retn
 30071                                  
 30072                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30073                                  ;
 30074                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 30075                                  ;
 30076                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 30077                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 30078                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 30079                                  ;
 30080                                  ;	Output : none
 30081                                  ;

 30083                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 30084                                  ;
 30085                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 30087                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 30088                                  	; 11/12/2022
 30089                                  	; ds = cs

 30092                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 30093                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 30094 00002A35 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 30095                                  	; 18/12/2022
 30096 00002A37 B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 30097 00002A3A 8826[D01F]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 30098                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 30099                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 30100 00002A3E 1E                      	push	ds
 30101                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 30102 00002A3F 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 30103 00002A41 2EA1[D11F]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]

 30105 00002A48 1F                      	pop	ds

 30107 00002A49 C3                      	retn

 30163                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 30164                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 30165                                  
 30166                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 30167                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 30168                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 30169                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30170                                  
 30171                                  ;******************************************************************************
 30172                                  ;
 30173                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 30174                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 30175                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 30176                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 30177                                  ;
 30178                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 30179                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 30180                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 30181                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 30182                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 30183                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 30184                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 30185                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 30186                                  ; available during the load.
 30187                                  ;
 30188                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 30189                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 30190                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 30191                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 30192                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 30193                                  ; allocated. After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 30194                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 30195                                  ;
 30196                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 30197                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 30198                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 30199                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 30200                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 30201                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 30202                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 30203                                  ;
 30204                                  ;******************************************************************************
 30205                                  
 30206                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 30207                                  
 30208                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 30209                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 30210                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 30211                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 30212                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 30213                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 30214                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 30215                                  
 30216                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 30217                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 30218                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 30219                                  
 30220                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30221                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 30222                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30223                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 30224                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 30225                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 30226                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30227                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30228                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1. Its contents
 30229                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 30230                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30231                                  
 30232                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30233                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 30234                                  
 30235                                  InitVar:
 30236                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30237                                  	; ds = cs
 30238

 30240                                  	; 03/01/2023
 30241                                  	;push	ax
 30242                                  	;push	cx
 30243                                  	;push	di
 30244 00002A74 06                      	push	es
 30245                                  
 30246                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 30247 00002A75 0E                      	push	cs

 30249                                  
 30250 00002A77 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 30251                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 30252                                  	;mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called

 30255                                  	;				;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 30256                                  	;mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 30257                                  
 30258                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30259                                  	; ds = cs
 30260 00002A79 A2[781F]                	mov	[fUmbTiny],al		;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 30261 00002A7C A2[771F]                	mov	[fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 30262 00002A7F A3[791F]                	mov	[SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 30263 00002A82 C606[7B1F]FF            	mov	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 30264                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 30265 00002A87 A2[AE1F]                	mov	[fm_argc], al		;Start with zero args having been read
 30266

 30278

 30280

 30282 00002A9A 07                      	pop	es

 30285                                  	;pop	cx
 30286                                  	;pop	ax	 	
 30287                                  
 30288 00002A9B C3                      	retn
 30289                                  
 30290                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30291                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 30292                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30293                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 30294                                  ; EXIT    : None
 30295                                  ; ERROR   : None
 30296                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 30297                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30298                                  
 30299                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30300                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F22h)
 30301                                  FixMem:
 30302                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30303                                  	;push	ax
 30304                                  	;push	bx
 30305                                  	;push	cx
 30306                                  	;push	dx
 30307 00002A9C 06                      	push	es
 30308                                  
 30309 00002A9D E84900                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 30310                                  
 30311 00002AA0 E80C02                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 30312 00002AA3 723F                    	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 30313                                  
 30314 00002AA5 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 30315                                  
 30316                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 30317                                  
 30318 00002AA7 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 30319 00002AA9 89D1                    	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 30320 00002AAB 42                      	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 30321                                  
 30322                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30323                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 30324                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 30325                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30326                                  
 30327 00002AAC 26A00000                fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 30328 00002AB0 268B1E0100              	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 30329 00002AB5 09D3                    	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 30330 00002AB7 7516                    	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 30331                                  
 30332                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 30333                                  
 30334 00002AB9 268B1E0300              fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 30335 00002ABE 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 30336 00002AC0 26A20000                	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 30337                                  
 30338 00002AC4 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 30339                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 30340                                  	; 11/07/2023
 30341 00002AC9 43                      	inc	bx
 30342 00002ACA 26891E0300              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 30343                                  
 30344                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 30345                                  
 30346 00002ACF 8CC1                    fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Put this address on the stack
 30347 00002AD1 268B160100              	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 30348                                  
 30349 00002AD6 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 30350 00002AD8 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 30351 00002ADD 43                      	inc	bx
 30352 00002ADE 8EC3                    	mov	es,bx
 30353                                  
 30354                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 30355 00002AE0 3C5A                    	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 30356 00002AE2 75C8                    	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 30357                                  fmX:	
 30358 00002AE4 E81300                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 30359                                  
 30360 00002AE7 07                      	pop	es
 30361                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30362                                  	;pop	dx
 30363                                  	;pop	cx
 30364                                  	;pop	bx
 30365                                  	;pop	ax
 30366                                  
 30367 00002AE8 C3                      	retn
 30368                                  
 30369                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30370                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 30371                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30372                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 30373                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 30374                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30375                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 30376                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30377                                  
 30378                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 30379                                  fm_link:
 30380 00002AE9 B80258                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 30381 00002AEC CD21                    	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 30382                                  
 30383                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 30384                                  	;
 30385                                  	;push	es
 30386                                  	;push	cs
 30387                                  	;pop	es
 30388                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 30389                                  	;pop	es
 30390                                  	
 30391                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30392                                  	; ds = cs
 30393                                  	;mov	[cs:fm_umb],al
 30394 00002AEE A2[AC1F]                	mov	[fm_umb],al
 30395                                  
 30396 00002AF1 B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 30397 00002AF4 BB0100                  	mov	bx,1
 30398 00002AF7 CD21                    	int	21h
 30399 00002AF9 C3                      	retn
 30400                                  
 30401                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30402                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 30403                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30404                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 30405                                  ; EXIT:     None
 30406                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30407                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 30408                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30409                                  
 30410                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 30411                                  fm_unlink:
 30412 00002AFA 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 30413                                  	
 30414                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 30415                                  	;
 30416                                  	;push	ds
 30417                                  	;push	cs
 30418                                  	;pop	ds
 30419                                  	;mov	bl,[fm_umb]	
 30420                                  	;pop	ds
 30421                                  	
 30422                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30423                                  	; ds = cs
 30424                                  	;mov	bl,[cs:fm_umb]
 30425 00002AFC 8A1E[AC1F]              	mov	bl,[fm_umb]
 30426                                  
 30427 00002B00 B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 30428 00002B03 CD21                    	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h
 30429 00002B05 C3                      	retn
 30430                                  
 30431                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30432                                  
 30433                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30434                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 30435                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 30436                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30437                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 30438                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 30439                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 30440                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30441                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30442                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 30443                                  ;
 30444                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 30445                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 30446                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 30447                                  ;
 30448                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 30449                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 30450                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 30451                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 30452                                  ;
 30453                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 30454                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 30455                                  ;
 30456                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30457                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 30458                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 30459                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 30460                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 30461                                  ;     lh
 30462                                  ;     /l
 30463                                  ;     1
 30464                                  ;     1000
 30465                                  ;     2
 30466                                  ;     print
 30467                                  ;     /d
 30468                                  ;     :lpt2
 30469                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 30470                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 30471                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 30472                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 30473                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 30474                                  ; for:
 30475                                  ;    Each /L
 30476                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 30477                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 30478                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 30479                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 30480                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 30481                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30482                                  
 30483                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30484                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F9Fh)
 30485                                  
 30486                                  ParseVar:
 30487                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 30488                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30489                                  	;push	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 30490 00002B06 1E                      	push	ds
 30491 00002B07 06                      	push	es
 30492                                  
 30493 00002B08 06                      	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 30494 00002B09 1F                      	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 30495 00002B0A FC                      	cld
 30496                                  
 30497                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 30498                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 30499                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 30500                                  
 30501 00002B0B AC                      pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 30502 00002B0C E8A200                  	call	isWhite
 30503 00002B0F 74FA                    	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 30504                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 30505 00002B11 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH
 30506 00002B13 7404                    	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 30507                                  
 30508 00002B15 4E                      	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 30509 00002B16 F8                      	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 30510 00002B17 EB2B                    	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 30511                                  
 30512 00002B19 AC                      pv20:	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 30513                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 30514 00002B1A 24DF                    	and	al,0DFh
 30515                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 30516 00002B1C 3C53                    	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 30517 00002B1E 750D                    	jne	short pv30
 30518                                  
 30519                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 30520 00002B20 2EFE06[AE1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 30521                                  
 30522                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 30523                                  	;
 30524                                  	;push	es
 30525                                  	;push	cs
 30526                                  	;pop	es
 30527                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 30528                                  	;pop	es
 30529                                  
 30530 00002B25 2EC606[781F]01          	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 30531                                  
 30532 00002B2B EBDE                    	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 30533                                  
 30534                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 30535 00002B2D 3C4C                    	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then 'tis a bad
 30536 00002B2F 750D                    	jne	short pvE1		; switch!
 30537                                  
 30538                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 30539 00002B31 2EFE06[AE1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 30540                                  
 30541 00002B36 E80E00                  	call	parseL
 30542 00002B39 73D0                    	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 30543                                  
 30544 00002B3B 4E                      	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 30545 00002B3C EB03                    	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 30546                                  
 30547                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 30548 00002B3E B80300                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 30549 00002B41 4E                      pvErr:	dec	si
 30550 00002B42 4E                      	dec	si
 30551 00002B43 F9                      	stc
 30552                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 30553 00002B44 07                      	pop	es
 30554 00002B45 1F                      	pop	ds
 30555                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30556                                  	;pop	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 30557 00002B46 C3                      	retn
 30558                                  
 30559                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30560                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 30561                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30562                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 30563                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 30564                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 30565                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 30566                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30567                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 30568                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 30569                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax.  The 3-character rewind
 30570                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 30571                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30572                                  
 30573                                  parseL:
 30574 00002B47 AC                      	lodsb
 30575 00002B48 3C3A                    	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 30576 00002B4A 754E                    	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 30577                                  
 30578                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30579                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 30580                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30581                                  
 30582 00002B4C E8E700                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, 'tis ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 30583 00002B4F 724F                    	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 30584 00002B51 E8A901                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 30585                                  
 30586 00002B54 88C1                    	mov	cl,al		; Remember the UMB number
 30587 00002B56 E87600                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 30588 00002B59 7245                    	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 30589                                  
 30590                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 30591 00002B5B 2EFE06[AE1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30592                                  
 30593 00002B60 AC                      	lodsb
 30594 00002B61 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 30595 00002B63 74E7                    	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 30596                                  
 30597 00002B65 E84900                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 30598 00002B68 743B                    	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 30599                                  
 30600 00002B6A E83900                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 30601 00002B6D 7435                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 30602                                  
 30603                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 30604 00002B6F 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH 	; Did "umb/" ? (as in, "/L:1,100;2/S")
 30605 00002B71 7431                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 30606                                  
 30607 00002B73 3C2C                    	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 30608 00002B75 7523                    	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 30609                                  
 30610                                  ; --- Read a size -------------------------------------------------------------
 30611                                  
 30612 00002B77 E8BC00                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 30613 00002B7A 721E                    	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 30614                                  
 30615 00002B7C E82201                  	call	toPara		; Convert from bytes to paragraphs
 30616                                  
 30617 00002B7F E87200                  	call	stowSiz		; CL still has the UMB number for this routine
 30618                                  
 30619                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB size is another arg for LH to skip
 30620 00002B82 2EFE06[AE1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30621                                  
 30622 00002B87 AC                      	lodsb
 30623 00002B88 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; They did "umb,size;", so get another UMB.
 30624 00002B8A 74C0                    	je	short pl10	;
 30625                                  
 30626 00002B8C E82200                  	call	isWhite		; Did it end with whitespace?
 30627 00002B8F 7414                    	jz	short plX	; If so, we're done here--go back.
 30628                                  
 30629 00002B91 E81200                  	call	isEOL		; Did they do "umb,size" and end??? (stupid)
 30630 00002B94 740E                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 30631                                  
 30632                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 30633 00002B96 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH	; Did they do "umb,size/" ?
 30634 00002B98 740A                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, again, we're done here.
 30635                                  plE1:	
 30636                                  	;mov	ax,1
 30637 00002B9A B80100                  	mov	ax,PV_InvArg	; If not, we don't know WHAT they did...
 30638 00002B9D 4E                      	dec	si
 30639 00002B9E F9                      	stc
 30640 00002B9F C3                      	retn
 30641                                  
 30642                                  plE2:	;mov	ax,2
 30643 00002BA0 B80200                  	mov	ax,PV_BadUMB	; In this case, they've specified a UMB twice
 30644                                  	; 12/12/2022
 30645                                  	; cf=1
 30646                                  	;stc
 30647 00002BA3 C3                      	retn
 30648                                  plSwX:	
 30649 00002BA4 4E                      	dec	si		; If we hit a '/' character, back up one char
 30650                                  				; so the whitespace checker will see it too.
 30651                                  plX:	; 12/12/2022
 30652                                  	; cf=0
 30653                                  	;clc			; Then just return with carry clear, so
 30654 00002BA5 C3                      	retn			; ParseVar will go about its business.
 30655

 30681                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30682                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 30683                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30684                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 30685                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 30686                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30687                                  ; USES:     ZF
 30688                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30689                                  
 30690                                  isEOL:
 30691 00002BA6 3C00                    	cmp	al,0		; Null-terminator
 30692 00002BA8 7406                    	je	short ieX
 30693 00002BAA 3C0D                    	cmp	al,CR ; 0Dh	; Carriage Return
 30694 00002BAC 7402                    	je	short ieX
 30695 00002BAE 3C0A                    	cmp	al,LF ; 0Ah	; LineFeed
 30696                                  ieX:	
 30697 00002BB0 C3                      	retn
 30698                                  
 30699                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30700                                  ;*** isWhite - returns with ZF set if AL contains whitespace (or "=")
 30701                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30702                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 30703                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains space, tab, or equals
 30704                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30705                                  ; USES:     ZF
 30706                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30707                                  
 30708                                  isWhite:
 30709 00002BB1 3C20                    	cmp	al,' '		; Space
 30710 00002BB3 7406                    	je	short iwX
 30711 00002BB5 3C3D                    	cmp	al,'='		; Equals (treat as whitespace)
 30712 00002BB7 7402                    	je	short iwX
 30713 00002BB9 3C09                    	cmp	al,tab ; 9	; Tab
 30714                                  iwX:	
 30715 00002BBB C3                      	retn

 30768                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30769                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 30770                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 30771                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain. If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 30772                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 30773                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30774                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 30775                                  ; EXIT:     None
 30776                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 30777                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30778                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30779                                  
 30780                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 30781                                  stowUMB:
 30782 00002BCF 3C10                    	cmp	al,MAXUMB ; 16
 30783 00002BD1 7202                    	jb	short su10
 30784 00002BD3 F9                      	stc
 30785 00002BD4 C3                      	retn			; Ooops-- UMB>=MAXUMB
 30786                                  su10:	
 30787                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30788                                  	;push	bx
 30789                                  	;push	di
 30790                                  	;push	si
 30791                                  	;push	ds
 30792                                  	;push	es
 30793                                  	;push	cs
 30794                                  	;pop	es
 30795                                  	;push	cs
 30796                                  	;pop	ds
 30797                                  
 30798                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30799                                  	; ds <> cs
 30800                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],0FFh
 30801 00002BD5 2E803E[7B1F]FF          	cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED
 30802                                  				; If this, we haven't been here before
 30803 00002BDB 7504                    	jne	short su20
 30804 00002BDD 2EA2[7B1F]              	mov	[cs:UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 30805                                  
 30806                                  	;;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],0FFh
 30807                                  	;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; If this, we haven't been here before
 30808                                  	;jne	short su20
 30809                                  	;mov	[UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 30810                                  su20:	
 30811 00002BE1 08C0                    	or	al,al		; If they gave UMB 0, there's really nothing
 30812 00002BE3 740E                    	jz	short su30	; that we should do here.
 30813                                  
 30814                                  	;mov	bl,al
 30815                                  	;xor	bh,bh
 30816                                  	;mov	ax,1		; Now, AX = 1, and BX = UMB Number
 30817                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30818 00002BE5 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah
 30819 00002BE7 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 30820 00002BE9 B001                    	mov	al,1
 30821                                  
 30822                                  	;xchg	[es:bx+UmbUsed],al
 30823                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30824 00002BEB 2E8687[7C1F]            	xchg	[cs:bx+UmbUsed],al
 30825                                  
 30826                                  	;or	al,al		; If it was already 1, then al==1... and that
 30827                                  	;jz	short su30	; means an error.
 30828                                  	;
 30829                                  	;stc			; OOOPS!  This one's been used before.  :(
 30830                                  	
 30831                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30832 00002BF0 3C01                    	cmp	al,1
 30833 00002BF2 F5                      	cmc 	; if al > 0 -> cf = 1
 30834                                  su30:	
 30835                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30836                                  	;pop	es
 30837                                  	;pop	ds
 30838                                  	;pop	si
 30839                                  	;pop	di
 30840                                  	;pop	bx
 30841 00002BF3 C3                      	retn
 30842

 30847                                  ; EXIT:     None

 30864 00002BF4 88CB                    	mov	bl,cl			; Now bl==UMB number, AX==size
 30865 00002BF6 B700                    	mov	bh,0			;     bx==UMB number, AX==size
 30866 00002BF8 D0E3                    	shl	bl,1			;     bx==offset into array, AX=size
 30867                                  	;mov	[es:bx+UmbSize],ax	; Store the size
