 30877                                  
 30878                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30879                                  ;*** toDigit - converts a character-digit to its binary counterpart
 30880                                  ;            -- verifies that CL contains a valid character-digit; if so, it
 30881                                  ; changes CL to its counterpart binary digit ((CL-'0') or (CL-'A'+10)).
 30882                                  ; A-F are considered valid iff gnradix is 16.
 30883                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30884                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains a digit ('0' to '9' or, if gnradix==16, 'A' to 'F')
 30885                                  ; EXIT:     CL contains digit in binary (0 to 9 or, if gnradix==16, 0 to 15)
 30886                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set indicates invalid digit; carry clear indicates good digit
 30887                                  ; USES:     CL, Flags
 30888                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30889                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 30890                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 30891                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 30892                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30893                                  
 30894                                  gnradix:
 30895 00002C00 0000                    	dw	0		; Must be a word--16x16 multiplication
 30896                                  
 30897                                  toDigit:
 30898 00002C02 2E833E[002C]10          	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 30899 00002C08 751C                    	jne	short td20	; Don't check hex digits if radix isn't 16
 30900                                  
 30901                                  toDigit_hex:
 30902 00002C0A 80F961                  	cmp	cl,'a'	; 61h
 30903 00002C0D 7209                    	jb	short td10
 30904 00002C0F 80F966                  	cmp	cl,'f'	; 66h
 30905 00002C12 7720                    	ja	short tdE	; Nothing valid above 'z' at all...
 30906 00002C14 80E957                  	sub	cl,'a'-10 ; 57h	; Make 'a'==10 and return.
 30907                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 30908 00002C17 C3                      	retn
 30909                                  td10:	
 30910 00002C18 80F941                  	cmp	cl,'A'  ; 41h
 30911 00002C1B 7209                    	jb	short td20	; Below 'A'?  Not a letter...
 30912 00002C1D 80F946                  	cmp	cl,'F'	; 46h
 30913 00002C20 7712                    	ja	short tdE	; Above 'F'?  Not a digit.
 30914 00002C22 80E937                  	sub	cl,'A'-10 ; 37h	; Make 'A'==10 and return.
 30915                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 30916 00002C25 C3                      	retn
 30917                                  toDigit_dec:
 30918                                  td20:	
 30919 00002C26 80F930                  	cmp	cl,'0'		; If less than zero,
 30920                                  	;jb	short tdE	; Done.
 30921 00002C29 720A                    	jb	short tdEr ; 08/04/2019
 30922 00002C2B 80F939                  	cmp	cl,'9'		; Or, if greater than nine,
 30923 00002C2E 7704                    	ja	short tdE	; Done.
 30924 00002C30 80E930                  	sub	cl,'0'	; 30h	; Okay--make '0'==0 and return.
 30925                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 30926 00002C33 C3                      	retn
 30927                                  tdE:	
 30928 00002C34 F9                      	stc
 30929                                  tdEr:		; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 30930 00002C35 C3                      	retn
 30931                                  
 30932                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30933                                  ;*** GetXNum - reads a 32-bit ASCII number at ES:SI and returns it in DX:AX
 30934                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30935                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to an ascii string to scan
 30936                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI moved to first invalid digit, DX:AX contains value read
 30937                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if # is too big, or has no digits (EOL possibly)
 30938                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, DX, AX, Flags, gnradix
 30939                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30940                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 30941                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 30942                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 30943                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30944                                  
 30945                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30946                                  
 30947                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30948                                  ; (SYSINIT:3109h)
 30949                                  
 30950                                  GetXNum:
 30951                                  	;pushreg <bx, cx, ds>
 30952                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30953                                  	;push	bx
 30954 00002C36 51                      	push	cx ; *
 30955                                  	;push	ds
 30956                                  
 30957 00002C37 FC                      	cld
 30958 00002C38 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 30959 00002C3A 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 30960 00002C3C 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 30961 00002C3E 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; Start with 0 (makes sense)
 30962                                  
 30963 00002C40 2EC706[002C]0A00        	mov	word [cs:gnradix],10	; And default to a radix of 10 (dec)
 30964                                  
 30965 00002C47 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]		; Now AX=0, BX=0, CH=0/CL=char, DX=0
 30966                                  	;call	toDigit
 30967 00002C4A E8D9FF                  	call	toDigit_dec
 30968                                  	;jc	short gxnE		; If it's not a digit, leave now.
 30969                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30970 00002C4D 7233                    	jc	short gxnX
 30971                                  
 30972 00002C4F 08C9                    	or	cl,cl
 30973 00002C51 7517                    	jnz	short gxn20		; Doesn't have '0x'
 30974 00002C53 268A4C01                	mov	cl,[es:si+1]
 30975 00002C57 80F978                  	cmp	cl,'x'			; Either 'x'...
 30976 00002C5A 7405                    	je	short gxn10
 30977 00002C5C 80F958                  	cmp	cl,'X'			; ...or 'X' means it's hexadecimal
 30978 00002C5F 7509                    	jne	short gxn20
 30979                                  
 30980                                  gxn10:	
 30981 00002C61 2EC706[002C]1000        	mov	word [cs:gnradix], 16
 30982 00002C68 46                      	inc	si			; Since we read "0x", march over it.
 30983 00002C69 46                      	inc	si
 30984                                  
 30985                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 30986                                  ; GXN20--ES:SI = a digit in a number; if not, we're done
 30987                                  ;        DX:AX = current total
 30988                                  ;        BX    = 0
 30989                                  ;        CH    = 0
 30990                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 30991                                  
 30992                                  gxn20:	
 30993 00002C6A 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]	; Now DX:AX=current total, CH=0/CL=char
 30994 00002C6D 46                      	inc	si
 30995                                  
 30996 00002C6E E891FF                  	call	toDigit		; Accepts only valid digits, A-F -> 10-16
 30997 00002C71 720D                    	jc	short gxnQ	; <- Ah... wasn't a digit. Stop.
 30998                                  
 30999 00002C73 E80E00                  	call	mul32		; Multiply DX:AX by gnradix
 31000 00002C76 720A                    	jc	short gxnX	; (if it's too big, error out)
 31001                                  
 31002 00002C78 01C8                    	add	ax,cx		; Add the digit
 31003 00002C7A 11DA                    	adc	dx,bx		; (BX is 0!)--Adds 1 iff last add wrapped
 31004                                  	;jc	short gxnX	; If _that_ wrapped, it's too big.
 31005                                  	;jmp	short gxn20
 31006 00002C7C 73EC                    	jnc	short gxn20
 31007                                  gxnE:	
 31008                                  	;stc			; In this case, we need to set the carry
 31009 00002C7E EB02                    	jmp	short gxnX	; and leave--there were no digits given.
 31010                                  gxnQ:	
 31011 00002C80 4E                      	dec	si		; Don't read in the offensive character.
 31012 00002C81 F8                      	clc			; And clear carry, so they know it's okay.
 31013                                  gxnX:	
 31014                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31015                                  	;pop	ds
 31016 00002C82 59                      	pop	cx ; *
 31017                                  	;pop	bx
 31018 00002C83 C3                      	retn
 31019                                  
 31020                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31021                                  ;*** mul32 - multiplies the number in DX:AX by gnradix
 31022                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31023                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be multiplied, BX = 0, gnradix = multiplier
 31024                                  ; EXIT:    DX:AX has been multiplied by gnradix if carry clear; BX still 0
 31025                                  ; ERROR:   Carry set if number was too large
 31026                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 31027                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31028                                  
 31029                                  mul32:
 31030 00002C84 50                      	push	ax		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 31031 00002C85 89D0                    	mov	ax,dx		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 31032 00002C87 2EF726[002C]            	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=?, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 31033 00002C8C 7211                    	jc	short m32E	; Too big?
 31034                                  
 31035 00002C8E 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 31036 00002C90 58                      	pop	ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 31037                                  
 31038 00002C91 87D3                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=0, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 31039 00002C93 2EF726[002C]            	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=carry,  AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 31040 00002C98 87D3                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 31041 00002C9A 01DA                    	add	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 31042 00002C9C 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 31043 00002C9E C3                      	retn
 31044                                  m32E:	
 31045 00002C9F 58                      	pop	ax
 31046 00002CA0 C3                      	retn
 31047                                  
 31048                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31049                                  ;*** toPara - divides DX:AX by 16; result in AX only (discards extra DX data)
 31050                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31051                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be divided
 31052                                  ; EXIT:    Interpereting DX:AX as bytes, AX=paragraph equivalent, 0xFFFF max
 31053                                  ; ERROR:   None
 31054                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 31055                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31056                                  ; Note: The 386 has a 32-bit SHR, which would work perfectly for this... but we
 31057                                  ;       can't ensure a 386 host machine. Sorry.
 31058                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31059                                  
 31060                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31061                                  toPara:
 31062 00002CA1 51                      	push	cx		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:LLLL llll llll llll
 31063                                  
 31064 00002CA2 B104                    	mov	cl,4		;
 31065 00002CA4 D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:0000 LLLL llll llll
 31066 00002CA6 92                      	xchg	ax,dx		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh
 31067 00002CA7 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 31068 00002CA9 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:hhhh 0000 0000 0000
 31069 00002CAB 09D0                    	or	ax,dx		;    AX=hhhh LLLL llll llll
 31070                                  
 31071 00002CAD 59                      	pop	cx
 31072 00002CAE C3                      	retn
 31073                                  
 31074                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31075                                  ;*** UmbHead - returns in AX the address of the first UMB block (0x9FFF)
 31076                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31077                                  ; ENTRY:  Nothing
 31078                                  ; EXIT:   AX contains 0x9FFF for most systems
 31079                                  ; ERROR:  Carry set if pointer is 0xFFFF (if not set up yet--DH runs into this)
 31080                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 31081                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31082                                  ; Early in the boot-cycle, the pointer used to obtain this value isn't set up;
 31083                                  ; to be precise, before a UMB provider is around. In this event, the pointer
 31084                                  ; is always set to 0xFFFF; it changes once a provider is around. On most
 31085                                  ; machines (all of 'em I've seen), it changes to 0x9FFF at that point.
 31086                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31087                                  
 31088                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31089                                  UmbHead:
 31090                                  	; 13/05/2019 (because of callers, pushs & pops are not needed here)
 31091                                  
 31092                                  	;push	si ; ?
 31093                                  	;push	ds ; ? 
 31094                                  	;push	es
 31095                                  	;push	bx ; *	
 31096                                  
 31097                                  	; 09/04/2019
 31098                                  	; !!! No need to save es,bx,ds,si above !!! (es,bx are changed here)
 31099                                  
 31100 00002CAF B452                    	mov	ah,GET_IN_VARS		; Call int 21h, function 52h...
 31101 00002CB1 CD21                    	int	21h
 31102                                  
 31103 00002CB3 26A18C00                	mov	ax,[es:DOS_UMB_HEAD]	; And read what's in ES:[008C]
 31104                                  	
 31105                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31106 00002CB7 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 31107 00002CBA F5                      	cmc
 31108                                  	; if AX=0FFFFh -> CF=1
 31109 00002CBB C3                      	retn
 31110                                  
 31111                                  ; 01/01/2023
 31112                                  ;%if 0
 31113                                  ;	cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 31114                                  ;	je	short uhE		; If it's 0xFFFF, it's an error...
 31115                                  ;
 31116                                  ;	clc				; Else, it isn't (CLC done by prev cmp)
 31117                                  ;	;jmp	short uhX
 31118                                  ;	; 12/12/2022
 31119                                  ;	retn
 31120                                  ;uhE:	
 31121                                  ;	stc
 31122                                  ;uhX:	
 31123                                  ;	;pop	bx ; *
 31124                                  ;	;pop	es
 31125                                  ;	;pop	ds ; ?
 31126                                  ;	;pop	si ; ?
 31127                                  ;	retn
 31128                                  ;%endif
 31129                                  
 31130                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 31160                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31161                                  ;*** AddrToUmb - converts a segment address in AX to its appropriate UMB number
 31162                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31163                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a segment address
 31164                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain the UMB number which contains the address (0==conv)
 31165                                  ; ERROR:  If the address is above UM Range, AX will return as FFFF.
 31166                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 31167                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31168                                  ; An address in the following areas is treated as:
 31169                                  ;    0      <-> umbhead (0x9FFF)          = Conventional memory
 31170                                  ;    0x9FFF <-> addr of first UM sys MCB  = UMB #1
 31171                                  ;      ...
 31172                                  ;    addr of last UM sys MCB <-> TOM      = invalid; returns #0xFFFF
 31173                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31174                                  
 31175                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31176                                  AddrToUmb:
 31177                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31178                                  	;push	cx
 31179                                  	;push	dx
 31180 00002CCC 06                      	push	es
 31181                                  
 31182 00002CCD 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; DX = address to search for
 31183                                  
 31184 00002CCF E8DDFF                  	call	UmbHead		; AX = first segment
 31185 00002CD2 7222                    	jc	short atuE	; If it couldn't get it, error out.
 31186                                  
 31187                                  	; 22/07/2023
 31188                                  	;mov	es,ax ; *	; ES = first UMB segment
 31189 00002CD4 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx ; 0	; Pretend we're on UMB 0 for now... (cx = UMB#)
 31190                                  
 31191                                  	; 22/07/2023
 31192                                  atu10:
 31193 00002CD6 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax ; * ; ** ; 22/07/2023
 31194                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 31195                                  ; ATU10--ES - Current MCB address
 31196                                  ;        DX - Address given for conversion
 31197                                  ;        CX - Current UMB #
 31198                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 31199                                  
 31200                                  ;atu10:	
 31201                                  	;mov	ax,es ; * ; 18/07/2023
 31202 00002CD8 39D0                            cmp	ax,dx		; Present segment >= given segment?
 31203 00002CDA 731D                    	jae	short atuX	; Yep--done.
 31204                                  
 31205 00002CDC E8DDFF                  	call	isSysMCB	; Returns with ZF set if this is a system MCB
 31206 00002CDF 7501                    	jnz	short atu20
 31207                                  
 31208 00002CE1 41                      	inc	cx		; If it _was_ a system MCB, we're in a new UMB.
 31209                                  atu20:	
 31210                                  	;mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 31211                                  	;cmp	al,arena_signature_end  ; 'Z'
 31212                                  	; 22/07/2023
 31213                                  	; ax = es
 31214                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 31215 00002CE2 2603060300              	add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 31216 00002CE7 26803E00005A            	cmp	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_end
 31217 00002CED 7403                    	je	short atu30		; 'Z' means this was the last MCB... that's it.
 31218                                  
 31219                                  	;NextMCB es,ax
 31220                                  
 31221                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 31222                                  	;;add	ax,[es:3]
 31223                                  	;add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 31224 00002CEF 40                      	inc	ax
 31225                                  	; 22/07/2023
 31226                                  	;mov	es,ax ; *
 31227 00002CF0 EBE4                    	jmp	short atu10
 31228                                  
 31229                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31230                                  ; if we get to atu30, they specified a number that was past the last MCB.
 31231                                  ; make sure it's not _inside_ that MCB before we return an error condition.
 31232                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31233                                  
 31234                                  atu30:	
 31235                                  	; 22/07/2023
 31236                                  	; ax = es + [es:ARENA.SIZE] 
 31237                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 31238                                  	;add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE] ; **
 31239 00002CF2 39D0                    	cmp	ax,dx		; Present >= given?
 31240 00002CF4 7303                    	jae	short atuX	; Yep! It _was_ inside.
 31241                                  atuE:	
 31242 00002CF6 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx ; 0	; Else, fall through with UMB # == -1
 31243 00002CF8 49                      	dec	cx		; (that makes it return 0xFFFF and sets CF)
 31244                                  atuX:	
 31245 00002CF9 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx		; Return the UMB number in AX
 31246                                  	
 31247 00002CFB 07                      	pop	es	
 31248                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31249                                  	;pop	dx
 31250                                  	;pop	cx
 31251 00002CFC C3                      	retn
 31252                                  
 31253                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31254                                  ;*** convUMB - checks after GetXNum to convert an address to a UMB number
 31255                                  ;            -- if GetXNum read a hex number, we interperete that as a segment
 31256                                  ; address rather than a UMB number... and use that address to look up a UMB.
 31257                                  ; This routine checks for that condition and calls AddrToUmb if necessary.
 31258                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31259                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a UMB number or segment, gnradix has been set by GetXNum
 31260                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain a UMB number
 31261                                  ; ERROR:  None
 31262                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 31263                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31264                                  
 31265                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31266                                  convUMB:
 31267 00002CFD 2E833E[002C]10          	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 31268 00002D03 7507                    	jne	short cu10	; If it didn't read in hex, it's not an address
 31269 00002D05 E8C4FF                  	call	AddrToUmb	; Else, convert the address to a UMB number
 31270                                  	;cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 31271                                  	;jne	short cu10
 31272                                  	;inc	ax		; If too high, ignore it (make it conventional)
 31273                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31274 00002D08 40                      	inc	ax
 31275 00002D09 7401                    	jz	short cu10	; If too high, ignore it (make it conventional)
 31276 00002D0B 48                      	dec	ax
 31277                                  cu10:	
 31278 00002D0C C3                      	retn

 31308                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31309                                  ;*** loadLow - returns AL==0 if UMB0 == 0, else AL==1
 31310                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31311                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 31312                                  ; EXIT:   AL==0 if mem strategy should be set to LOW_FIRST, else AL==1
 31313                                  ;         Carry set if UMB0 not specified (_NOT_ an error)
 31314                                  ; ERROR:  None
 31315                                  ; USES:   Flags, fm_strat, fm_umb
 31316                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31317                                  ; We want to set the memory strategy to LOW_FIRST if the user specified a
 31318                                  ; load UMB, and it is 0. That 0 can be either from the user having _specified_
 31319                                  ; zero (/L:0;...), or from having specified a too-big min size (/L:1,99999999)
 31320                                  ; such that the load UMB is too small, and shouldn't be used.

 31331                                  	jne	short ll10
 31332                                  
 31333                                  	stc
 31334                                  ll15:

 31336                                  	;stc
 31337                                  	;jmp	short llX
 31338                                  	retn
 31339                                  ll10:	
 31340                                  	or	al,al		; AL=the load UMB: Is it == 0?
 31341                                  	;jz	short llX	; Yep... CF==0 (from OR) && AL=0, so just exit
 31342                                  
 31343                                  	jnz	short ll15	; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31344                                  	retn

 31346                                  	;mov	al,1
 31347                                  	;clc
 31348                                  ;llX:
 31349                                  	;pop	ds		; Return DS to where it was
 31350                                  	;retn

 31739                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31740                                  ;*** findUMB - makes ES:0 point to the first MCB in UMB given as AL
 31741                                  ;            -- returns UmbHEAD pointer (0x9FFF) if passed AL==0
 31742                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31743                                  ; ENTRY:    AL should be to a valid UMB number
 31744                                  ; EXIT:     ES:0 points to first MCB in UMB (_not_ the 8+SC MCB that heads it)
 31745                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if couldn't reach UMB (too high)
 31746                                  ; USES:     Flags, ES
 31747                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31748                                  
 31749                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31750                                  	; (SYSINIT:3344h)
 31751                                  findUMB:
 31752                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31753                                  	;push	ax
 31754                                  	; 02/01/2023
 31755 00002DD1 51                      	push	cx ; *
 31756                                  	;push	dx
 31757                                  
 31758 00002DD2 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah		; Zap ah, so al==ax
 31759                                  
 31760 00002DD4 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; Store the to-be-found UMB number in DX
 31761                                  
 31762 00002DD6 E8D6FE                  	call	UmbHead		; Returns first UMB segment in AX
 31763                                  	; 22/07/2023
 31764                                  	;mov	es,ax ; *
 31765 00002DD9 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx		; Pretend we're on UMB 0 for now...
 31766                                  
 31767                                  	; 22/07/2023
 31768                                  fu10:
 31769 00002DDB 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax ; * ; **
 31770                                  ; ---------------------------------------------
 31771                                  ; FU10--CX - This UMB number; 0 == conventional
 31772                                  ;       DX - The UMB number they're looking for
 31773                                  ;       ES - The current MCB address
 31774                                  ; ---------------------------------------------
 31775                                  
 31776                                  ;fu10:	
 31777 00002DDD 39D1                    	cmp	cx,dx		; If CX==DX, we've found the UMB we're
 31778 00002DDF 7417                    	je	short fuX	; searching for--so exit.
 31779                                  
 31780 00002DE1 E8D8FE                  	call	isSysMCB	; Returns with ZF set if owner is SYSTEM
 31781 00002DE4 7501                    	jnz	short fu20
 31782                                  
 31783 00002DE6 41                      	inc	cx		; If it _was_ SYSTEM, we're in a new UMB.
 31784                                  fu20:	
 31785                                  	;mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 31786                                  	;cmp	al,arena_signature_end ; 'Z'
 31787                                  	; 19/07/2023
 31788 00002DE7 26803E00005A            	cmp	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_end 
 31789 00002DED 7408                    	je	short fuE	; 'Z' means this was the last MCB... that's it.
 31790                                  
 31791                                  	;NextMCB es,ax		; Go on forward.
 31792                                  	; 22/07/2023
 31793                                  	; ax = es
 31794                                  	;mov	ax,es ; * ; 22/07/2023
 31795                                  	;add	ax,[es:3]
 31796 00002DEF 2603060300              	add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 31797 00002DF4 40                      	inc	ax
 31798                                  	; 22/07/2023
 31799                                  	;mov	es,ax ; **
 31800 00002DF5 EBE4                    	jmp	short fu10
 31801                                  fuE:	
 31802 00002DF7 F9                      	stc
 31803                                  fuX:
 31804                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31805                                  	;pop	dx
 31806                                  	; 02/01/2023
 31807 00002DF8 59                      	pop	cx ; *
 31808                                  	;pop	ax		; The address is already in ES.
 31809 00002DF9 C3                      	retn
 31810                                  
 31811                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31812                                  ;*** BigFree - makes ES:0 point to the largest free MCB in UMB given as AL
 31813                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31814                                  ; ENTRY:    AL should be to a valid UMB number
 31815                                  ; EXIT:     ES:0 points to largest free MCB in UMB, AX returns its size
 31816                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if couldn't reach UMB (0 or too high)
 31817                                  ; USES:     Flags, ES
 31818                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31819                                  
 31820                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31821                                  BigFree:
 31822                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31823                                  	;push	bx
 31824 00002DFA 51                      	push	cx
 31825                                  
 31826 00002DFB E8D3FF                  	call	findUMB			; Returns with CF if err, else ES==MCB
 31827 00002DFE 723A                    	jc	short bfX		; (would be "jc bfE"; it just does stc)
 31828                                  
 31829 00002E00 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; Segment address of largest free MCB
 31830 00002E02 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			; Size of largest free MCB
 31831                                  
 31832                                  ; ---------------------------------------------
 31833                                  ; BF10--ES - Current MCB address
 31834                                  ;       BX - Address of largest free MCB so far
 31835                                  ;       CX - Size of largest free MCB so far
 31836                                  ; ---------------------------------------------
 31837                                  
 31838                                  bf10:	
 31839 00002E04 E8B5FE                  	call	isSysMCB		; If we've left the MCB, we're done.
 31840 00002E07 7428                    	jz	short bf30
 31841                                  
 31842                                  	;call	isFreeMCB		; Returns with ZF set if owner is 0
 31843 00002E09 26830E010000            	or	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],0
 31844 00002E0F 750C                    	jnz	short bf20
 31845                                  
 31846 00002E11 26A10300                	mov	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 31847                                  	;cmp	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Compare sizes...
 31848 00002E15 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax
 31849                                  	;jg	short bf20		; Unless we're bigger,
 31850                                  	; 19/07/2023
 31851 00002E17 7D04                    	jge	short bf20
 31852                                  
 31853 00002E19 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			; Store this new element's address,
 31854                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; and its size.
 31855 00002E1B 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 31856                                  
 31857                                  bf20:	
 31858                                  	;mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 31859                                  	;cmp	al,arena_signature_end	; 'Z'
 31860                                  	; 19/07/2023
 31861                                  	;cmp	byte [es:0],'Z'
 31862 00002E1D 26803E00005A            	cmp	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_end
 31863 00002E23 740C                    	jz	short bf30		; 'Z' means this was the last MCB.
 31864                                  
 31865                                  	;NextMCB es,ax			; Go on forward.
 31866 00002E25 8CC0                    	mov     ax,es
 31867                                  	;add	ax,[es:3]
 31868 00002E27 2603060300              	add     ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 31869 00002E2C 40                      	inc     ax
 31870 00002E2D 8EC0                    	mov     es,ax
 31871                                  
 31872 00002E2F EBD3                    	jmp	short bf10
 31873                                  
 31874 00002E31 8EC3                    bf30:	mov	es,bx			; Return the address
 31875 00002E33 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx			; Return the size
 31876 00002E35 09DB                    	or	bx,bx
 31877 00002E37 7501                    	jnz	short bfX		; (if size==0, there's nothing free)
 31878                                  bfE:	
 31879 00002E39 F9                      	stc
 31880                                  bfX:
 31881 00002E3A 59                      	pop	cx
 31882                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31883                                  	;pop	bx
 31884 00002E3B C3                      	retn
 31885                                  
 31886                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31887                                  ;*** isSpecified - sets ZF if UMB in AL wasn't specified in DH/LH line.
 31888                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31889                                  ; ENTRY:    AL should be to a valid UMB number
 31890                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set if UMB wasn't specified, ZF clear if it was
 31891                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31892                                  ; USES:     Flags
 31893                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31894                                  
 31895                                  	; 02/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31896                                  
 31897                                  isSpecified:
 31898                                  	; 02/01/2023
 31899                                  	;push	ax
 31900                                  
 31901 00002E3C 30FF                    	xor	bh,bh
 31902 00002E3E 88C3                    	mov	bl,al
 31903                                  
 31904                                  	;getdata al,DS:UmbUsed[bx]
 31905                                  	;
 31906                                  	;push	ds
 31907                                  	;push	cs
 31908                                  	;pop	ds
 31909                                  	;mov	al,[bx+UmbUsed]
 31910                                  	;pop	ds
 31911                                  	
 31912                                  	;mov	al,[cs:bx+UmbUsed]
 31913                                  	; 02/01/2023
 31914                                  	; ds = cs
 31915 00002E40 8A87[7C1F]              	mov	al,[bx+UmbUsed]
 31916                                  
 31917 00002E44 08C0                    	or	al,al			; Sets ZF if al==0 (ie, if unspecified)
 31918                                  
 31919                                  	; 02/01/2023
 31920 00002E46 58                      	pop	ax
 31921 00002E47 C3                      	retn
 31922                                  
 31923                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31924                                  ;*** shrinkMCB - breaks an MCB into two pieces, the lowest one's size==AX
 31925                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31926                                  ; ENTRY:    AX == new size, ES:0 == current MCB
 31927                                  ; EXIT:     None; MCB broken if carry clear
 31928                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if MCB isn't as large as AX+0x20 (not a useful split)
 31929                                  ; USES:     Flags
 31930                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31931                                  ; If the size of the to-be-split MCB isn't at least 0x20 bytes greater than
 31932                                  ; the specified new size, the split is useless; if it's only 0x10 bytes, that
 31933                                  ; 0x10 will be used to make a header that mentions a 0-byte free space, and
 31934                                  ; that just sucks up 0x10 bytes for nothing. So we make 0x20 bytes the
 31935                                  ; minimum for performing a split.
 31936                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31937                                  
 31938                                  MIN_SPLIT_SIZE	equ	20h
 31939                                  
 31940                                  	; 02/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31941                                  
 31942                                  shrinkMCB:
 31943                                  	;pushreg <bx,cx,es>
 31944                                  	; 02/01/2023
 31945                                  	;push	bx
 31946 00002E48 51                      	push	cx
 31947 00002E49 06                      	push	es
 31948                                  
 31949 00002E4A 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax			; Move things around... and
 31950                                  	; 02/01/2023
 31951                                  	;mov	ax,es			; save this one for later.
 31952                                  
 31953 00002E4C 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 31954                                  	; 02/01/2023
 31955 00002E51 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx 
 31956                                  
 31957 00002E53 83E820                  	sub	ax,MIN_SPLIT_SIZE ; 32
 31958                                  	;sub	cx,MIN_SPLIT_SIZE ; 32
 31959                                  	;;cmp	bx,cx			; {New size} vs {Current Size-20h}
 31960                                  	;ja	short smE		; if wanted_size > cur-20h, abort.
 31961                                  	; 18/12/2022
 31962                                  	;cmp	cx,bx
 31963                                  	; 02/01/2023
 31964 00002E56 39D8                    	cmp	ax,bx
 31965 00002E58 7228                    	jb	short smE ; (*)
 31966                                  
 31967 00002E5A 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 31968                                  	
 31969                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 31970                                  	; 02/01/2023
 31971 00002E5F 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 31972                                  
 31973 00002E61 26891E0300              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx
 31974 00002E66 26C60600004D            	mov	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],'M'
 31975                                  
 31976 00002E6C 01D8                    	add	ax,bx
 31977 00002E6E 40                      	inc	ax
 31978 00002E6F 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; Move to new arena area
 31979                                  
 31980 00002E71 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx
 31981 00002E73 29D8                    	sub	ax,bx
 31982                                  	; 12/12/2022
 31983                                  	; ax > 0
 31984 00002E75 48                      	dec	ax			; And prepare the new size
 31985                                  
 31986                                  	; 18/12/2022
 31987 00002E76 2688160000              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl
 31988                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],0 ; (**)
 31989 00002E7B 26A30300                	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],ax
 31990                                  	;mov	ax,'  ' ; 2020h
 31991                                  	;mov	[es:ARENA.NAME+0],ax ; (**)
 31992                                  	;mov	[es:ARENA.NAME+2],ax ; (**)
 31993                                  	;mov	[es:ARENA.NAME+4],ax ; (**)
 31994                                  	;mov	[es:ARENA.NAME+6],ax ; (**)
 31995                                  
 31996                                  	; 18/12/2022
 31997 00002E7F E8A401                  	call	freeMCB	; (**)
 31998                                  
 31999                                  	; 12/12/2022
 32000                                  	; cf=0
 32001                                  	;clc
 32002                                  	; 18/12/2022
 32003                                  	;jmp	short smX
 32004                                  smE:	
 32005                                  	; 18/12/2022
 32006                                  	; cf=1 (*)
 32007                                  	;stc
 32008                                  smX:	
 32009                                  	;popreg	<es,cx,bx>
 32010 00002E82 07                      	pop	es
 32011 00002E83 59                      	pop	cx
 32012                                  	; 02/01/2023
 32013                                  	;pop	bx
 32014 00002E84 C3                      	retn
 32015                                  
 32016                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32017                                  ;*** hideUMB? - hides as appropriate the UMB in CL
 32018                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32019                                  ; ENTRY:    CL should be to a valid UMB number, and AX to its address (findUMB)
 32020                                  ; EXIT:     None; UMB is hidden as necessary
 32021                                  ; ERROR:    None
 32022                                  ; USES:     Flags, AX, CX
 32023                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32024                                  ; PRIMARY LOGIC:
 32025                                  ;
 32026                                  ; If the UMB is specified in the DH/LH statement, then:
 32027                                  ;    If the largest free segment is too small (check specified size), then:
 32028                                  ;       Pretend it wasn't ever specified, and fall out of this IF.
 32029                                  ;    Else, if largest free segment is LARGER than specified size, then:
 32030                                  ;       If /S was given on the command-line, then:
 32031                                  ;          Break that element into two pieces
 32032                                  ;          Set a flag that we're shrinking
 32033                                  ;       Endif
 32034                                  ;    Endif
 32035                                  ; Endif
 32036                                  ; If the UMB is NOT specified (or was removed by the above):
 32037                                  ;    Hide all free elements in the UMB
 32038                                  ;    If the flag that we're shrinking was set, then:
 32039                                  ;       UN-hide the lower portion of the shrunken UMB
 32040                                  ;    ENDIF
 32041                                  ; ENDIF
 32042                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32043                                  
 32044                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 32045                                  	; (SYSINIT:3426h)
 32046                                  _hideUMB_:
 32047                                  	; 02/01/2023
 32048                                  	; ds = cs
 32049                                  
 32050                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32051                                  	;push	bx
 32052                                  	;push	dx
 32053 00002E85 06                      	push	es
 32054                                  
 32055 00002E86 88C8                    	mov	al,cl
 32056 00002E88 E8B1FF                  	call	isSpecified	; Returns ZF set if al's umb was NOT specified
 32057 00002E8B 742D                    	jz	short hu_20
 32058                                  
 32059 00002E8D 88C8                    	mov	al,cl		; Retrieve the size of the largest
 32060 00002E8F E868FF                  	call	BigFree		; free element in AX; put its address in ES
 32061 00002E92 7226                    	jc	short hu_20	; Oops. Errors mean skip this part.
 32062                                  
 32063 00002E94 50                      	push	ax		; TOS==size of BigFree in UMB (popped as BX)
 32064 00002E95 88C8                    	mov	al,cl		; Retrieve the user's specified
 32065 00002E97 E8B0FE                  	call	GetSize		; minimum size for this umb (into AX)
 32066 00002E9A 5B                      	pop	bx		; Now BX==BigFree, AX==Specified Size
 32067                                  
 32068 00002E9B 09C0                    	or	ax,ax		; If they didn't specify one,
 32069 00002E9D 741B                    	jz	short hu_20	; Skip over all this.
 32070                                  
 32071 00002E9F 39D8                    	cmp	ax,bx		; Ah... if (specified > max free)
 32072 00002EA1 7607                    	jbe	short hu_10
 32073                                  
 32074 00002EA3 88C8                    	mov	al,cl		;  Then mark that UMB as unused. Nya nya.
 32075 00002EA5 E814FD                  	call	unMarkUMB
 32076 00002EA8 EB10                    	jmp	short hu_20
 32077                                  hu_10:	
 32078                                  	;call	isTiny		; Returns ZF clear if user specified /S
 32079                                  	;jz	short hu_20
 32080                                  	; 02/01/2023
 32081                                  ;isTiny:
 32082                                  	;mov	al,[fUmbTiny] ; ds = cs
 32083                                  	;or	al,al
 32084 00002EAA 800E[781F]00            	or	byte [fUmbTiny],0
 32085 00002EAF 7409                    	jz	short hu_20
 32086                                  
 32087 00002EB1 E894FF                  	call	shrinkMCB	; They specified /S, so shrink the MCB to AX
 32088 00002EB4 7204                    	jc	short hu_20	; Ah... if didn't shrink after all, skip this:
 32089                                  
 32090 00002EB6 8CC2                    	mov	dx,es
 32091 00002EB8 EB09                    	jmp	short hu_30	; Skip the spec check.. we wanna hide this one.
 32092                                  
 32093 00002EBA 89C8                    hu_20:	mov	ax,cx
 32094 00002EBC E87DFF                  	call	isSpecified	; If they specified this UMB, we're done...
 32095 00002EBF 7510                    	jnz	short hu_X	; so leave.
 32096                                  
 32097 00002EC1 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 32098                                  hu_30:	
 32099 00002EC3 88C8                    	mov	al,cl
 32100                                  
 32101 00002EC5 E89CFE                  	call	hideUMB		; Hides everything in UMB #al
 32102                                  
 32103 00002EC8 09D2                    	or	dx,dx		; Did we shrink a UMB? If not, DX==0,
 32104 00002ECA 7405                    	jz	short hu_X	; So we should leave.
 32105                                  
 32106 00002ECC 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx		; Ah, but if it isn't, DX==the MCB's address;
 32107 00002ECE E8E5FE                  	call	unHideMCB	; Un-hides the lower portion of that MCB.
 32108                                  hu_X:	
 32109 00002ED1 07                      	pop	es
 32110                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32111                                  	;pop	dx
 32112                                  	;pop	bx
 32113 00002ED2 C3                      	retn
 32114                                  
 32115                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32116                                  ;*** UnFreeze - Marks FROZEN elements as FREE
 32117                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32118                                  ; Entry:  None
 32119                                  ; Exit:   None; all 8+FROZEN elements are marked as FREE, from any UMB.
 32120                                  ; Error:  None
 32121                                  ; Uses:   Flags
 32122                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32123                                  
 32124                                  	; 03/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 32125                                  UnFreeze:
 32126                                  	; 03/01/2023
 32127                                  	;push	ax
 32128 00002ED3 06                      	push	es
 32129                                  
 32130 00002ED4 E8D8FD                  	call	UmbHead		; Returns with carry if err, else ES == MCB
 32131 00002ED7 721A                    	jc	short ufX
 32132                                  
 32133                                  	; 22/07/2023
 32134                                  uf10:
 32135 00002ED9 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax ; *
 32136                                  
 32137                                  ; ------------------------------
 32138                                  ; UF10--ES - Current MCB address
 32139                                  ; ------------------------------
 32140                                  
 32141                                  ;uf10:	
 32142 00002EDB E81700                  	call	isFrozMCB	; Returns with ZF set if MCB is FROZEN
 32143 00002EDE 7503                    	jnz	short uf20
 32144 00002EE0 E8D3FE                  	call	unHideMCB
 32145                                  uf20:	
 32146                                  	;mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 32147                                  	;cmp	al,arena_signature_end ; 'Z'
 32148                                  	; 22/07/2023
 32149 00002EE3 26803E00005A            	cmp	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_end ; 'Z'
 32150 00002EE9 7408                    	jz	short ufX	; 'Z' means this was the last MCB.. that's it.
 32151                                  
 32152                                  	;NextMCB es,ax		; Go on forward.
 32153                                  	; 22/07/2023
 32154                                  	; ax = es
 32155                                  	;mov	ax,es ; *

 32301                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32302                                  ;*** UmbTest - returns with carry set if UMBs are not available, else CF==false
 32303                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32304                                  ; ENTRY:    None

 32306                                  ; ERROR:    None

 32334                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32335                                  ;*** WalkMem - travels memory chain and returns carry clear iff UMBs are linked
 32336                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32337                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 32338                                  ; EXIT:     Carry SET if MCB chain stops before 9FFF, CLEAR if stops >= 9FFF.
 32339                                  ; ERROR:    None
 32340                                  ; USES:     Flags
 32341                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32342                                  
 32343                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)

 32347                                  	;push	ax ; ?
 32348                                  	;push	bx ; ?

 32350                                  	;push	es ; ? no need to save contents of these registers ?
 32351

 32361                                  ; UM10: ES = Current MCB pointer

 32370

 32383                                  	;mov	es,ax ; **
 32384                                  	
 32385 00002FA2 EBEE                    	jmp	short um10		; And restart the loop.
 32386                                  um20:	
 32387                                  	; 22/07/2023
 32388                                  	; ax = es
 32389                                  	;mov	ax,es
 32390                                  
 32391 00002FA4 3DFF9F                  	cmp	ax,9FFFh		; This sets CF if ax < 9FFF.
 32392                                  
 32393                                  	;pop	es ; ?
 32394                                  	;;pop	ds ; ? ; 01/01/2023 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:353Dh)
 32395                                  	;pop	bx ; ?
 32396                                  	;pop	ax ; ?
 32397                                  	
 32398 00002FA7 C3                      	retn

 32664                                  			; DOS - 2+ internal - GET LIST OF LISTS

 32670

 32672                                  	;jmp	short xhu_x
 32673                                  xhu_e:	
 32674                                  	;stc
 32675 0000304C F5                      	cmc	; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 ; *

 32678                                  	;pop	es

 32684                                  ;*** linkumb - links UMBs not already linked in; updates fm_umb as needed
 32685                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 32714                                  
 32715                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32716                                  ;
 32717                                  ; procedure : InitDevLoad
 32718                                  ;
 32719                                  ;	Input : DeviceHi = 0 indicates load DD in low memory
 32720                                  ;			 = 1 indicates load in UMB:
 32721                                  ;		           ConvLoad = 0 indicates a new-style load (see below)
 32722                                  ;		                    = 1 indicates a DOS 5-style load
 32723                                  ;		DevSize  = Size of the device driver file in paras
 32724                                  ;
 32725                                  ;	Output : none
 32726                                  ;
 32727                                  ;	Initializes DevLoadAddr, DevLoadEnd & DevEntry.
 32728                                  ;	Also sets up a header for the Device driver entry for mem utility
 32729                                  ;
 32730                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32731                                  ; For a "new-style load", we break off the current DevEntry and link the umbs
 32732                                  ; as we see fit, using HideUMBs (and UnHideUMBs at exit, though _it_ decides
 32733                                  ; whether it's entitled to do anything). HideUMBs uses the chart built by
 32734                                  ; ParseVar to determine which UMBs to leave FREE, and which not.
 32735                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32736                                  
 32737                                  	; 01/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 32738                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 32739                                  	; (SYSINIT:364Ah)
 32740                                  InitDevLoad:
 32741                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32742                                  	;push	es ; *
 32743                                  
 32744                                  	; 11/12/2022
 32745                                  	; ds = cs
 32746 00003060 803E[CD1F]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 32747                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Are we loading in UMB ?
 32748                                  	;je	short InitForLo		; no, init for lo mem
 32749 00003065 7439                    	je	short initforlo_x ; 09/04/2019
 32750                                  
 32751                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 32752                                  ; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 32753                                  ; %if 0
 32754                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32755 00003067 803E[BD1F]01            	cmp	byte [ConvLoad],1	; Are we loading as per DOS 5?
 32756                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:ConvLoad],1	; Are we loading as per DOS 5?
 32757 0000306C 7413                    	je	short InitForConv
 32758                                  
 32759                                  ; There are two stages to preparing upper-memory; first, we mark as 8+HIDDEN
 32760                                  ; any areas not specified on the /L:... chain. Second, we mark as 8+FROZEN
 32761                                  ; any areas left in upper-memory, except for elements in the load UMB...
 32762                                  ; we then malloc space as per Dos-5 style, and mark as free any spaces which
 32763                                  ; are 8+FROZEN (but leave 8+HIDDEN still hidden). The load is performed,
 32764                                  ; and UnHideUMBs later on marks all 8+HIDDEN as free.
 32765                                  
 32766 0000306E E86904                  	call	ShrinkUMB		; Stop using the old device arena
 32767                                  
 32768 00003071 E899FC                  	call	HideUMBs		; Mark up the UM area as we see fit
 32769 00003074 E8CDFE                  	call	FreezeUM		; Hide everything BUT the load area
 32770 00003077 E85700                  	call	GetUMBForDev		; And grab that load area as needed
 32771 0000307A 9C                      	pushf
 32772 0000307B E855FE                  	call	UnFreeze		; Then unhide everything frozen
 32773 0000307E 9D                      	popf
 32774                                  	;jc	short InitForLo		; (if carry, it's loading low)
 32775                                  	;jmp	short InitForHi
 32776                                  	; 06/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 32777 0000307F EB0B                    	jmp	short idl0
 32778                                  
 32779                                  ;%endif ; 01/11/2022
 32780                                  
 32781                                  	; 01/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 32782                                  	; (SYSINIT:2B67h)
 32783                                  InitForConv:
 32784                                  	; 11/12/2022
 32785                                  	; ds = cs
 32786 00003081 E83700                  	call	SpaceInUMB		; Do we have space left in the
 32787                                  					;  current UMB ?
 32788 00003084 7308                    	jnc	short InitForHi		; yes, we have
 32789 00003086 E85104                  	call	ShrinkUMB		; shrink the current UMB in use
 32790 00003089 E84500                  	call	GetUMBForDev		; else try to allocate new UMB
 32791                                  idl0: ; 06/07/2023
 32792 0000308C 720D                    	jc	short InitForLo		; we didn't succeed, so load
 32793                                  					;  in low memory
 32794                                  InitForHi:
 32795                                  	; 11/12/2022
 32796                                  	; ds = cs
 32797                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevUMBFree]	; get Para addr of free mem
 32798                                  	;mov	dx,[cs:DevUMBAddr]	; UMB start addr
 32799                                  	;add	dx,[cs:DevUMBSize]	; DX = UMB End addr
 32800 0000308E A1[C31F]                	mov	ax,[DevUMBFree]
 32801 00003091 8B16[BF1F]              	mov	dx,[DevUMBAddr]
 32802 00003095 0316[C11F]              	add	dx,[DevUMBSize]
 32803 00003099 EB0C                    	jmp	short idl1
 32804                                  
 32805                                  InitForLo:
 32806                                  	; 11/12/2022
 32807                                  	; ds = cs
 32808                                  	;mov	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; in case we failed to load
 32809 0000309B C606[CD1F]00            	mov	byte [DeviceHi],0
 32810                                  initforlo_x:
 32811                                  	; 11/12/2022
 32812                                  	; ds = cs
 32813                                  					;  into UMB indicate that
 32814                                  					;  we are loading low
 32815                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:memhi]		; AX = start of Low memory
 32816                                  	;mov	dx,[cs:ALLOCLIM]	; DX = End of Low memory
 32817 000030A0 A1[6403]                	mov	ax,[memhi]
 32818 000030A3 8B16[A502]              	mov	dx,[ALLOCLIM]
 32819                                  idl1:
 32820 000030A7 E86C00                  	call	DevSetMark		; setup a sub-arena for DD
 32821                                  	; 11/12/2022
 32822                                  	; ds = cs
 32823                                  	;mov	[cs:DevLoadAddr],ax	; init the Device load address
 32824                                  	;mov	[cs:DevLoadEnd],dx	; init the limit of the block
 32825                                  	;mov	word [cs:DevEntry],0	; init Entry point to DD
 32826                                  	;mov	[cs:DevEntry+2],ax
 32827 000030AA A3[B11F]                	mov	[DevLoadAddr],ax
 32828 000030AD 8916[B31F]              	mov	[DevLoadEnd],dx
 32829 000030B1 C706[B51F]0000          	mov	word [DevEntry],0
 32830 000030B7 A3[B71F]                	mov	[DevEntry+2],ax
 32831                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32832                                  	;pop	es ; *
 32833 000030BA C3                      	retn
 32834                                  
 32835                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32836                                  ;
 32837                                  ; procedure : SpaceInUMB?
 32838                                  ;
 32839                                  ;	Input : DevUMBAddr, DevUMBSize, DevUMBFree & DevSize
 32840                                  ;	Output : Carry set if no space in UMB
 32841                                  ;		 Carry clear if Space is available for the device in
 32842                                  ;		   current UMB
 32843                                  ;
 32844                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32845                                  
 32846                                  SpaceInUMB:
 32847                                  	; 11/12/2022
 32848                                  	; ds = cs
 32849                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevUMBSize]
 32850                                  	;add	ax,[cs:DevUMBAddr]	; End of UMB
 32851                                  	;sub	ax,[cs:DevUMBFree]	; - Free = Remaining space
 32852 000030BB A1[C11F]                	mov	ax,[DevUMBSize]
 32853 000030BE 0306[BF1F]              	add	ax,[DevUMBAddr]		; End of UMB
 32854 000030C2 2B06[C31F]              	sub	ax,[DevUMBFree]		; - Free = Remaining space
 32855                                  	; 11/12/2022
 32856                                  	;or	ax,ax			; Nospace ?
 32857                                  	;jnz	short spcinumb1
 32858                                  	;stc
 32859                                  	;retn
 32860                                  	; 11/12/2022
 32861 000030C6 83F801                  	cmp	ax,1
 32862 000030C9 7205                    	jb	short spcinumb2	; cf=1
 32863                                  spcinumb1:
 32864 000030CB 48                      	dec	ax			; space for sub-arena
 32865                                  	; 11/12/2022
 32866                                  	; ds = cs
 32867 000030CC 3B06[AF1F]              	cmp	ax,[DevSize]
 32868                                  	;cmp	ax,[cs:DevSize]		; do we have space ?
 32869                                  spcinumb2:
 32870 000030D0 C3                      	retn
 32871                                  
 32872                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32873                                  ;
 32874                                  ; procedure : PrepareMark
 32875                                  ;
 32876                                  ;	Input : AX==Address of MCB (not addr of free space), BX==Size
 32877                                  ;	Output : None; MCB marked appropriately and DevUMB* set as needed.
 32878                                  ;
 32879                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32880                                  
 32881                                  ;	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 32882                                  ;
 32883                                  ;PrepareMark:
 32884                                  ;	push	ds
 32885                                  ;	mov	ds,ax
 32886                                  ;	mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],8
 32887                                  ;	mov	word [ARENA.NAME],'SD' ; 4453h
 32888                                  ;	pop	ds
 32889                                  ;
 32890                                  ;	inc	ax
 32891                                  ;	mov	[cs:DevUMBAddr],ax
 32892                                  ;	mov	[cs:DevUMBFree],ax
 32893                                  ;	mov	[cs:DevUMBSize],bx	; update the UMB Variables
 32894                                  ;	retn
 32895                                  
 32896                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32897                                  ;
 32898                                  ; procedure : GetUMBForDev
 32899                                  ;
 32900                                  ;	Input : DevSize
 32901                                  ;	Output : Carry set if couldn't allocate a UMB to fit the
 32902                                  ;		 the device.
 32903                                  ;		 If success carry clear
 32904                                  ;
 32905                                  ;	Allocates the biggest UMB for loading devices and updates
 32906                                  ;	DevUMBSize, DevUMBAddr & DevUMBFree if it succeeded in allocating
 32907                                  ;	UMB.
 32908                                  ;
 32909                                  ;	This routine relies on the fact that all of the low memory
 32910                                  ;	is allocated, and any DOS alloc calls should return memory
 32911                                  ;	from the UMB pool.
 32912                                  ;
 32913                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32914                                  
 32915                                  	; 01/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 32916                                  	; (SYSINIT:2BC6h)
 32917                                  
 32918                                  GetUMBForDev:
 32919                                  	; 11/12/2022
 32920                                  	; ds = cs
 32921 000030D1 BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh
 32922 000030D4 B80048                  	mov	ax,4800h
 32923 000030D7 CD21                    	int	21h
 32924                                  		; DOS - 2+ - ALLOCATE MEMORY
 32925                                  		; BX = number of 16-byte paragraphs desired
 32926                                  
 32927 000030D9 09DB                    	or	bx,bx
 32928 000030DB 742C                    	jz	short gufd_err
 32929                                  
 32930 000030DD 4B                      	dec	bx
 32931                                  	; 11/12/2022
 32932                                  	; ds = cs
 32933 000030DE 391E[AF1F]              	cmp	[DevSize],bx
 32934                                  	;cmp	[cs:DevSize],bx
 32935 000030E2 7725                    	ja	short gufd_err
 32936 000030E4 43                      	inc	bx
 32937                                  
 32938 000030E5 B80048                  	mov	ax,4800h
 32939 000030E8 CD21                    	int	21h
 32940 000030EA 721D                    	jc	short gufd_err
 32941                                  
 32942                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 32943                                  	;dec	ax
 32944                                  	;call	PrepareMark
 32945                                  	;
 32946                                  PrepareMark:
 32947 000030EC 1E                      	push	ds
 32948 000030ED 48                      	dec	ax
 32949 000030EE 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 32950 000030F0 C70601000800            	mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],8
 32951 000030F6 C70608005344            	mov	word [ARENA.NAME],'SD' ; 4453h
 32952 000030FC 40                      	inc	ax
 32953 000030FD 1F                      	pop	ds
 32954                                  	; 11/12/2022
 32955                                  	; ds = cs
 32956                                  	;mov	[cs:DevUMBSize],bx	; update the UMB Variables
 32957                                  	;mov	[cs:DevUMBAddr],ax
 32958                                  	;mov	[cs:DevUMBFree],ax
 32959 000030FE 891E[C11F]              	mov	[DevUMBSize],bx		; update the UMB Variables
 32960 00003102 A3[BF1F]                	mov	[DevUMBAddr],ax
 32961 00003105 A3[C31F]                	mov	[DevUMBFree],ax
 32962                                  	;
 32963                                  	; 11/12/2022
 32964                                  	; cf=0
 32965                                  	;clc				; mark no error
 32966 00003108 C3                      	retn
 32967                                  gufd_err:
 32968 00003109 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax ; 0
 32969                                  	; 11/12/2022
 32970                                  	; ds = cs
 32971                                  	;mov	[cs:DevUMBSize],ax	; erase the previous values
 32972                                  	;mov	[cs:DevUMBAddr],ax
 32973                                  	;mov	[cs:DevUMBFree],ax
 32974 0000310B A3[C11F]                	mov	[DevUMBSize],ax		; erase the previous values
 32975 0000310E A3[BF1F]                	mov	[DevUMBAddr],ax
 32976 00003111 A3[C31F]                	mov	[DevUMBFree],ax
 32977 00003114 F9                      	stc
 32978 00003115 C3                      	retn
